name: Were

name: abusing
trans: n./vt. 滥用;虐待;辱骂

example: He was abusing Big Brother, he was denouncing the dictatorship of the Party, he was demanding the immediate conclusion of peace with Eurasia, he was advocating freedom of speech, freedom of the Press, freedom of assembly, freedom of thought, he was crying hysterically that the revolution had been betrayed--and all this in rapid polysyllabic speech which was a sort of parody of the habitual style of the orators of the Party, and even contained Newspeak words: more Newspeak words, indeed, than any Party member would normally use in real life.

name: orators
trans: n. 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家

name: lest
trans: conj. 惟恐，免得
example: And all the while, lest one should be in any doubt as to the reality which Goldstein's specious claptrap covered, behind his head on the telescreen there marched the endless columns of the Eurasian army--row after row of solid-looking men with expressionless Asiatic faces, who swam up to the surface of the screen and vanished, to be replaced by others exactly similar.

name: strange

name: saboteurs

example: To know and not to know, to be conscious of complete truthfulness while telling carefully constructed lies, to hold simultaneously two opinions which cancelled out, knowing them to be contradictory and believing in both of them, to use logic against logic, to repudiate morality while laying claim to it, to believe that democracy was impossible and that the Party was the guardian of democracy, to forget whatever it was necessary to forget, then to draw it back into memory again at the moment when it was needed, and then promptly to forget it again: and above all, to apply the same process to the process itself.

name: February

name: speakwritten

name: rewriting
trans: vt.重写，再生

name: sixty
trans: num.六十，六十个

name: nearer
trans: a. 近的，接近的；亲近的prep. 靠近ad. 接近

name: Very
trans: ad. 很，非常；完全a. 正是的；真正，真实的
example: Very likely no boots had been produced at all.

name: Likelier
example: Likelier still, nobody knew how many had been produced, much less cared.

name: cared
trans: n. 汽车，车辆，车；(火车)车厢

name: astronomical
trans: adj.天文学的
example: All one knew was that every quarter astronomical numbers of boots were produced on paper, while perhaps half the population of Oceania went barefoot.

trans: n. 人口，(全体)居民

name: shadow
trans: n. 阴影，影子，荫；暗处，阴暗

name: Foodstuffs
trans: n.食品
example: Foodstuffs----' The phrase 'our new, happy life' recurred several times.

name: favourite

n. 特别喜爱的人(或物)竞赛中被认为会获胜的马、竞争者等

trans: adj.口的,张口的,敞口的,多洞穴的v.目瞪口呆地凝视( gape的现在分词 ),张开，张大

name: solemnity
trans: 庄严，严肃

trans: n. 原因；事业，事件，奋斗目标v. 使产生，引起

name: satisfaction
trans: n. 满足，满意；乐事，愉快

name: lugged
trans: 费力搬运

name: charred
trans: v.把…烧成炭( char的过去式),烧焦

name: fill
trans: v. (with)填满，充满

name: top
trans: n. 顶，顶端；首位；顶点a. 最高的；顶上的
example: With the tobacco ration at 100 grammes a week it was seldom possible to fill a pipe to the top.

name: smoking
trans: n.抽烟
example: Winston was smoking a Victory Cigarette which he held carefully horizontal.

name: Cigarette
trans: n. 香烟，纸烟，卷烟
example: Winston was smoking a Victory Cigarette which he held carefully horizontal.

name: horizontal
trans: a. 地平线的；水平的

name: tomorrow
trans: n. 明天；来日，未来ad. 在明天，在明日
example: The new ration did not start till tomorrow and he had only four cigarettes left.

name: remoter
trans: a. 远的，遥远的，疏远的，偏僻的，细微的

name: noises
trans: n. 喧闹声，噪声，吵嚷声

name: thank
trans: vt. 感谢int.谢谢n.感谢(意)

name: announced
trans: v. 正式宣布；发表；通告；广播(电台节目)
example: And only yesterday, he reflected, it had been announced that the ration was to be REDUCED to twenty grammes a week.

name: REDUCED
trans: adj.减少的，简化的v.换算( reduce的过去式和过去分词 ),约束,使变为,使变弱
example: And only yesterday, he reflected, it had been announced that the ration was to be REDUCED to twenty grammes a week.

name: Was
trans: Was is the past tense of the verb "to be," which is used to indicate the existence or identity of something or someone in the past.
example: Was it possible that they could swallow that, after only twenty-four hours?

name: swallow
trans: vt. 吞,咽;轻信,轻易接受;承受,使不流露
example: Was it possible that they could swallow that, after only twenty-four hours?

name: swallowed
trans: vt. 吞,咽;轻信,轻易接受;承受,使不流露
example: Yes, they swallowed it.

name: stupidity
trans: n.愚蠢
example: Parsons swallowed it easily, with the stupidity of an animal.

name: fanatically
trans: adj.狂热的,入迷的,狂信的n.狂热宗教徒,狂信者,入迷的人
example: The eyeless creature at the other table swallowed it fanatically, passionately, with a furious desire to track down, denounce, and vaporize anyone who should suggest that last week the ration had been thirty grammes.

name: innumerable

name: accurately

example: Even if the legendary Brotherhood existed, as just possibly it might, it was inconceivable that its members could ever assemble in larger numbers than twos and threes.

name: assemble
trans: v. 聚集;装配
example: Even if the legendary Brotherhood existed, as just possibly it might, it was inconceivable that its members could ever assemble in larger numbers than twos and threes.

name: twos
trans: num. 二，两个n. 两个(人或物)
example: Even if the legendary Brotherhood existed, as just possibly it might, it was inconceivable that its members could ever assemble in larger numbers than twos and threes.

name: threes
trans: num. 三pron./a. 三(个，只…)
example: Even if the legendary Brotherhood existed, as just possibly it might, it was inconceivable that its members could ever assemble in larger numbers than twos and threes.

name: Rebellion
trans: n. 叛乱，反抗，起义
example: Rebellion meant a look in the eyes, an inflexion of the voice, at the most, an occasional whispered word.

name: inflexion
example: Rebellion meant a look in the eyes, an inflexion of the voice, at the most, an occasional whispered word.

name: occasional
trans: a. 偶然的，非经常的，特殊场合的；临时的

name: strength
trans: n. 力，力量；实力；长处，优点；人力；兵力
example: But the proles, if only they could somehow become conscious of their own strength.

name: conspire
trans: vi. 共谋；协力
vt.  密谋策划
example: would have no need to conspire.

name: rise
trans: v. 升起；起立；上涨；起义n. 上涨，增高；起源

name: flies
trans: n. 苍蝇（fly的复数）；舞台上空，吊景区；裤子前面的开口
v. 飞行；时间飞逝；乘飞机；飘动（fly的第三人称单数）
example: They needed only to rise up and shake themselves like a horse shaking off flies.

name: chose
trans: v. 选择，挑选；甘愿

name: tomorrow
trans: n. 明天；来日，未来ad. 在明天，在明日

name: Surely
trans: a.确实；稳当地

name: occur
trans: vi. 发生;想起,想到;存在

name: yet
trans: ad. 还，尚，仍然；已经conj. 然而ad. 甚至
example: And yet----!

name: tremendous
trans: a. 极大的,巨大的;非常的,极好的

name: cry
trans: vi. 哭,流泪v. 叫,喊n. 哭泣,哭声,叫喊,喊声

trans: n. 愤怒，气愤vt. 使发怒，激怒vi. 发怒

name: despair
trans: n./vi. 绝望,丧失信心

trans: adj. 发嗡嗡声的；精力旺盛的

name: reverberation
trans: n. 回声；回响【搭配】reverberate vi. 回响
example: ' that went humming on like the reverberation of a bell.

name: bell
trans: n. 钟，铃

name: leapt
example: His heart had leapt.

name: started
trans: v. 开始；动身；吃惊；开办，开动n. 开端；惊起

name: thought
trans: n. 思想，思考，思维；意图，打算；想法

name: riot

trans: n. 斑点；地点v. 认出，认清，发现；玷污，弄脏

trans: n. 大批,大群,众多

name: stalls
trans: n. 分隔栏;售货摊;前排座位,畜栏,厩

trans: n.贩卖，出售v.卖，售，销( sell的现在分词 ),经销,推销,出卖

trans: n. 罐头；锡a. 锡制的vt. 镀锡于

trans: 炖锅；深平底锅

name: flimsy
trans: adj.易坏的, 脆弱的, 浅薄的, 没有价值的, 不足信的, (人)浮夸的。n.薄纸, 描图用薄纸, 薄纸稿纸。

name: unexpectedly
trans: ad
v. 未料到地,意外地

trans: v./n. 撞击;颠簸地行驶;凹凸不平;ad. 猛烈地

trans: 推挤，撞；争夺
推撞，挤拥

trans: n. 分隔栏;售货摊;前排座位,畜栏,厩

trans: adj.发胀的,浮肿的,傲慢的v.使膨胀，使肿胀( bloat的过去式和过去分词),用盐腌

trans: 炖锅；深平底锅

trans: vt./vi. 用力拉,猛拉,拖拉

name: disgustedly
trans: adj. 厌恶的, 厌烦的副 词:disgustedly
example: Winston watched them disgustedly.

name: throats
trans: n. 咽喉,嗓子

name: shout
trans: v. 大声叫，喊，呼出n. 呼喊，叫

name: Until
trans: conj./prep. 直到…为止，在…以前；直到…

name: transcription
trans: n. 抄写；抄本；誊写

trans: n. 奴役，束缚；施虐性行为

name: hideously
trans: adj.骇人听闻的

trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，信念

name: necessary

name: breed
trans: v. 繁殖,生育;教养;引起;n. 品种,类型

name: importance
trans: n. 重要，重要性

trans: n. 左面，左方a. 左边的，左面的；在左方的

name: gutters
trans: n.沟，边沟；檐槽

trans: num. 十二pron./a. 十二(个，只…)

example: The ideal set up by the Party was something huge, terrible, and glittering--a world of steel and concrete, of monstrous machines and terrifying weapons--a nation of warriors and fanatics, marching forward in perfect unity, all thinking the same thoughts and shouting the same slogans, perpetually working, fighting, triumphing, persecuting--three hundred million people all with the same face.

name: perpetually
trans: adv.永恒地,终身地,不断地
example: The ideal set up by the Party was something huge, terrible, and glittering--a world of steel and concrete, of monstrous machines and terrifying weapons--a nation of warriors and fanatics, marching forward in perfect unity, all thinking the same thoughts and shouting the same slogans, perpetually working, fighting, triumphing, persecuting--three hundred million people all with the same face.

name: triumphing
trans: n. 凯旋,成功
example: The ideal set up by the Party was something huge, terrible, and glittering--a world of steel and concrete, of monstrous machines and terrifying weapons--a nation of warriors and fanatics, marching forward in perfect unity, all thinking the same thoughts and shouting the same slogans, perpetually working, fighting, triumphing, persecuting--three hundred million people all with the same face.

name: persecuting
trans: vt. (尤指因宗教或政治信仰不同)迫害;烦扰
example: The ideal set up by the Party was something huge, terrible, and glittering--a world of steel and concrete, of monstrous machines and terrifying weapons--a nation of warriors and fanatics, marching forward in perfect unity, all thinking the same thoughts and shouting the same slogans, perpetually working, fighting, triumphing, persecuting--three hundred million people all with the same face.

name: decaying
trans: v.（使）腐烂，腐朽( decay的现在分词 ),衰败，衰退，衰落
example: The reality was decaying, dingy cities where underfed people shuffled to and fro in leaky shoes, in patched-up nineteenth-century houses that smelt always of cabbage and bad lavatories.

name: cities
trans: n. 城市（city的复数）
example: The reality was decaying, dingy cities where underfed people shuffled to and fro in leaky shoes, in patched-up nineteenth-century houses that smelt always of cabbage and bad lavatories.

name: underfed
trans: prep. 在…下面在…以下ad. 在下面；少于
example: The reality was decaying, dingy cities where underfed people shuffled to and fro in leaky shoes, in patched-up nineteenth-century houses that smelt always of cabbage and bad lavatories.

name: shuffled
trans: v.拖脚走,洗澡
example: The reality was decaying, dingy cities where underfed people shuffled to and fro in leaky shoes, in patched-up nineteenth-century houses that smelt always of cabbage and bad lavatories.

name: leaky
trans: adj.有漏洞的，有漏隙的，渗漏的
example: The reality was decaying, dingy cities where underfed people shuffled to and fro in leaky shoes, in patched-up nineteenth-century houses that smelt always of cabbage and bad lavatories.

name: lavatories
example: The reality was decaying, dingy cities where underfed people shuffled to and fro in leaky shoes, in patched-up nineteenth-century houses that smelt always of cabbage and bad lavatories.

name: ruinous
trans: a. 毁灭性的,破坏性的
example: He seemed to see a vision of London, vast and ruinous, city of a million dustbins, and mixed up with it was a picture of Mrs Parsons, a woman with lined face and wispy hair, fiddling helplessly with a blocked waste-pipe.

name: dustbins
trans: n.簸箕
example: He seemed to see a vision of London, vast and ruinous, city of a million dustbins, and mixed up with it was a picture of Mrs Parsons, a woman with lined face and wispy hair, fiddling helplessly with a blocked waste-pipe.

name: scratched
trans: n. 抓痕,擦伤;vt. 抓,搔,挠
example: He reached down and scratched his ankle again.

name: bruised
trans: 医青肿的，瘀紫的
example: Day and night the telescreens bruised your ears with statistics proving that people today had more food, more clothes, better houses, better recreations--that they lived longer, worked shorter hours, were bigger, healthier, stronger, happier, more intelligent, better educated, than the people of fifty years ago.

name: proving
trans: v. 证明，证实；检验；考验；鉴定；结果是，表明是
example: Day and night the telescreens bruised your ears with statistics proving that people today had more food, more clothes, better houses, better recreations--that they lived longer, worked shorter hours, were bigger, healthier, stronger, happier, more intelligent, better educated, than the people of fifty years ago.

name: healthier
trans: n. 健康，健康状况；卫生
example: Day and night the telescreens bruised your ears with statistics proving that people today had more food, more clothes, better houses, better recreations--that they lived longer, worked shorter hours, were bigger, healthier, stronger, happier, more intelligent, better educated, than the people of fifty years ago.

name: happier
example: Day and night the telescreens bruised your ears with statistics proving that people today had more food, more clothes, better houses, better recreations--that they lived longer, worked shorter hours, were bigger, healthier, stronger, happier, more intelligent, better educated, than the people of fifty years ago.

name: educated
trans: adj. 有教养的；受过教育的
v. 教导；训练；培育（educate的过去分词形式）
example: Day and night the telescreens bruised your ears with statistics proving that people today had more food, more clothes, better houses, better recreations--that they lived longer, worked shorter hours, were bigger, healthier, stronger, happier, more intelligent, better educated, than the people of fifty years ago.

name: proved
trans: v. 证明，证实；检验；考验；鉴定；结果是，表明是
example: Not a word of it could ever be proved or disproved.

name: disproved
trans: v.反驳, 驳斥, 证明...为误。
example: Not a word of it could ever be proved or disproved.

name: adult
trans: n. 成年人a. 成年的，充分长成的，成熟的
example: The Party claimed, for example, that today 40 per cent of adult proles were literate: before the Revolution, it was said, the number had only been 15 per cent.

name: literate
trans: n.有文化的
example: The Party claimed, for example, that today 40 per cent of adult proles were literate: before the Revolution, it was said, the number had only been 15 per cent.

name: infant
trans: n. 婴儿
example: The Party claimed that the infant mortality rate was now only 160 per thousand, whereas before the Revolution it had been 300--and so it went on.

name: mortality
trans: n. 死亡数，死亡率；必死性，必死的命运
example: The Party claimed that the infant mortality rate was now only 160 per thousand, whereas before the Revolution it had been 300--and so it went on.

name: whereas
trans: conj. 鉴于;反之
example: The Party claimed that the infant mortality rate was now only 160 per thousand, whereas before the Revolution it had been 300--and so it went on.

name: equation
trans: n. (数学)等式，方程式；(with)相等；均衡
example: It was like a single equation with two unknowns.

name: unknowns
trans: a.不知道的；未知的
example: It was like a single equation with two unknowns.

name: fantasy
trans: n.幻想, 白日梦。
example: It might very well be that literally every word in the history books, even the things that one accepted without question, was pure fantasy.

name: garment
trans: n. (一件)衣服(长袍、外套)
example: For all he knew there might never have been any such law as the JUS PRIMAE NOCTIS, or any such creature as a capitalist, or any such garment as a top hat.

name: mist
trans: n. 薄雾;朦胧
example: Everything faded into mist.

name: erased
trans: vt. 擦掉,抹掉
example: The past was erased, the erasure was forgotten, the lie became truth.

name: erasure
trans: n.抹去
example: The past was erased, the erasure was forgotten, the lie became truth.

name: possessed
trans: adj. 着魔的；冷静的；拥有的
example: Just once in his life he had possessed--AFTER the event: that was what counted--concrete, unmistakable evidence of an act of falsification.

name: AFTER
trans: prep. 在…以后；在…后面adv. 以后，后来
example: Just once in his life he had possessed--AFTER the event: that was what counted--concrete, unmistakable evidence of an act of falsification.

name: counted
trans: v. 数，计算；算入；看作，认为n. 计数，总数
example: Just once in his life he had possessed--AFTER the event: that was what counted--concrete, unmistakable evidence of an act of falsification.

name: held
trans: v. 拿着；保有；托住；举行；继续n. 握住；船舱
example: He had held it between his fingers for as long as thirty seconds.

name: parted
trans: n. 部分，角色，一方，零件，地区，部，篇v. 使分开
example: In 1973, it must have been--at any rate, it was at about the time when he and Katharine had parted.

name: relevant
trans: a. 有关的,切题的,中肯的
example: But the really relevant date was seven or eight years earlier.

name: eight
trans: num. 八pron. 八(个，只…)
example: But the really relevant date was seven or eight years earlier.

name: leaders
trans: n.领袖，领导人；首领
example: The story really began in the middle sixties, the period of the great purges in which the original leaders of the Revolution were wiped out once and for all.

name: none
trans: pron. 没有任何人(东西)；都不ad. 一点也不
example: By 1970 none of them was left, except Big Brother himself.

name: exposed
trans: adj.裸露的，暴露的v.揭露,暴露
example: All the rest had by that time been exposed as traitors and counter-revolutionaries.

name: revolutionaries
example: All the rest had by that time been exposed as traitors and counter-revolutionaries.

name: fled
example: Goldstein had fled and was hiding no one knew where, and of the others, a few had simply disappeared, while the majority had been executed after spectacular public trials at which they made confession of their crimes.

name: spectacular
trans: a. 壮观的
example: Goldstein had fled and was hiding no one knew where, and of the others, a few had simply disappeared, while the majority had been executed after spectacular public trials at which they made confession of their crimes.

name: Among
trans: prep. 在…之中；在一群(组)之中；于…之间
example: Among the last survivors were three men named Jones, Aaronson, and Rutherford.

name: survivors
trans: n.幸存者
example: Among the last survivors were three men named Jones, Aaronson, and Rutherford.

name: Jones
example: Among the last survivors were three men named Jones, Aaronson, and Rutherford.

name: Aaronson
example: Among the last survivors were three men named Jones, Aaronson, and Rutherford.

name: Rutherford
example: Among the last survivors were three men named Jones, Aaronson, and Rutherford.

name: arrested
trans: n. 逮捕，扣留vt. 逮捕，扣留；阻止；吸引
example: It must have been in 1965 that these three had been arrested.

name: incriminate
trans: vt. 控告；暗示……有罪
example: As often happened, they had vanished for a year or more, so that one did not know whether they were alive or dead, and then had suddenly been brought forth to incriminate themselves in the usual way.

name: embezzlement
trans: n. 盗用,挪用
example: They had confessed to intelligence with the enemy (at that date, too, the enemy was Eurasia), embezzlement of public funds, the murder of various trusted Party members, intrigues against the leadership of Big Brother which had started long before the Revolution happened, and acts of sabotage causing the death of hundreds of thousands of people.

name: funds
trans: n. 资金，基金；存款，现款；(知识等的)累积
example: They had confessed to intelligence with the enemy (at that date, too, the enemy was Eurasia), embezzlement of public funds, the murder of various trusted Party members, intrigues against the leadership of Big Brother which had started long before the Revolution happened, and acts of sabotage causing the death of hundreds of thousands of people.

name: murder
trans: v./n. 谋杀，凶杀
example: They had confessed to intelligence with the enemy (at that date, too, the enemy was Eurasia), embezzlement of public funds, the murder of various trusted Party members, intrigues against the leadership of Big Brother which had started long before the Revolution happened, and acts of sabotage causing the death of hundreds of thousands of people.

name: intrigues
trans: n.阴谋, 诡计。vi.密谋, 私通。vt.激起...的兴趣, 用诡计取得
example: They had confessed to intelligence with the enemy (at that date, too, the enemy was Eurasia), embezzlement of public funds, the murder of various trusted Party members, intrigues against the leadership of Big Brother which had started long before the Revolution happened, and acts of sabotage causing the death of hundreds of thousands of people.

name: causing
trans: n. 原因；事业，事件，奋斗目标v. 使产生，引起
example: They had confessed to intelligence with the enemy (at that date, too, the enemy was Eurasia), embezzlement of public funds, the murder of various trusted Party members, intrigues against the leadership of Big Brother which had started long before the Revolution happened, and acts of sabotage causing the death of hundreds of thousands of people.

name: confessing
trans: v. 供认，承认，坦白，忏悔
example: After confessing to these things they had been pardoned, reinstated in the Party, and given posts which were in fact sinecures but which sounded important.

name: pardoned
trans: n. 原谅，宽恕；请再说一遍v. 原谅，饶恕，赦免
example: After confessing to these things they had been pardoned, reinstated in the Party, and given posts which were in fact sinecures but which sounded important.

name: reinstated
trans: vt.复原，恢复
example: After confessing to these things they had been pardoned, reinstated in the Party, and given posts which were in fact sinecures but which sounded important.

name: posts
trans: v. 贴出；公告；投寄n. (支)柱；邮政，邮寄；职位
example: After confessing to these things they had been pardoned, reinstated in the Party, and given posts which were in fact sinecures but which sounded important.

name: sinecures
trans: 拿钱不干事的职务；闲差事
example: After confessing to these things they had been pardoned, reinstated in the Party, and given posts which were in fact sinecures but which sounded important.

name: analysing
trans: vt. 分析, 分解, 解释
example: All three had written long, abject articles in 'The Times', analysing the reasons for their defection and promising to make amends.

name: defection
trans: n. 脱离，退出，叛逃
example: All three had written long, abject articles in 'The Times', analysing the reasons for their defection and promising to make amends.

name: promising
trans: a. 有希望的，有前途的
example: All three had written long, abject articles in 'The Times', analysing the reasons for their defection and promising to make amends.

name: amends
trans: n.赔偿
example: All three had written long, abject articles in 'The Times', analysing the reasons for their defection and promising to make amends.

name: release
trans: vt./n. 释放;发表
example: Some time after their release Winston had actually seen all three of them in the Chestnut Tree Cafe.

name: terrified
trans: 恐惧的；受惊吓的
example: He remembered the sort of terrified fascination with which he had watched them out of the corner of his eye.

name: fascination
trans: n.入迷
example: He remembered the sort of terrified fascination with which he had watched them out of the corner of his eye.

name: relics
trans: n. 遗迹，遗物；废墟；纪念物
example: They were men far older than himself, relics of the ancient world, almost the last great figures left over from the heroic days of the Party.

name: glamour
trans: n.[亦作glamor] 魔力, 魅力。v.迷惑。
example: The glamour of the underground struggle and the civil war still faintly clung to them.

name: dates
trans: n. 日期，年代v. 注明…的日期n./v. 约会
example: He had the feeling, though already at that time facts and dates were growing blurry, that he had known their names years earlier than he had known that of Big Brother.

name: blurry
trans: adj.模糊的,污脏的，污斑的
example: He had the feeling, though already at that time facts and dates were growing blurry, that he had known their names years earlier than he had known that of Big Brother.

name: outlaws
trans: n. 被剥夺公民权者;vt. 禁止
example: But also they were outlaws, enemies, untouchables, doomed with absolute certainty to extinction within a year or two.

name: untouchables
trans: 达不到的；不可批评的；不可捉摸的

name: extinction
trans: n.绝灭，熄灭
example: But also they were outlaws, enemies, untouchables, doomed with absolute certainty to extinction within a year or two.

name: escaped
trans: adj.溜走v.逃脱( escape的过去式和过去分词 ),（气体，液体等）漏出,（未受伤或只受了一点伤害而）逃脱,声音（不自觉地）由…发出
example: No one who had once fallen into the hands of the Thought Police ever escaped in the end.

name: corpses
trans: n.尸体。
example: They were corpses waiting to be sent back to the grave.

name: tables
trans: n. 桌子；表格（table的复数）；附录
v. 制表（table的三单形式）；搁置
example: There was no one at any of the tables nearest to them.

name: wise
trans: a. 有智慧的，聪明的
example: It was not wise even to be seen in the neighbourhood of such people.

name: neighbourhood
trans: n.社区;街坊
example: It was not wise even to be seen in the neighbourhood of such people.

name: silence
trans: n. 寂静，沉默v. 使沉默，使安静
example: They were sitting in silence before glasses of the gin flavoured with cloves which was the speciality of the cafe.

name: glasses
trans: pl. n. 眼镜
example: They were sitting in silence before glasses of the gin flavoured with cloves which was the speciality of the cafe.

name: flavoured
trans: n.滋味, 香味。

trans: n.丁香，丁香树,植小鳞茎：如洋葱瓣或大蒜瓣儿v.劈开，剁开( cleave的过去式)
example: They were sitting in silence before glasses of the gin flavoured with cloves which was the speciality of the cafe.

name: speciality
trans: n.特性, 特质, 专业, 特殊性。
example: They were sitting in silence before glasses of the gin flavoured with cloves which was the speciality of the cafe.

name: cafe
trans: n. 咖啡馆,酒吧,餐馆
example: They were sitting in silence before glasses of the gin flavoured with cloves which was the speciality of the cafe.

name: impressed
trans: adj.印象深刻的；外加的；受感动的；了不起的--formatted-->
example: Of the three, it was Rutherford whose appearance had most impressed Winston.

name: famous
trans: a. 著名的
example: Rutherford had once been a famous caricaturist, whose brutal cartoons had helped to inflame popular opinion before and during the Revolution.

name: caricaturist
example: Rutherford had once been a famous caricaturist, whose brutal cartoons had helped to inflame popular opinion before and during the Revolution.

name: helped
trans: v. 帮(援)助；有助于；[呼救
example: Rutherford had once been a famous caricaturist, whose brutal cartoons had helped to inflame popular opinion before and during the Revolution.

name: inflame
trans: 使加剧
example: Rutherford had once been a famous caricaturist, whose brutal cartoons had helped to inflame popular opinion before and during the Revolution.

name: appearing
trans: vi. 出现；出场；问世；仿佛；出版，发表
example: Even now, at long intervals, his cartoons were appearing in The Times.

name: imitation
trans: n. 模仿，仿效；仿制；仿造品
example: They were simply an imitation of his earlier manner, and curiously lifeless and unconvincing.

name: lifeless
trans: adj. 无生命的；死气沉沉的；无趣味的
example: They were simply an imitation of his earlier manner, and curiously lifeless and unconvincing.

name: unconvincing
trans: 没有说服力的
example: They were simply an imitation of his earlier manner, and curiously lifeless and unconvincing.

name: rehashing
trans: 重复，老调重弹
example: Always they were a rehashing of the ancient themes--slum tenements, starving children, street battles, capitalists in top hats--even on the barricades the capitalists still seemed to cling to their top hats an endless, hopeless effort to get back into the past.

name: themes
trans: n. 题目,主题

example: Always they were a rehashing of the ancient themes--slum tenements, starving children, street battles, capitalists in top hats--even on the barricades the capitalists still seemed to cling to their top hats an endless, hopeless effort to get back into the past.

example: Always they were a rehashing of the ancient themes--slum tenements, starving children, street battles, capitalists in top hats--even on the barricades the capitalists still seemed to cling to their top hats an endless, hopeless effort to get back into the past.

name: mane
trans: （马等的）鬃毛
example: He was a monstrous man, with a mane of greasy grey hair, his face pouched and seamed, with thick negroid lips.

name: pouched
trans: 小袋；育儿袋；烟草袋
成袋状
example: He was a monstrous man, with a mane of greasy grey hair, his face pouched and seamed, with thick negroid lips.

name: seamed
trans: n./v. 线缝,接缝;煤层
example: He was a monstrous man, with a mane of greasy grey hair, his face pouched and seamed, with thick negroid lips.

name: negroid
example: He was a monstrous man, with a mane of greasy grey hair, his face pouched and seamed, with thick negroid lips.

name: immensely
trans: adv.极大地，广大地,无限地，庞大地,〈口〉非常，很,“immense”的派生
example: At one time he must have been immensely strong; now his great body was sagging, sloping, bulging, falling away in every direction.

name: sloping
trans: adj. 倾斜的，有坡度的
example: At one time he must have been immensely strong; now his great body was sagging, sloping, bulging, falling away in every direction.

name: bulging
trans: n.膨胀,凸出（部）,打气,折皱v.凸出( bulge的现在分词 ),充满,塞满（某物）
example: At one time he must have been immensely strong; now his great body was sagging, sloping, bulging, falling away in every direction.

name: mountain
trans: n. 山
example: He seemed to be breaking up before one's eyes, like a mountain crumbling.

name: crumbling
trans: v.（把…）弄碎， （使）碎成细屑( crumble的现在分词 ),衰落,坍塌,损坏
example: He seemed to be breaking up before one's eyes, like a mountain crumbling.

name: lonely
trans: a. 孤独的，寂寞的；荒凉的，人迹稀少的
example: It was the lonely hour of fifteen.

name: cafe
trans: n. 咖啡馆,酒吧,餐馆
example: Winston could not now remember how he had come to be in the cafe at such a time.

name: empty
trans: a. 空的；空洞的v. 倒空，使成为空的
example: The place was almost empty.

name: trickling
trans: v./n. (使)滴流,(使)细流
example: A tinny music was trickling from the telescreens.

name: motionless
trans: adj.不动的
example: The three men sat in their corner almost motionless, never speaking.

name: Uncommanded
example: Uncommanded, the waiter brought fresh glasses of gin.

name: waiter
trans: n. 侍者，服务员
example: Uncommanded, the waiter brought fresh glasses of gin.

name: chessboard
example: There was a chessboard on the table beside them, with the pieces set out but no game started.

name: beside
trans: prep. 在…旁边，在…附近；和…相比
example: There was a chessboard on the table beside them, with the pieces set out but no game started.

name: telescreens
example: And then, for perhaps half a minute in all, something happened to the telescreens.

name: tune
trans: n. 曲调,旋律,协调,调动
example: The tune that they were playing changed, and the tone of the music changed too.

name: describe
trans: v. 描述，形容
example: There came into it--but it was something hard to describe.

name: cracked

v. 破裂；发沙哑声；失败；崩溃（crack的过去分词）

name: braying
trans: vi. 叫；捣碎 vt. 叫

name: jeering
trans: n.嘲笑, 讥讽, 戏弄。v.嘲弄, 戏弄。
example: It was a peculiar, cracked, braying, jeering note: in his mind Winston called it a yellow note.

name: yellow
trans: a. 黄的，黄色的n. 黄色
example: It was a peculiar, cracked, braying, jeering note: in his mind Winston called it a yellow note.

adj. 唱歌的；音乐般的
v. 唱歌（sing的ing形式）

name: ruinous
trans: a. 毁灭性的,破坏性的

name: inward
trans: ad. 向内，在内a. 向内的，在内的，里面的

name: shudder
trans: n. 震动；发抖；战栗; vi. 发抖；战栗 时 态: shuddered, shuddering, shudders

name: shuddered
trans: n. 震动；发抖；战栗; vi. 发抖；战栗 时 态: shuddered, shuddering, shudders
example: And for the first time he noticed, with a kind of inward shudder, and yet not knowing AT WHAT he shuddered, that both Aaronson and Rutherford had broken noses.

trans: n. 鼻子；(飞机，船等的)前端，突出部分

name: arrested
trans: n. 逮捕，扣留vt. 逮捕，扣留；阻止；吸引

name: conspiracies
example: It appeared that they had engaged in fresh conspiracies from the very moment of their release.

name: string
trans: n. 线,细绳;弦
example: At their second trial they confessed to all their old crimes over again, with a whole string of new ones.

name: fate
trans: n. 命运
example: They were executed, and their fate was recorded in the Party histories, a warning to posterity.

name: posterity
trans: n.子孙，后代
example: They were executed, and their fate was recorded in the Party histories, a warning to posterity.

name: unrolling
trans: adj.旋转的,波动的,起伏的n.旋转,动摇,轰鸣
example: About five years after this, in 1973, Winston was unrolling a wad of documents which had just flopped out of the pneumatic tube on to his desk when he came on a fragment of paper which had evidently been slipped in among the others and then forgotten.

name: wad
trans: n.填充物,炮塞（弹塞）,小块软物,可观的一卷纸币，大量的钱vt.使成一团（或一卷，一叠等）,（用填料）填塞,将炮弹放入（炮筒）,把弹塞填入vi.形成团
example: About five years after this, in 1973, Winston was unrolling a wad of documents which had just flopped out of the pneumatic tube on to his desk when he came on a fragment of paper which had evidently been slipped in among the others and then forgotten.

example: The instant he had flattened it out he saw its significance.

name: photograph
trans: n. 照片
example: It was a half-page torn out of 'The Times' of about ten years earlier--the top half of the page, so that it included the date--and it contained a photograph of the delegates at some Party function in New York.

name: delegates
trans: vt. 委派…为代表,授权;n. 代表

name: function
trans: n. 职责,作用,正式社会集会 vi. 起作用,运行
example: It was a half-page torn out of 'The Times' of about ten years earlier--the top half of the page, so that it included the date--and it contained a photograph of the delegates at some Party function in New York.

name: New
trans: a. 新(近)的；新来的；不熟悉的；没经验的

name: York
example: It was a half-page torn out of 'The Times' of about ten years earlier--the top half of the page, so that it included the date--and it contained a photograph of the delegates at some Party function in New York.

name: Prominent
trans: a. 突起的，凸出的；突出的，杰出的

name: mistaking
trans: n. 错误，过失，误解v. 弄错；(for)把…误认为

name: soil
trans: n. 泥土;v. 弄脏

name: flown
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: airfield
trans: 飞机场
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: Canada
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: Siberia
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: General
trans: a. 一般的，普通的；总的，大体的n. 将军
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: Staff
trans: n. 木棍,杆,工作人员
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: secrets
trans: a. 秘密的，机密的n. 秘密
example: They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets.

name: stuck
trans: adj. 卡住的，困住的，陷入……的
example: The date had stuck in Winston's memory because it chanced to be midsummer day; but the whole story must be on record in countless other places as well.

name: chanced
trans: n. 机会；可能性；偶然性，运气v. 碰巧，偶然发生

name: midsummer
example: The date had stuck in Winston's memory because it chanced to be midsummer day; but the whole story must be on record in countless other places as well.

name: countless
trans: adj.无数的

name: conclusion
trans: n. 结论，推论；结尾；缔结，议定

trans: n. 发现；被发现的事物

name: accused
trans: n. 被告
adj. 被控告的
v. 指责；控告（accuse的过去式）

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石

name: turns
trans: v./n. (使)转动；(使)旋转；(使)转变n. 机会

trans: n. （组织的）层；[地质] 地层；社会阶层

name: destroys
trans: v. 破坏，摧毁，消灭
example: But this was concrete evidence; it was a fragment of the abolished past, like a fossil bone which turns up in the wrong stratum and destroys a geological theory.

name: geological
trans: adj. 地质的，地质学的
example: But this was concrete evidence; it was a fragment of the abolished past, like a fossil bone which turns up in the wrong stratum and destroys a geological theory.

name: theory
trans: n. 理论，原理；学说，见解，看法

name: atoms
trans: n. [物] 原子（atom的复数）

name: straight
trans: a. 直的；整齐的，端正的ad. 直接；正直，直率

name: Luckily
trans: adv.幸运地,侥幸,幸而,幸亏

trans: n.上面，上部

name: view
trans: n. 视野；风景；观察；见解；照片vt. 观察；认为

name: scribbling
trans: 潦草写成的东西；潦草的写法；杂文
乱写；滥写；潦草地书写
example: He took his scribbling pad on his knee and pushed back his chair so as to get as far away from the telescreen as possible.

name: pad
trans: n. 垫子;拍纸簿;vt. 步行,走路
example: He took his scribbling pad on his knee and pushed back his chair so as to get as far away from the telescreen as possible.

name: controlled
trans: adj. 受约束的,克制的

name: beating
trans: 打；[纸] 打浆；敲打；失败
打（beat的ing形式）

trans: n. 剧烈痛苦;折磨,烦扰;v. 折磨;纠缠

name: accident
trans: n. 意外遭遇，事故；意外(因素)

name: draught
trans: 气流；汇票；草稿（等于draft）
起草；征兵；选派（等于draft）
汲出的；拖拉的（等于draft）
example: He let what he judged to be ten minutes go by, tormented all the while by the fear that some accident--a sudden draught blowing across his desk, for instance--would betray him.

name: blowing
trans: vi. 吹，吹气，打气；吹奏；爆炸n. 打，打击

trans: v. 揭开，揭露

name: crumbled
trans: v.（把…）弄碎， （使）碎成细屑( crumble的过去式和过去分词 ),衰落,坍塌,损坏

name: eleven
trans: num. 十一pron./a. 十一(个，只…)

trans: ad. 在今天；现今，在当代n. 今天；现在

name: recorded
trans: v.记录，录音，拍摄( record的过去式和过去分词 ),标明,发表正式（或法律方面的）声明,演奏音乐供录制
example: It was curious that the fact of having held it in his fingers seemed to him to make a difference even now, when the photograph itself, as well as the event it recorded, was only memory.

name: HAD
trans: v. 有，具有；体会，经受；从事；使；吃，喝
example: Was the Party's hold upon the past less strong, he wondered, because a piece of evidence which existed no longer HAD ONCE existed?

name: ONCE
trans: ad. 一次，曾经conj. 一(旦)…就…n. 一次
example: Was the Party's hold upon the past less strong, he wondered, because a piece of evidence which existed no longer HAD ONCE existed?

name: supposing
trans: conj.假使
example: But today, supposing that it could be somehow resurrected from its ashes, the photograph might not even be evidence.

name: resurrected
trans: 使重生，使复苏
example: But today, supposing that it could be somehow resurrected from its ashes, the photograph might not even be evidence.

name: agents
trans: n. 间谍；代理人；代理商；特工人员（agent的复数形式）
example: Already, at the time when he made his discovery, Oceania was no longer at war with Eurasia, and it must have been to the agents of Eastasia that the three dead men had betrayed their country.

name: Since
trans: prep. 自从conj. 自从；因为，既然ad. 后来

name: dates
trans: n. 日期，年代v. 注明…的日期n./v. 约会

name: continuously
trans: adv.连续不断地
example: The past not only changed, but changed continuously.

name: afflicted
trans: He was afflicted by pain in his right arm.
example: What most afflicted him with the sense of nightmare was that he had never clearly understood why the huge imposture was undertaken.

name: understood
trans: v. 懂，理解；获悉，听说；揣测，认为
example: What most afflicted him with the sense of nightmare was that he had never clearly understood why the huge imposture was undertaken.

name: imposture
trans: n. 欺诈，欺骗；冒牌

name: advantages
trans: n. 优点，长处，有利条件；利益，好处
example: The immediate advantages of falsifying the past were obvious, but the ultimate motive was mysterious.

name: falsifying
trans: v.伪造。
example: The immediate advantages of falsifying the past were obvious, but the ultimate motive was mysterious.

name: motive
trans: n. 动机，目的a. 发动的，运动的
example: The immediate advantages of falsifying the past were obvious, but the ultimate motive was mysterious.

name: HOW
trans: ad. 1. (表示方法、手段、状态)怎样；如何
example: He took up his pen again and wrote: I understand HOW: I do not understand WHY.

name: lunatic
trans: adj. 精神错乱的；疯狂的；愚蠢的; n. 疯子；疯人 名 词: lunatic
example: He wondered, as he had many times wondered before, whether he himself was a lunatic.

name: minority
trans: n. 少数;少数民族;未成年
example: Perhaps a lunatic was simply a minority of one.

name: madness
trans: n.疯狂，疯病

name: goes
trans: v. 去，离开；走；放置；变成；运转n. 围棋

name: ALONE
trans: a. 单独的，孤独的ad. 单独地，独自地；仅仅
example: He might be ALONE in holding that belief, and if alone, then a lunatic.

name: greatly
trans: ad.大大地，非常
example: But the thought of being a lunatic did not greatly trouble him: the horror was that he might also be wrong.

name: trouble
trans: n. 烦恼；动乱；疾病；故障；辛苦v. (使)烦恼
example: But the thought of being a lunatic did not greatly trouble him: the horror was that he might also be wrong.

name: portrait
trans: n. 肖像，画像
example: He picked up the children's history book and looked at the portrait of Big Brother which formed its frontispiece.

name: frontispiece
example: He picked up the children's history book and looked at the portrait of Big Brother which formed its frontispiece.

name: hypnotic

example: The hypnotic eyes gazed into his own.

name: pressing
trans: adj.急迫的,再三要求的,恳切要求的 n.同批的唱片,模压制品

trans: v. 穿过;透过;看穿,洞察;秘密潜入

name: battering

name: beliefs
trans: n. 信任，相信，信念；信仰，信条
example: It was as though some huge force were pressing down upon you--something that penetrated inside your skull, battering against your brain, frightening you out of your beliefs, persuading you, almost, to deny the evidence of your senses.

name: persuading
trans: v. 劝说（persuade的ing形式）
example: It was as though some huge force were pressing down upon you--something that penetrated inside your skull, battering against your brain, frightening you out of your beliefs, persuading you, almost, to deny the evidence of your senses.

name: deny
trans: v. 否认，否定；拒绝
example: It was as though some huge force were pressing down upon you--something that penetrated inside your skull, battering against your brain, frightening you out of your beliefs, persuading you, almost, to deny the evidence of your senses.

name: senses
trans: It would be hard to live without your five senses.
example: It was as though some huge force were pressing down upon you--something that penetrated inside your skull, battering against your brain, frightening you out of your beliefs, persuading you, almost, to deny the evidence of your senses.

name: announce
trans: v. 正式宣布；发表；通告；广播(电台节目)
example: In the end the Party would announce that two and two made five, and you would have to believe it.

name: inevitable
trans: a. 不可避免的,照例必有的

name: demanded
trans: n./v. 要求，请求，需要(量)v. 查问

name: validity
trans: n.有效，效力；正确
example: Not merely the validity of experience, but the very existence of external reality, was tacitly denied by their philosophy.

name: experience
trans: n./vt. 经验；经历；体验；阅历
example: Not merely the validity of experience, but the very existence of external reality, was tacitly denied by their philosophy.

name: tacitly
trans: 肃静地；沉默地；心照不宣地
example: Not merely the validity of experience, but the very existence of external reality, was tacitly denied by their philosophy.

name: philosophy
trans: n. 哲学，哲理，人生观，价值观，世界观
example: Not merely the validity of experience, but the very existence of external reality, was tacitly denied by their philosophy.

name: heresy
trans: n. 异端；异端邪说；异教
example: The heresy of heresies was common sense.

name: terrifying
trans: adj.可怕的,极大的v.使恐怖，使惊吓,恐吓(terrify的现在分词)
example: And what was terrifying was not that they would kill you for thinking otherwise, but that they might be right.

name: four
trans: num. 四pron./a. 四(个，只…)
example: For, after all, how do we know that two and two make four?

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，引力；严肃，庄重

name: works
trans: n.工厂,作品,善行

name: unchangeable
trans: adj.变化的

name: controllable
trans: adj. 可控制的，可操纵的

name: But
trans: conj. 但是prep. 除…以外ad. 只，才，仅仅

name: stiffen
trans: 变硬；变猛烈；变粘
example: His courage seemed suddenly to stiffen of its own accord.

name: accord
trans: vi. 相一致;相符合; vt. 授予,赠与; n. 一致,符合;(尤指国与国之间的)谅解
example: His courage seemed suddenly to stiffen of its own accord.

name: association
trans: n. 联盟，协会，社团；交往，联合；联想
example: The face of O'Brien, not called up by any obvious association, had floated into his mind.

name: certainty
trans: n. 必然的事,必然,确实,肯定

name: letter
trans: n. 信，函件；字母，文字
example: He was writing the diary for O'Brien--TO O'Brien: it was like an interminable letter which no one would ever read, but which was addressed to a particular person and took its colour from that fact.

name: addressed
trans: n. 住址,致词 vt. 向…致词,在信封上写姓名、住址
example: He was writing the diary for O'Brien--TO O'Brien: it was like an interminable letter which no one would ever read, but which was addressed to a particular person and took its colour from that fact.

name: reject
trans: v. 拒绝，抵制，丢弃，排斥，退掉n. 落选者
example: The Party told you to reject the evidence of your eyes and ears.

name: command
trans: n./v. 命令，指挥，控制n. 掌握，运用能力
example: It was their final, most essential command.

name: arrayed
trans: n. 展示;一系列
example: His heart sank as he thought of the enormous power arrayed against him, the ease with which any Party intellectual would overthrow him in debate, the subtle arguments which he would not be able to understand, much less answer.

name: debate
trans: v./n. 争论，辩论
example: His heart sank as he thought of the enormous power arrayed against him, the ease with which any Party intellectual would overthrow him in debate, the subtle arguments which he would not be able to understand, much less answer.

name: subtle
trans: a. 微妙的,难于捉摸的;诡秘的,狡诈的;隐约的

name: arguments
trans: n. 争论(吵)，辩论；理由；论证
example: His heart sank as he thought of the enormous power arrayed against him, the ease with which any Party intellectual would overthrow him in debate, the subtle arguments which he would not be able to understand, much less answer.

name: yet
trans: ad. 还，尚，仍然；已经conj. 然而ad. 甚至
example: And yet he was in the right!

name: wrong
trans: a. 错的ad. 错误地，不正确地n. 错误v. 委屈
example: They were wrong and he was right.

name: defended
trans: v. 防守，保卫；为…辩护，为…答辩
example: The obvious, the silly, and the true had got to be defended.

name: Truisms
trans: 自明之理；老生常谈；老套；众所周知；真实性
example: Truisms are true, hold on to that!

name: laws
trans: n. 法律，法规，法学，规律，定律
example: The solid world exists, its laws do not change.

name: Stones
trans: 石头
example: Stones are hard, water is wet, objects unsupported fall towards the earth's centre.

name: objects
trans: n. 物体；客体，对象；目标；宾语v. (to)反对
example: Stones are hard, water is wet, objects unsupported fall towards the earth's centre.

name: unsupported
example: Stones are hard, water is wet, objects unsupported fall towards the earth's centre.

name: fall
trans: v. 跌倒；下降；减弱；坠落；变成，陷于n. 秋季
example: Stones are hard, water is wet, objects unsupported fall towards the earth's centre.

name: axiom
trans: [数] 公理；格言；自明之理
example: With the feeling that he was speaking to O'Brien, and also that he was setting forth an important axiom, he wrote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four.

name: Freedom
trans: n. 自由，自主，免除，特权

name: plus
trans: prep./n. 加,加号 a. 正的
example: With the feeling that he was speaking to O'Brien, and also that he was setting forth an important axiom, he wrote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four.

name: granted
trans: vt. 同意给予;同意或承认某事属实;n. 拨款,补助款
example: If that is granted, all else follows.

name: follows
trans: v. 跟随，接着；领会；沿着…前进，遵循；结果是
example: If that is granted, all else follows.

name: roasting
trans: adj.用于烤炙烘焙的,燥热的，灼热的n.严厉批评,受到严厉批评v.烤，烘，焙( roast的现在分词 ),嘲讽,（对某人）非常生气，严厉批评
example: Chapter 8 From somewhere at the bottom of a passage the smell of roasting coffee--real coffee, not Victory Coffee--came floating out into the street.

name: floating
trans: a.浮动的，浮点的
example: Chapter 8 From somewhere at the bottom of a passage the smell of roasting coffee--real coffee, not Victory Coffee--came floating out into the street.

name: involuntarily
trans: adv.非自愿地,非出于本意地,无意地,偶然地

name: childhood
trans: n. 幼年，童年

name: banged
trans: n./v. 猛击,猛敲,砰然作声

name: kilometres
trans: n. 千米，公里( kilometre的名词复数 )

name: missed

name: rash

name: spare

name: assumed

name: OWNLIFE

name: balminess

name: alley
trans: 小巷

example: He got away from Mr Charrington and went down the stairs alone, so as not to let the old man see him reconnoitring the street before stepping out of the door.

name: stepping
trans: n.干草原
example: He got away from Mr Charrington and went down the stairs alone, so as not to let the old man see him reconnoitring the street before stepping out of the door.

name: suitable
trans: a. (for)合适的，适宜的
example: He had already made up his mind that after a suitable interval--a month, say--he would take the risk of visiting the shop again.

name: visiting
trans: n.拜访，访问v.访问( visit的现在分词 ),探望,参观,游览
example: He had already made up his mind that after a suitable interval--a month, say--he would take the risk of visiting the shop again.

name: shirking
trans: 逃避，规避

name: buying
trans: n.购买v.购买，购得( buy的现在分词 ),做出牺牲以获得,够支付,买通
example: The serious piece of folly had been to come back here in the first place, after buying the diary and without knowing whether the proprietor of the shop could be trusted.

name: proprietor
trans: n.所有者，业主
example: The serious piece of folly had been to come back here in the first place, after buying the diary and without knowing whether the proprietor of the shop could be trusted.

name: However
trans: ad. 然而，可是，不过，无论如何conj. 无论
example: However----!

name: Yes
trans: ad. 是[用于肯定句前
example: Yes, he thought again, he would come back.

name: further
trans: ad./a. 更远，更往前；进一步v. 促进，增进
example: He would buy further scraps of beautiful rubbish.

name: scraps
trans: n. 碎片,碎屑;少许,少量
example: He would buy further scraps of beautiful rubbish.

name: Danes
example: He would buy the engraving of St Clement Danes, take it out of its frame, and carry it home concealed under the jacket of his overalls.

name: drag
trans: v. 拖，拖曳
example: He would drag the rest of that poem out of Mr Charrington's memory.

name: poem
trans: n. 诗
example: He would drag the rest of that poem out of Mr Charrington's memory.

name: project
trans: n. 方案;计划;v. 设计;投影;抛
example: Even the lunatic project of renting the room upstairs flashed momentarily through his mind again.

name: renting
trans: v. 租，租赁n. 租金
example: Even the lunatic project of renting the room upstairs flashed momentarily through his mind again.

name: momentarily
trans: adv.顷刻之间，<美>马上，立刻
example: Even the lunatic project of renting the room upstairs flashed momentarily through his mind again.

name: exaltation
trans: 得意洋洋，欣喜；提拔；举起
example: For perhaps five seconds exaltation made him careless, and he stepped out on to the pavement without so much as a preliminary glance through the window.

name: careless
trans: a.粗心的，漫不经心的
example: For perhaps five seconds exaltation made him careless, and he stepped out on to the pavement without so much as a preliminary glance through the window.

name: improvised
trans: adj.简易的
example: He had even started humming to an improvised tune Oranges and lemons, say the bells of St Clement's, You owe me three farthings, say the---- Suddenly his heart seemed to turn to ice and his bowels to water.

name: ice
trans: n. 冰；冰冻甜食vt. 冰冻，使成冰
example: He had even started humming to an improvised tune Oranges and lemons, say the bells of St Clement's, You owe me three farthings, say the---- Suddenly his heart seemed to turn to ice and his bowels to water.

name: pavement
trans: n. 人行道
example: A figure in blue overalls was coming down the pavement, not ten metres away.

name: Fiction
trans: n. 虚构，编造；小说
example: It was the girl from the Fiction Department, the girl with dark hair.

name: failing
trans: 失败；缺点，过失；弱点
如果没有…
失败的
失败；不及格（fail的ing形式）
example: The light was failing, but there was no difficulty in recognizing her.

name: recognizing
trans: v. 认出，承认，公认，赏识，表扬
example: The light was failing, but there was no difficulty in recognizing her.

name: quickly
trans: ad.快，迅速
example: She looked him straight in the face, then walked quickly on as though she had not seen him.

name: paralysed
trans: 麻痹的;惊呆的
example: For a few seconds Winston was too paralysed to move.

name: heavily
trans: ad.重重地；大量地
example: Then he turned to the right and walked heavily away, not noticing for the moment that he was going in the wrong direction.

name: noticing
trans: n. 通知，通告，布告；注意，认识v. 注意到，注意
example: Then he turned to the right and walked heavily away, not noticing for the moment that he was going in the wrong direction.

name: settled
trans: adj.不变的，稳定的,固定的,妥,停当
example: At any rate, one question was settled.

name: doubting
trans: n./v. 怀疑，疑虑
example: There was no doubting any longer that the girl was spying on him.

name: spying
trans: v.看见，发现( spy的现在分词 ),当间谍,从事间谍活动,搜集情报
example: There was no doubting any longer that the girl was spying on him.

name: credible
trans: adj.可信的, 可靠的。
example: She must have followed him here, because it was not credible that by pure chance she should have happened to be walking on the same evening up the same obscure backstreet, kilometres distant from any quarter where Party members lived.

name: chance
trans: n. 机会；可能性；偶然性，运气v. 碰巧，偶然发生
example: She must have followed him here, because it was not credible that by pure chance she should have happened to be walking on the same evening up the same obscure backstreet, kilometres distant from any quarter where Party members lived.

name: backstreet
example: She must have followed him here, because it was not credible that by pure chance she should have happened to be walking on the same evening up the same obscure backstreet, kilometres distant from any quarter where Party members lived.

name: distant
trans: a. 远的；遥远的；疏远的；不亲近的
example: She must have followed him here, because it was not credible that by pure chance she should have happened to be walking on the same evening up the same obscure backstreet, kilometres distant from any quarter where Party members lived.

name: coincidence
trans: n. 巧合；同时发生，共同存在；符合，一致
example: It was too great a coincidence.

name: actuated
trans: vt. 开动（机器等）；促使，驱使；激励（人等）
example: Whether she was really an agent of the Thought Police, or simply an amateur spy actuated by officiousness, hardly mattered.

name: officiousness
example: Whether she was really an agent of the Thought Police, or simply an amateur spy actuated by officiousness, hardly mattered.

name: watching
trans: v. 观看；看守；(for)窥伺，等待n. 看管；表
example: It was enough that she was watching him.

name: Probably
trans: ad.或许，大概
example: Probably she had seen him go into the pub as well.

name: pub
trans: n.酒吧
example: Probably she had seen him go into the pub as well.

name: walk
trans: v. 走，步行，散步；走遍n. 走，步行，散步
example: It was an effort to walk.

name: thigh
trans: n. 大腿,股
example: The lump of glass in his pocket banged against his thigh at each step, and he was half minded to take it out and throw it away.

name: minded
trans: n. 精神，理智，意见，记忆力v. 注意，介意，反对
example: The lump of glass in his pocket banged against his thigh at each step, and he was half minded to take it out and throw it away.

name: worst
trans: a./ad. 最坏(的)，最差(的)
example: The worst thing was the pain in his belly.

name: reach
trans: v. 抵达；(out)伸手，够到n. 能达到的范围
example: For a couple of minutes he had the feeling that he would die if he did not reach a lavatory soon.

name: lavatories
example: But there would be no public lavatories in a quarter like this.

name: ache
trans: vi. 痛；哀怜n. (指连续)疼痛、酸痛
example: Then the spasm passed, leaving a dull ache behind.

name: blind
trans: a. 盲的，瞎的；盲目的vt. 使失明n. 百叶窗
example: The street was a blind alley.

name: retrace
trans: vt.折回，折返,回忆，回想,追溯，探源,重描
example: Winston halted, stood for several seconds wondering vaguely what to do, then turned round and began to retrace his steps.

name: catch
trans: v. 捕捉，捕获；赶上；感染；理解，听到
example: As he turned it occurred to him that the girl had only passed him three minutes ago and that by running he could probably catch up with her.

name: smash
trans: vt./vi. 打碎,打破;击溃
example: He could keep on her track till they were in some quiet place, and then smash her skull in with a cobblestone.

name: cobblestone
trans: n.圆石，鹅卵石
example: He could keep on her track till they were in some quiet place, and then smash her skull in with a cobblestone.

name: pocket
trans: n. 衣袋a. 袖珍的，小型的v. 把…装入袋内
example: The piece of glass in his pocket would be heavy enough for the job.

name: abandoned
trans: adj. 被抛弃的,自甘堕落的,没有约束的,放荡的
example: But he abandoned the idea immediately, because even the thought of making any physical effort was unbearable.

name: strike
trans: n./vi. 罢工vt. 打，击；攻击；给…深刻印象
example: He could not run, he could not strike a blow.

name: Besides
trans: ad. 此外；并且prep. 于…之外；除…以外

name: lusty
trans: adj. 精力充沛的；健壮的 n. （Lusty）人名；（英）勒斯蒂
example: Besides, she was young and lusty and would defend herself.

name: defend
trans: v. 防守，保卫；为…辩护，为…答辩
example: Besides, she was young and lusty and would defend herself.

name: partial
trans: a. 不完全的;偏袒的;偏爱的

name: alibi
trans: 不在场的证明；托辞，借口

name: impossible
trans: a. 不可能的；难以忍受的，很难对付的
example: But that too was impossible.

name: lassitude
trans: 乏力，没精打采

name: quiet
trans: a. 安静的，平静的n. 安静v. 使安静，平静
example: All he wanted was to get home quickly and then sit down and be quiet.

name: flat
trans: a. 平坦的，扁平的，平淡的n. 一套房间；平面
example: It was after twenty-two hours when he got back to the flat.

name: switched
trans: n. 开关；转换；鞭子v. 转变，转换；抽打

name: teacupful
trans: n.茶杯
example: He went into the kitchen and swallowed nearly a teacupful of Victory Gin.

name: alcove
trans: n.凹室，壁龛,（花园）凉亭,<古>僻静处

name: open
trans: n. 公开，户外a. 开的，开放的v. 开
example: But he did not open it at once.

name: brassy
trans: 厚脸皮的，不知羞耻的

name: squalling
trans: 尖叫

name: patriotic
trans: a. 爱国的
example: From the telescreen a brassy female voice was squalling a patriotic song.

name: song
trans: n. 歌唱，(虫、鸟等)鸣声；歌曲，歌词
example: From the telescreen a brassy female voice was squalling a patriotic song.

name: staring
trans: n. 星；恒星；明星v. 用星号标出；扮演主角

name: marbled
trans: n. 大理石,(游戏用的)玻璃弹子
example: He sat staring at the marbled cover of the book, trying without success to shut the voice out of his consciousness.

name: success
trans: n. 成就，成功；成功的事物，有成就的人
example: He sat staring at the marbled cover of the book, trying without success to shut the voice out of his consciousness.

name: night
trans: n. 夜间；夜；晚(上)

name: proper
trans: a. 适合的；合乎体统的；固有的；有礼貌的

name: Undoubtedly
trans: ad. 无疑地,必是地

name: Many
trans: a. 许多的，多的pron. 许多人或物，许多

name: disappearances
trans: n.消失，消散；失踪
example: Many of the disappearances were actually suicides.

name: suicides
trans: n. 自杀
example: Many of the disappearances were actually suicides.

name: desperate
trans: a. 绝望的;不顾一切的;危急的

name: firearms
trans: n.火器, 枪炮。
example: But it needed desperate courage to kill yourself in a world where firearms, or any quick and certain poison, were completely unprocurable.

name: poison
trans: n. 毒物，毒药v. 放毒，毒害，污染

name: unprocurable

name: astonishment
trans: n.惊奇，惊讶

name: treachery
trans: 背叛；变节；背叛行为

name: inertia

trans: v. 表演；举动；起作用n. 行为，法令；一幕

name: extremity
trans: 极端；绝境；非常手段；手足

name: crisis
trans: n. 转折点

name: consecutive
trans: a. 连续的,连贯的

trans: ad. 外观上，表面上

name: situations
trans: n. 形势，处境，状况；位置，场所；职位，职务

name: battlefield
trans: n. 战场,战地斗争的领域
example: On the battlefield, in the torture chamber, on a sinking ship, the issues that you are fighting for are always forgotten, because the body swells up until it fills the universe, and even when you are not paralysed by fright or screaming with pain, life is a moment-to-moment struggle against hunger or cold or sleeplessness, against a sour stomach or an aching tooth.

name: chamber
trans: n. 房间;议院;贸易团体;弹膛

trans: vt./vi. 使膨胀,使增强,使壮大,使隆起

trans: n. 宇宙，万物
example: On the battlefield, in the torture chamber, on a sinking ship, the issues that you are fighting for are always forgotten, because the body swells up until it fills the universe, and even when you are not paralysed by fright or screaming with pain, life is a moment-to-moment struggle against hunger or cold or sleeplessness, against a sour stomach or an aching tooth.

name: hunger
trans: n./v. 饥饿；渴望
example: On the battlefield, in the torture chamber, on a sinking ship, the issues that you are fighting for are always forgotten, because the body swells up until it fills the universe, and even when you are not paralysed by fright or screaming with pain, life is a moment-to-moment struggle against hunger or cold or sleeplessness, against a sour stomach or an aching tooth.

name: sleeplessness
example: On the battlefield, in the torture chamber, on a sinking ship, the issues that you are fighting for are always forgotten, because the body swells up until it fills the universe, and even when you are not paralysed by fright or screaming with pain, life is a moment-to-moment struggle against hunger or cold or sleeplessness, against a sour stomach or an aching tooth.

name: aching
trans: adj.疼痛的
example: On the battlefield, in the torture chamber, on a sinking ship, the issues that you are fighting for are always forgotten, because the body swells up until it fills the universe, and even when you are not paralysed by fright or screaming with pain, life is a moment-to-moment struggle against hunger or cold or sleeplessness, against a sour stomach or an aching tooth.

name: tooth
trans: n. 牙齿；齿状物
example: On the battlefield, in the torture chamber, on a sinking ship, the issues that you are fighting for are always forgotten, because the body swells up until it fills the universe, and even when you are not paralysed by fright or screaming with pain, life is a moment-to-moment struggle against hunger or cold or sleeplessness, against a sour stomach or an aching tooth.

name: opened
trans: a.开路的，断开的
example: He opened the diary.

name: write
trans: v. 写，书写，写字；写作；写信(给)，函告
example: It was important to write something down.

name: song
trans: n. 歌唱，(虫、鸟等)鸣声；歌曲，歌词
example: The woman on the telescreen had started a new song.

name: jagged
trans: adj.锯齿状的，有凹口的，（外形）参差不齐的。
example: Her voice seemed to stick into his brain like jagged splinters of glass.

name: splinters
trans: 碎片；微小的东西；极瘦的人
分裂；裂成碎片
example: Her voice seemed to stick into his brain like jagged splinters of glass.

name: instead
trans: ad. 代替，顶替
example: He tried to think of O'Brien, for whom, or to whom, the diary was written, but instead he began thinking of the things that would happen to him after the Thought Police took him away.

name: killed
trans: vt. 杀死，消灭；破坏，毁灭；消磨(时间)
example: It would not matter if they killed you at once.

name: killed
trans: vt. 杀死，消灭；破坏，毁灭；消磨(时间)
example: To be killed was what you expected.

name: grovelling
trans: 卑躬屈膝
example: But before death (nobody spoke of such things, yet everybody knew of them) there was the routine of confession that had to be gone through: the grovelling on the floor and screaming for mercy, the crack of broken bones, the smashed teeth and bloody clots of hair.

name: mercy
trans: n. 怜悯,宽恕
example: But before death (nobody spoke of such things, yet everybody knew of them) there was the routine of confession that had to be gone through: the grovelling on the floor and screaming for mercy, the crack of broken bones, the smashed teeth and bloody clots of hair.

name: clots
trans: n. 凝块，黏团（尤指血块）；（非正式）笨蛋，傻瓜 v. （使）凝结成块；覆以粘性物质 n. （Clot）（法、美）克洛（人名）
example: But before death (nobody spoke of such things, yet everybody knew of them) there was the routine of confession that had to be gone through: the grovelling on the floor and screaming for mercy, the crack of broken bones, the smashed teeth and bloody clots of hair.

name: endure
trans: v. 忍受，持久，持续
example: Why did you have to endure it, since the end was always the same?

name: weeks
trans: n. 星期，周
example: Why was it not possible to cut a few days or weeks out of your life?

name: detection
trans: n.察觉，发觉；侦察
example: Nobody ever escaped detection, and nobody ever failed to confess.

name: confess
trans: v. 供认，承认，坦白，忏悔
example: Nobody ever escaped detection, and nobody ever failed to confess.

name: succumbed
trans: vi.屈服, 屈从, 死。
example: When once you had succumbed to thoughtcrime it was certain that by a given date you would be dead.

name: embedded
trans: adj.植入的，深入的，内含的v.把…嵌入，埋入( embed的过去式和过去分词 )
example: Why then did that horror, which altered nothing, have to lie embedded in future time?

name: summon
trans: vt. 召唤,传唤;鼓起,聚集
example: He tried with a little more success than before to summon up the image of O'Brien.

name: darkness
trans: n.黑暗
example: 'We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness,' O'Brien had said to him.

name: meant
trans: 意味；打算（mean的过去式和过去分词）；表示…的意思
example: He knew what it meant, or thought he knew.

name: foreknowledge
trans: 预知；先见之明
example: The place where there is no darkness was the imagined future, which one would never see, but which, by foreknowledge, one could mystically share in.

name: mystically
trans: adj.神秘的
example: The place where there is no darkness was the imagined future, which one would never see, but which, by foreknowledge, one could mystically share in.

name: share
trans: v. (with)分配，共用；分担n. 一份，份额；股份
example: The place where there is no darkness was the imagined future, which one would never see, but which, by foreknowledge, one could mystically share in.

name: nagging
trans: adj.唠叨的，挑剔的,使人不得安宁的v.不断地挑剔或批评（某人）( nag的现在分词 ),不断地烦扰或伤害（某人）,无休止地抱怨,不断指责
example: But with the voice from the telescreen nagging at his ears he could not follow the train of thought further.

name: cigarette
trans: n. 香烟，纸烟，卷烟
example: He put a cigarette in his mouth.

name: bitter
trans: a. 有苦味的;辛酸的;怀恨的;n. 苦啤酒
example: Half the tobacco promptly fell out on to his tongue, a bitter dust which was difficult to spit out again.

name: displacing
trans: vt. 转移,取代
example: The face of Big Brother swam into his mind, displacing that of O'Brien.

name: coin
trans: n. 铸币,硬币 vt. 铸造,创造
example: Just as he had done a few days earlier, he slid a coin out of his pocket and looked at it.

name: calm

name: boring

name: departments

name: greater
trans: than,大于

trans: a. 腐败的,贪污的;v. (使)腐败,贿赂

trans: n. 柄，把手，拉手v. 处理，对待，操纵；触，抚养

trans: ad. 不管怎么说，无论如何；不论以何种方式

trans: num.十六，十六个

trans: ad. 另样，用别的方法；在其他方面conj. 要不然

trans: prep. 自从conj. 自从；因为，既然ad. 后来

name: Life
trans: n. 生命，生存；一生，寿命；生活；生物

trans: 一文不名的，破产的
打破，断掉（break的过去式）
(Broke)人名；(英)布罗克

name: rob
trans: v. (of)抢劫，盗取；非法剥夺

name: pleasures
trans: n. 愉快，快乐；乐事，乐趣

name: crudest
trans: a. 天然的;粗鲁的;粗制的

name: criticism
trans: n. 评论性的文章，评论；批评，指责，非难

trans: prep. 除…之外v. 除外；反对

name: doctrine

name: organized
trans: adj. 有组织的, 有条理的

name: failure
trans: n. 失败，不及格；失败者；故障，失灵；未能

name: clever
trans: a. 聪明的，伶俐的，机敏的，精巧的

name: accepting
trans: vt. 接受，领受；认可，同意vi. 同意，认可
example: He wondered vaguely how many others like her there might be in the younger generation people who had grown up in the world of the Revolution, knowing nothing else, accepting the Party as something unalterable, like the sky, not rebelling against its authority but simply evading it, as a rabbit dodges a dog.

name: rebelling
trans: v. 反抗，反叛，起义n. 叛逆者，起义者

trans: v.规避, 逃避, 躲避。

name: dodges
trans: v. 躲闪,躲开;搪塞;逃避

name: discuss
trans: vt. 讨论，商议

name: remote
trans: a. 远的，遥远的，疏远的，偏僻的，细微的

name: worth
trans: n. 价值a. 值…的，价值…的，值得…的

name: imaginable
trans: 可能的；可想像的

name: sanction
trans: n.批准, 同意, 支持, 制裁, 认可。v.批准, 同意, 支持, 鼓励, 认可。

trans: n. 白日梦
vi. 做白日梦

name: wife
trans: n. 妻子，夫人，太太

name: Julia
example: ' said Julia.

name: GOODTHINKFUL
example: 'She was--do you know the Newspeak word GOODTHINKFUL?

name: Meaning
trans: n. 意思，意义，含义；重要性，价值

name: didn
example: ' 'No, I didn't know the word, but I know the kind of person, right enough.

name: telling
trans: adj.有效的, 明显的, 生动的。

name: described
trans: a.被看到的，被发现的,,(di,si,chuai,bo,te)

name: stiffening
trans: 变硬；变猛烈；变粘

name: distasteful
trans: adj. 令人不快的；不合口味的；表示厌恶的

name: hadn
example: 'I could have stood it if it hadn't been for one thing,' he said.

name: frigid
trans: adj. 寒冷的，严寒的；冷淡的

name: ceremony
trans: n. 典礼,仪式,礼节

trans: v./n. 猜测，推测；以为；猜想

trans: adj.创造的v.创造( create的过去式和过去分词 ),引起,造成,封

trans: n. 活力，精力；能，能量

trans: int. 该死vt. 遣责；使失败a. 十足的ad. 极

trans: n. 熊;粗鲁的人;v. 携带;有,怀有;承受,忍受;生育

trans: v. 爆裂，炸破；突然发生n. 突然破裂，爆发

name: energy
trans: n. 活力，精力；能，能量

trans: n. 装置，设备，仪表；方法，设计

name: informers

name: Kent

example: In the labyrinthine Ministry the windowless, air-conditioned rooms kept their normal temperature, but outside the pavements scorched one's feet and the stench of the Tubes at the rush hours was a horror.

name: scorched
trans: vt./vi. 烧焦,烤焦,枯萎
example: In the labyrinthine Ministry the windowless, air-conditioned rooms kept their normal temperature, but outside the pavements scorched one's feet and the stench of the Tubes at the rush hours was a horror.

name: stench
trans: 恶臭；臭气
使…散发恶臭
发恶臭
example: In the labyrinthine Ministry the windowless, air-conditioned rooms kept their normal temperature, but outside the pavements scorched one's feet and the stench of the Tubes at the rush hours was a horror.

name: Tubes
trans: n. 管，软管；电子管，显像管；地铁
example: In the labyrinthine Ministry the windowless, air-conditioned rooms kept their normal temperature, but outside the pavements scorched one's feet and the stench of the Tubes at the rush hours was a horror.

name: staffs
trans: n. 木棍,杆,工作人员
example: The preparations for Hate Week were in full swing, and the staffs of all the Ministries were working overtime.

name: overtime
trans: a. 超时的，加班的ad. 加班
example: The preparations for Hate Week were in full swing, and the staffs of all the Ministries were working overtime.

name: Processions
trans: n. 队伍，行列
example: Processions, meetings, military parades, lectures, waxworks, displays, film shows, telescreen programmes all had to be organized; stands had to be erected, effigies built, slogans coined, songs written, rumours circulated, photographs faked.

name: waxworks
example: Processions, meetings, military parades, lectures, waxworks, displays, film shows, telescreen programmes all had to be organized; stands had to be erected, effigies built, slogans coined, songs written, rumours circulated, photographs faked.

name: stands
trans: vi. 站立；位于；经受n. 台，座；货摊；立场
example: Processions, meetings, military parades, lectures, waxworks, displays, film shows, telescreen programmes all had to be organized; stands had to be erected, effigies built, slogans coined, songs written, rumours circulated, photographs faked.

name: effigies
example: Processions, meetings, military parades, lectures, waxworks, displays, film shows, telescreen programmes all had to be organized; stands had to be erected, effigies built, slogans coined, songs written, rumours circulated, photographs faked.

name: coined
trans: n. 铸币,硬币 vt. 铸造,创造
example: Processions, meetings, military parades, lectures, waxworks, displays, film shows, telescreen programmes all had to be organized; stands had to be erected, effigies built, slogans coined, songs written, rumours circulated, photographs faked.

name: unit
trans: n. 单位，单元；部件，元件；机组，装置
example: Julia's unit in the Fiction Department had been taken off the production of novels and was rushing out a series of atrocity pamphlets.

name: rushing
trans: adj.急流的，旺盛的v.（使）急速行进，仓促完成( rush的现在分词 ),突袭,（使）仓促行事,催促
example: Julia's unit in the Fiction Department had been taken off the production of novels and was rushing out a series of atrocity pamphlets.

name: atrocity
trans: n. 暴行；凶恶，残暴
example: Julia's unit in the Fiction Department had been taken off the production of novels and was rushing out a series of atrocity pamphlets.

name: addition
trans: n. 加，加法；附加部分，增加(物)
example: Winston, in addition to his regular work, spent long periods every day in going through back files of 'The Times' and altering and embellishing news items which were to be quoted in speeches.

name: regular
trans: a. 有规律的；整齐的，匀称的，正规的，正式的
example: Winston, in addition to his regular work, spent long periods every day in going through back files of 'The Times' and altering and embellishing news items which were to be quoted in speeches.

name: altering
trans: v. 改变,更改
example: Winston, in addition to his regular work, spent long periods every day in going through back files of 'The Times' and altering and embellishing news items which were to be quoted in speeches.

name: embellishing
trans: vt. 美化；装饰；修饰；润色时 态: embellished，embellishing，embellishes
example: Winston, in addition to his regular work, spent long periods every day in going through back files of 'The Times' and altering and embellishing news items which were to be quoted in speeches.

name: quoted
trans: v. 引用，援引
example: Winston, in addition to his regular work, spent long periods every day in going through back files of 'The Times' and altering and embellishing news items which were to be quoted in speeches.

name: Late
trans: a. 迟的，晚的，晚期的；已故的ad. 迟，晚
example: Late at night, when crowds of rowdy proles roamed the streets, the town had a curiously febrile air.

name: crowds
trans: n. 人群；一群，一伙v. 聚集，群集；挤满，拥挤
example: Late at night, when crowds of rowdy proles roamed the streets, the town had a curiously febrile air.

name: febrile
trans: adj. 发热的；发烧的；热病的
example: Late at night, when crowds of rowdy proles roamed the streets, the town had a curiously febrile air.

name: explosions
trans: n. 爆炸，爆发
example: The rocket bombs crashed oftener than ever, and sometimes in the far distance there were enormous explosions which no one could explain and about which there were wild rumours.

name: explain
trans: v. 解释，说明
example: The rocket bombs crashed oftener than ever, and sometimes in the far distance there were enormous explosions which no one could explain and about which there were wild rumours.

name: theme
trans: n. 题目,主题
example: The new tune which was to be the theme-song of Hate Week (the Hate Song, it was called) had already been composed and was being endlessly plugged on the telescreens.

name: Song
trans: n. 歌唱，(虫、鸟等)鸣声；歌曲，歌词
example: The new tune which was to be the theme-song of Hate Week (the Hate Song, it was called) had already been composed and was being endlessly plugged on the telescreens.

name: barking
trans: n./v. 树皮,狗叫
example: It had a savage, barking rhythm which could not exactly be called music, but resembled the beating of a drum.

name: rhythm
trans: n. 韵律,格律,有规律的反复(循环),周期性
example: It had a savage, barking rhythm which could not exactly be called music, but resembled the beating of a drum.

name: Roared
trans: n./v. 吼叫,怒吼,轰鸣
example: Roared out by hundreds of voices to the tramp of marching feet, it was terrifying.

name: midnight
trans: n.午夜，子夜，夜半
example: The proles had taken a fancy to it, and in the midnight streets it competed with the still-popular 'It was only a hopeless fancy'.

name: competed
trans: vi. 比赛；竞争；对抗
example: The proles had taken a fancy to it, and in the midnight streets it competed with the still-popular 'It was only a hopeless fancy'.

name: toilet
trans: n. 厕所，盥洗室
example: The Parsons children played it at all hours of the night and day, unbearably, on a comb and a piece of toilet paper.

name: fuller
trans: a. (of)满的，充满的a./ad. 完全，充分
example: Winston's evenings were fuller than ever.

name: Squads
trans: n. (军队中的)班, 小队
example: Squads of volunteers, organized by Parsons, were preparing the street for Hate Week, stitching banners, painting posters, erecting flagstaffs on the roofs, and perilously slinging wires across the street for the reception of streamers.

name: volunteers
trans: 志愿者

用投石器投掷；吊起
example: Squads of volunteers, organized by Parsons, were preparing the street for Hate Week, stitching banners, painting posters, erecting flagstaffs on the roofs, and perilously slinging wires across the street for the reception of streamers.

name: wires
trans: n. [电] 电线；线变形器（wire的复数）；小五金；网格
example: Squads of volunteers, organized by Parsons, were preparing the street for Hate Week, stitching banners, painting posters, erecting flagstaffs on the roofs, and perilously slinging wires across the street for the reception of streamers.

trans: n. 招待会,接收,接待处

name: streamers
trans: n.（作装饰用的）彩色纸带,长条旗
example: Squads of volunteers, organized by Parsons, were preparing the street for Hate Week, stitching banners, painting posters, erecting flagstaffs on the roofs, and perilously slinging wires across the street for the reception of streamers.

name: boasted
trans: n./v. 自夸;自豪地拥有
example: Parsons boasted that Victory Mansions alone would display four hundred metres of bunting.

name: bunting
trans: 小圆面包
example: Parsons boasted that Victory Mansions alone would display four hundred metres of bunting.

name: native
trans: a. 本地的，本国的；天生的n. 本地人，本国人
example: He was in his native element and as happy as a lark.

name: element
trans: n. 元素；要素；成分；元件；自然环境
example: He was in his native element and as happy as a lark.

name: lark
trans: n.云雀，百灵鸟
example: He was in his native element and as happy as a lark.

name: manual
trans: a. 手工的,用手的;n. 手册;便览
example: The heat and the manual work had even given him a pretext for reverting to shorts and an open shirt in the evenings.

name: reverting
trans: v.回复到，重议
example: The heat and the manual work had even given him a pretext for reverting to shorts and an open shirt in the evenings.

name: pulling
trans: v. 拉，拖n. 拉，拖；拉力，牵引力
example: He was everywhere at once, pushing, pulling, sawing, hammering, improvising, jollying everyone along with comradely exhortations and giving out from every fold of his body what seemed an inexhaustible supply of acrid-smelling sweat.

name: sawing
trans: n. 锯子，锯床v. 锯，锯开

trans: 愉快的；欢乐的；宜人的
很；非常
（口）用好话劝某人做…；（口）用好话使高兴
(Jolly)人名；(法)若利；(英、印)乔利；(德)约利
