name: poster
trans: n.海报, 招贴, (布告, 标语, 海报等的)张贴者。
example: A new poster had suddenly appeared all over London.

name: striding
trans: v./n. 大踏步走
example: It had no caption, and represented simply the monstrous figure of a Eurasian soldier, three or four metres high, striding forward with expressionless Mongolian face and enormous boots, a submachine gun pointed from his hip.

name: submachine
example: It had no caption, and represented simply the monstrous figure of a Eurasian soldier, three or four metres high, striding forward with expressionless Mongolian face and enormous boots, a submachine gun pointed from his hip.

name: hip
trans: n. 臀部，髋；屋脊
example: It had no caption, and represented simply the monstrous figure of a Eurasian soldier, three or four metres high, striding forward with expressionless Mongolian face and enormous boots, a submachine gun pointed from his hip.

name: muzzle
trans: 枪口，炮口；口套，口络；动物的鼻口
使…缄默；给…戴口套；封锁…的言论
example: From whatever angle you looked at the poster, the muzzle of the gun, magnified by the foreshortening, seemed to be pointed straight at you.

name: foreshortening
example: From whatever angle you looked at the poster, the muzzle of the gun, magnified by the foreshortening, seemed to be pointed straight at you.

name: outnumbering
trans: 数目超过；比…多
example: The thing had been plastered on every blank space on every wall, even outnumbering the portraits of Big Brother.

name: portraits
trans: n. 肖像，画像
example: The thing had been plastered on every blank space on every wall, even outnumbering the portraits of Big Brother.

name: apathetic
trans: adj. 冷漠的；无动于衷的，缺乏兴趣的
example: The proles, normally apathetic about the war, were being lashed into one of their periodical frenzies of patriotism.

name: lashed
trans: n.鞭子, 鞭打, 睫毛, 责骂, 讽刺。vt.鞭打, 摆动, 扎捆, 冲击, 煽动, 讽刺。vi.猛击, 急速甩动。
example: The proles, normally apathetic about the war, were being lashed into one of their periodical frenzies of patriotism.

name: periodical
trans: a. 周期的;定期的;n. 期刊;杂志
example: The proles, normally apathetic about the war, were being lashed into one of their periodical frenzies of patriotism.

name: frenzies
example: The proles, normally apathetic about the war, were being lashed into one of their periodical frenzies of patriotism.

name: harmonize
trans: vt.使和谐,为（旋律）配和声vi.和谐,以和声演奏或歌唱
example: As though to harmonize with the general mood, the rocket bombs had been killing larger numbers of people than usual.

name: killing
trans: adj. 杀害的；迷人的；使人筋疲力尽的
n. 谋杀；杀戮；猎获物
v. 杀死；消磨；毁掉（kill的ing形式）副 词:killingly
example: As though to harmonize with the general mood, the rocket bombs had been killing larger numbers of people than usual.

name: theatre
trans: n.戏院；戏剧；教室
example: One fell on a crowded film theatre in Stepney, burying several hundred victims among the ruins.

name: Stepney
example: One fell on a crowded film theatre in Stepney, burying several hundred victims among the ruins.

name: burying
trans: v. 埋(葬)，安葬；埋藏，遮盖
example: One fell on a crowded film theatre in Stepney, burying several hundred victims among the ruins.

name: victims
trans: n. 牺牲品，受害者

name: trailing
trans: n.&,a.结尾；尾随的
example: The whole population of the neighbourhood turned out for a long, trailing funeral which went on for hours and was in effect an indignation meeting.

name: indignation
trans: n. 愤怒，愤慨
example: The whole population of the neighbourhood turned out for a long, trailing funeral which went on for hours and was in effect an indignation meeting.

name: playground
trans: n. 运动场，游戏场
example: Another bomb fell on a piece of waste ground which was used as a playground and several dozen children were blown to pieces.

name: burned
trans: v.（使）燃烧( burn的过去式和过去分词 ),使用某物为燃料,烧毁,烧坏
example: There were further angry demonstrations, Goldstein was burned in effigy, hundreds of copies of the poster of the Eurasian soldier were torn down and added to the flames, and a number of shops were looted in the turmoil; then a rumour flew round that spies were directing the rocket bombs by means of wireless waves, and an old couple who were suspected of being of foreign extraction had their house set on fire and perished of suffocation.

name: sake
trans: n. 缘故;目的

name: multiplied

name: seem
trans: v. 好像，似乎

name: Dirty
trans: a. 弄脏的；下流的v. 弄脏，玷污
example: Dirty or clean, the room was paradise.

name: paradise
trans: n. 天国,乐园

trans: n. 洒，喷，淋

name: June
example: Four, five, six--seven times they met during the month of June.

name: drinking

example: Winston had dropped his habit of drinking gin at all hours.

name: lost
trans: adj.失去的

name: fatter
trans: a. 多脂肪的，肥胖的；丰厚的n. 脂肪，肥肉
example: He had grown fatter, his varicose ulcer had subsided, leaving only a brown stain on the skin above his ankle, his fits of coughing in the early morning had stopped.

name: subsided
trans: v.下沉, 沉淀, 平息, 减退, 衰减。

trans: a. (病的)发作，痉挛v./a. n. 合适，试穿，安装

name: hardship
trans: n. 艰难，困苦

name: infrequently
trans: adv.稀少地，珍贵地
example: Now that they had a secure hiding-place, almost a home, it did not even seem a hardship that they could only meet infrequently and for a couple of hours at a time.

name: junk
trans: n.垃圾, 舢板。
example: What mattered was that the room over the junk-shop should exist.

name: inviolate
trans: adj. 不受侵犯的 未受损害的
example: To know that it was there, inviolate, was almost the same as being in it.

name: extinct
trans: a. 灭绝的;(火山)不再活跃的;(风俗)废弃的
example: The room was a world, a pocket of the past where extinct animals could walk.

name: extinct
trans: a. 灭绝的;(火山)不再活跃的;(风俗)废弃的
example: Mr Charrington, thought Winston, was another extinct animal.

name: upstairs
trans: ad. 向楼上；在楼上；上楼ad. 楼上的

name: customers
trans: n. 客户；[贸易] 顾客（customer的复数）
example: The old man seemed seldom or never to go out of doors, and on the other hand to have almost no customers.

name: ghostlike

trans: n. 罐头；锡a. 锡制的vt. 镀锡于

example: He led a ghostlike existence between the tiny, dark shop, and an even tinier back kitchen where he prepared his meals and which contained, among other things, an unbelievably ancient gramophone with an enormous horn.

name: opportunity

name: Wandering
trans: adj.漫游的,闲逛的,（精神）恍惚的,错乱的n.流浪,神志恍惚,精神错乱v.漫游( wander的现在分词 ),走神,神志恍惚,（思想）开小差
example: Wandering about among his worthless stock, with his long nose and thick spectacles and his bowed shoulders in the velvet jacket, he had always vaguely the air of being a collector rather than a tradesman.

用塞子塞住
example: With a sort of faded enthusiasm he would finger this scrap of rubbish or that--a china bottle-stopper, the painted lid of a broken snuffbox, a pinchbeck locket containing a strand of some long-dead baby's hair--never asking that Winston should buy it, merely that he should admire it.

name: tinkling

叮当声

name: musical
trans: a. 音乐的；有音乐才能的n. 音乐片
example: To talk to him was like listening to the tinkling of a worn-out musical-box.

name: corners
trans: n.角落，拐角
example: He had dragged out from the corners of his memory some more fragments of forgotten rhymes.

name: blackbirds
example: There was one about four and twenty blackbirds, and another about a cow with a crumpled horn, and another about the death of poor Cock Robin.

name: cow
trans: n. 母牛，奶牛
example: There was one about four and twenty blackbirds, and another about a cow with a crumpled horn, and another about the death of poor Cock Robin.

name: Cock
trans: n. 公鸡，雄鸡；龙头，开关
example: There was one about four and twenty blackbirds, and another about a cow with a crumpled horn, and another about the death of poor Cock Robin.

name: Robin
trans: 知更鸟
example: There was one about four and twenty blackbirds, and another about a cow with a crumpled horn, and another about the death of poor Cock Robin.

name: deprecating
trans: vt. 反对；抨击；轻视；声明不赞成
example: 'It just occurred to me you might be interested,' he would say with a deprecating little laugh whenever he produced a new fragment.

name: laugh
trans: v. 笑；(on)讥笑n. 笑，笑声
example: 'It just occurred to me you might be interested,' he would say with a deprecating little laugh whenever he produced a new fragment.

name: recall
trans: vt./n. 召回;回忆
example: But he could never recall more than a few lines of any one rhyme.

name: Both
trans: prep. 两者(都)，双方(都)adj. 两个…(都)

name: impending
trans: 即将发生的

极；非常
咒骂；诅咒…下地狱（damn的过去式）
example: There were times when the fact of impending death seemed as palpable as the bed they lay on, and they would cling together with a sort of despairing sensuality, like a damned soul grasping at his last morsel of pleasure when the clock is within five minutes of striking.

trans: adj. 贪婪的；紧紧抓住的 v. 抓紧，抓牢；理解，领会（gr asp的现在分词形式）

name: safety
trans: n. 安全，保险；安全设备，保险装置
example: But there were also times when they had the illusion not only of safety but of permanence.

name: permanence
trans: n.永久，持久
example: But there were also times when they had the illusion not only of safety but of permanence.

name: harm
trans: n./v. 伤害，损害，危害
example: So long as they were actually in this room, they both felt, no harm could come to them.

name: Getting
trans: v. 获得，得到；使，使得；变得，成为；到达

name: sanctuary
trans: 避难所，圣所
example: Getting there was difficult and dangerous, but the room itself was sanctuary.

name: glassy
trans: adj.似玻璃的,像玻璃一样光滑的,（眼神）呆滞的,无生气的adv.（目光）呆滞地，无生气地
example: It was as when Winston had gazed into the heart of the paperweight, with the feeling that it would be possible to get inside that glassy world, and that once inside it time could be arrested.

name: Often
trans: ad. 常常，经常，通常
example: Often they gave themselves up to daydreams of escape.

name: daydreams
trans: n. 白日梦
vi. 做白日梦
example: Often they gave themselves up to daydreams of escape.

name: indefinitely
trans: adv.不明确地

trans: n.阴谋, 诡计。vi.密谋, 私通。vt.激起...的兴趣, 用诡计取得

example: Or Katharine would die, and by subtle manoeuvrings Winston and Julia would succeed in getting married.

name: succeed
trans: vi. 成功；继承，接替vt. 接替；继…之后
example: Or Katharine would die, and by subtle manoeuvrings Winston and Julia would succeed in getting married.

name: suicide
trans: n. 自杀
example: Or they would commit suicide together.

name: accents
trans: n. 口音，腔调；重音(符号)vt. 重读
example: Or they would disappear, alter themselves out of recognition, learn to speak with proletarian accents, get jobs in a factory and live out their lives undetected in a back-street.

name: factory
trans: n. 工厂
example: Or they would disappear, alter themselves out of recognition, learn to speak with proletarian accents, get jobs in a factory and live out their lives undetected in a back-street.

name: undetected
trans: adj.未被觉察的，未被发现的,未探测到的
example: Or they would disappear, alter themselves out of recognition, learn to speak with proletarian accents, get jobs in a factory and live out their lives undetected in a back-street.

name: nonsense
trans: n. 胡说，废话
example: It was all nonsense, as they both knew.

name: escape
trans: n. 逃跑，逃脱v. 逃跑；避开，避免
example: In reality there was no escape.

name: plan
trans: n. 计划，规划；平面图，设计图v. 计划

name: practicable

name: intention
trans: n. 意图，意向，目的
example: Even the one plan that was practicable, suicide, they had no intention of carrying out.

name: hang
trans: v. 悬挂，垂吊；吊死，绞死

name: spinning
trans: n.纺纱v.使…旋转( spin的现在分词 ),纺（线）,杜撰,（使）急转身
example: To hang on from day to day and from week to week, spinning out a present that had no future, seemed an unconquerable instinct, just as one's lungs will always draw the next breath so long as there is air available.

trans: adj. 不可征服的,克服不了的,压制不了的
example: To hang on from day to day and from week to week, spinning out a present that had no future, seemed an unconquerable instinct, just as one's lungs will always draw the next breath so long as there is air available.

trans: a. 可获得的,可用的

name: engaging

v. 保证；雇用；参加（engage的ing形式）副 词:engagingly
example: Sometimes, too, they talked of engaging in active rebellion against the Party, but with no notion of how to take the first step.

name: fabulous
trans: adj.寓言中的, 寓言般的, 神话般的, 传统上的, 惊人的, 难以置信的。
example: Even if the fabulous Brotherhood was a reality, there still remained the difficulty of finding one's way into it.

name: intimacy
trans: n. 性行为；亲密；亲昵行为；隐私
example: He told her of the strange intimacy that existed, or seemed to exist, between himself and O'Brien, and of the impulse he sometimes felt, simply to walk into O'Brien's presence, announce that he was the enemy of the Party, and demand his help.

name: impossibly
trans: adv.不可能地，无法可想
example: Curiously enough, this did not strike her as an impossibly rash thing to do.

name: judging
trans: n. 法官；裁判员；鉴定人vt. 审判；评论，裁判
example: She was used to judging people by their faces, and it seemed natural to her that Winston should believe O'Brien to be trustworthy on the strength of a single flash of the eyes.

name: trustworthy
trans: adj.可信赖的。

name: secretly
trans: ad
v. 秘密地;背地里
example: Moreover she took it for granted that everyone, or nearly everyone, secretly hated the Party and would break the rules if he thought it safe to do so.

name: widespread
trans: a. 分布广泛的，普遍的
example: But she refused to believe that widespread, organized opposition existed or could exist.

name: opposition
trans: n.敌对，反抗
example: But she refused to believe that widespread, organized opposition existed or could exist.

name: tales
trans: n. 故事，传说

name: rallies
example: Times beyond number, at Party rallies and spontaneous demonstrations, she had shouted at the top of her voice for the execution of people whose names she had never heard and in whose supposed crimes she had not the faintest belief.

name: faintest
trans: a. 微弱的;不清楚的;n./vi. 昏晕

name: detachments
trans: 分离，拆开；超然；分遣；分遣队
example: When public trials were happening she had taken her place in the detachments from the Youth League who surrounded the courts from morning to night, chanting at intervals 'Death to the traitors!

name: courts
trans: n. 法院，法庭；宫廷，朝廷；院子；球场
example: When public trials were happening she had taken her place in the detachments from the Youth League who surrounded the courts from morning to night, chanting at intervals 'Death to the traitors!

name: Death
trans: n. 死，死亡；灭亡，毁灭，死因
example: When public trials were happening she had taken her place in the detachments from the Youth League who surrounded the courts from morning to night, chanting at intervals 'Death to the traitors!

name: excelled
trans: v. 杰出,胜过,优于
example: ' During the Two Minutes Hate she always excelled all others in shouting insults at Goldstein.

name: insults
trans: vt. 侮辱,凌辱;n. 侮辱的言词或行为
example: ' During the Two Minutes Hate she always excelled all others in shouting insults at Goldstein.

name: dimmest
trans: a. 暗的,看不清楚的,迟钝的;v. 变模糊,变暗淡
example: Yet she had only the dimmest idea of who Goldstein was and what doctrines he was supposed to represent.

name: battles
trans: n. 战役，战斗；斗争v. 战斗，斗争，搏斗
example: She had grown up since the Revolution and was too young to remember the ideological battles of the fifties and sixties.

name: independent
trans: a. (of)独立的，自主的
example: Such a thing as an independent political movement was outside her imagination: and in any case the Party was invincible.

name: imagination
trans: n. 想象(力)；空想，幻觉；想象出来的事物
example: Such a thing as an independent political movement was outside her imagination: and in any case the Party was invincible.

name: invincible
trans: adj.不能征服的, 无敌的。
example: Such a thing as an independent political movement was outside her imagination: and in any case the Party was invincible.

name: exist
trans: v. 存在；生存；生活
example: It would always exist, and it would always be the same.

name: disobedience
trans: 不服从；违反，违抗
example: You could only rebel against it by secret disobedience or, at most, by isolated acts of violence such as killing somebody or blowing something up.

name: isolated
trans: adj. 孤立的；分离的；绝缘的；单独的
v. 使孤立；使绝缘；脱离（isolate的过去分词）
example: You could only rebel against it by secret disobedience or, at most, by isolated acts of violence such as killing somebody or blowing something up.

name: violence
trans: n. 猛烈，强烈；暴力，暴行；强暴
example: You could only rebel against it by secret disobedience or, at most, by isolated acts of violence such as killing somebody or blowing something up.

name: acute
trans: a. 厉害的;敏锐的;(疾病等)急性的

name: susceptible
trans: adj.易受影响的, 易感动的, 容许...的。n.(因缺乏免疫力而)易得病的人。
example: In some ways she was far more acute than Winston, and far less susceptible to Party propaganda.

name: startled
trans: adj.受惊吓的v.使惊跳，使大吃一惊( startle的过去式和过去分词 )
example: Once when he happened in some connexion to mention the war against Eurasia, she startled him by saying casually that in her opinion the war was not happening.

name: fired
trans: v.开火，射击( fire的过去式和过去分词 ),<口>解雇,射（箭）,激励
example: The rocket bombs which fell daily on London were probably fired by the Government of Oceania itself, 'just to keep people frightened'.

name: Government
trans: n. 政府，内阁；管理，支配；政治，政体
example: The rocket bombs which fell daily on London were probably fired by the Government of Oceania itself, 'just to keep people frightened'.

name: literally
trans: ad. 照字义地,逐字地
example: This was an idea that had literally never occurred to him.

name: envy
trans: n./vt. 妒忌,妒忌的对象;羡慕
example: She also stirred a sort of envy in him by telling him that during the Two Minutes Hate her great difficulty was to avoid bursting out laughing.

name: laughing
trans: adj.笑的,笑柄,走运,决不是开玩笑的事v.笑( laugh的现在分词 ),发笑,嘲笑,（特别表示因成功而）处于有利地位
example: She also stirred a sort of envy in him by telling him that during the Two Minutes Hate her great difficulty was to avoid bursting out laughing.

name: teachings
trans: n.教学，讲授；教导
example: But she only questioned the teachings of the Party when they in some way touched upon her own life.

name: mythology
trans: n. 神话学

name: falsehood
trans: 谎言

name: learnt
example: She believed, for instance, having learnt it at school, that the Party had invented aeroplanes.

name: schooldays
example: (In his own schooldays, Winston remembered, in the late fifties, it was only the helicopter that the Party claimed to have invented; a dozen years later, when Julia was at school, it was already claiming the aeroplane; one generation more, and it would be claiming the steam engine.

name: claiming
trans: n. 要求;有所根据而索取的款项;要求权;要求之物; v. 要求承认;宣称;值得

name: aeroplane
trans: n.飞机
example: (In his own schooldays, Winston remembered, in the late fifties, it was only the helicopter that the Party claimed to have invented; a dozen years later, when Julia was at school, it was already claiming the aeroplane; one generation more, and it would be claiming the steam engine.

name: engine
trans: n. 发动机，引擎；火车头
example: (In his own schooldays, Winston remembered, in the late fifties, it was only the helicopter that the Party claimed to have invented; a dozen years later, when Julia was at school, it was already claiming the aeroplane; one generation more, and it would be claiming the steam engine.

name: uninteresting
trans: a. 有趣的，引人入胜的
example: ) And when he told her that aeroplanes had been in existence before he was born and long before the Revolution, the fact struck her as totally uninteresting.

name: aeroplanes
trans: n.飞机
example: After all, what did it matter who had invented aeroplanes?

name: shock
trans: n./vt. (使)震惊

name: regarded
trans: v. (as)把…看作为；考虑n. (pl.)敬重，问候
example: It was true that she regarded the whole war as a sham: but apparently she had not even noticed that the name of the enemy had changed.

name: sham
trans: n./a. 假冒(的)，虚伪(的)

name: vaguely
trans: 含糊地；暧昧地；茫然地

name: frightened
trans: adj. 害怕的

name: invention
trans: n. 发明，创造，发明物

name: dated
trans: adj. 陈旧的；过时的；有日期的 v. 注有日期（date 的过去式和过去分词）

name: switchover

name: argued
trans: v. 不同意,辩论

trans: n. 力量，力；势力；(pl.)(总称)军队v. 强迫

name: cares

name: anyway
trans: ad. 不管怎么说，无论如何；不论以何种方式

name: abyss
trans: 深渊；深邃，无底洞，地狱

name: she
trans: pron. (主格)她

trans: vt. 知道，了解；认识；识别vi. 知道，了解

name: aren

trans: n.出发，开始

trans: v. 幸免于，幸存；比…长命

trans: adv.已经

name: repainted
trans: vt.重画,,(rui,pen,te)

name: renamed
trans: vt.更名，改名

trans: n. 历史，历史学；来历，经历

trans: v. 占有，拥有

name: good
trans: a. 好的；善良的；擅长的；乖的n. 好处；利益
example: ' 'And what good was that?

name: threw
trans: vt. 扔；使突然陷入；使困惑n. 投掷(距离)

name: today
trans: ad. 在今天；现今，在当代n. 今天；现在

name: Well
trans: ad. 好，令人满意地；很int. 哎呀，好啦，嗯

trans: n. 风险，危险（risk复数）

name: kept
trans: v. 保持，保存，遵守，经营，看守，拘留，维持

name: Not
trans: ad. 不，不是，不会；没有
example: ' 'Not much, perhaps.

name: evidence
trans: n. 明显；显著；根据；证据；迹象

name: doubts

trans: n. 绳结;结合;树节;海里;小群人;v. 打结

name: interested

name: interested

trans: a. [哲

name: evenings

name: servant

name: conceal

name: memorized

name: episode

name: enquiry

name: directories

name: saying

说（say的ing形式）

name: concealed
trans: adj.隐藏的v.隐藏，隐瞒，遮住( conceal的过去式和过去分词 )

name: rate

name: conspiracy

唤出；传到；传唤到法院
example: He knew that sooner or later he would obey O'Brien's summons.

name: delay
trans: v./n. 耽搁，延迟

name: actions

name: accepted

先试；预尝；快乐地期待

name: sunk

name: dampness

name: woken

name: dreamt

name: luminous

name: dome

name: comprehended
trans: vt. 理解，领会；包含，包括

name: murder
trans: v./n. 谋杀，凶杀

name: asleep

name: murder

name: rackety

example: One did not know what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was possible to guess: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that registered your nervous reactions, gradual wearing-down by sleeplessness and solitude and persistent questioning.

name: reactions
trans: n.反应；反作用
example: One did not know what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was possible to guess: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that registered your nervous reactions, gradual wearing-down by sleeplessness and solitude and persistent questioning.

name: gradual
trans: a. 逐渐的,不陡的
example: One did not know what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was possible to guess: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that registered your nervous reactions, gradual wearing-down by sleeplessness and solitude and persistent questioning.

name: persistent
trans: adj.持久稳固的。
example: One did not know what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was possible to guess: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that registered your nervous reactions, gradual wearing-down by sleeplessness and solitude and persistent questioning.

name: questioning
trans: adj.怀疑的，探询的v.问（某人）问题( question的现在分词 ),对（某事物）表示感到怀疑
example: One did not know what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was possible to guess: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that registered your nervous reactions, gradual wearing-down by sleeplessness and solitude and persistent questioning.

name: Facts
trans: n. 事实，实际
example: Facts, at any rate, could not be kept hidden.

name: tracked
trans: n./v. 行踪;踪迹;跟踪;n. 路径
example: They could be tracked down by enquiry, they could be squeezed out of you by torture.

name: squeezed
trans: vt./vi. 挤,榨
example: They could be tracked down by enquiry, they could be squeezed out of you by torture.

name: ultimately
trans: ad.最终，最后
example: But if the object was not to stay alive but to stay human, what difference did it ultimately make?

name: alter
trans: v. 改变,更改
example: They could not alter your feelings: for that matter you could not alter them yourself, even if you wanted to.

name: bare
trans: a. 赤裸的;光秃秃的;刚刚够的,勉强的; vt. 露出,暴露
example: They could lay bare in the utmost detail everything that you had done or said or thought; but the inner heart, whose workings were mysterious even to yourself, remained impregnable.

name: utmost
trans: a. 最远的,最大的,极度的
example: They could lay bare in the utmost detail everything that you had done or said or thought; but the inner heart, whose workings were mysterious even to yourself, remained impregnable.

name: workings
trans: adj. 工作的；操作的；可行的
n. 工作；制作；活动；操纵
v. 工作；影响；受雇用（work的ing形式）
example: They could lay bare in the utmost detail everything that you had done or said or thought; but the inner heart, whose workings were mysterious even to yourself, remained impregnable.

name: Chapter
trans: n. 章；回，篇
example: Chapter 8 They had done it, they had done it at last!

name: shaped
trans: adj. …形状的合适的有计划的；有目标的
example: The room they were standing in was long-shaped and softly lit.

name: richness
trans: n.富饶，富有
example: The telescreen was dimmed to a low murmur; the richness of the dark-blue carpet gave one the impression of treading on velvet.

name: treading
trans: vi.&vt.踩，踏，践踏
example: The telescreen was dimmed to a low murmur; the richness of the dark-blue carpet gave one the impression of treading on velvet.

name: shaded
trans: v.遮蔽住，使阴暗(shade的过去式和过去分词),险胜,加灯罩,画阴影于…之上
example: At the far end of the room O'Brien was sitting at a table under a green-shaded lamp, with a mass of papers on either side of him.

name: bothered
trans: v./n. 麻烦,打扰
example: He had not bothered to look up when the servant showed Julia and Winston in.

name: thumping
trans: v. 重击，捶击；（心脏）怦怦跳；砰地作响；重步走（或前行），重重（或狠狠）地做；<非正式>彻底击垮；头痛欲裂 n. 重击，捶击；重击声；（尤指恐惧、激动引起的）心脏怦怦跳动声
example: Winston's heart was thumping so hard that he doubted whether he would be able to speak.

name: doubted
trans: n./v. 怀疑，疑虑
example: Winston's heart was thumping so hard that he doubted whether he would be able to speak.

name: last
trans: a. 最后的，刚过去的ad. 最后n. 最后v. 持续
example: They had done it, they had done it at last, was all he could think.

name: routes
trans: n. 路线，路程
example: It had been a rash act to come here at all, and sheer folly to arrive together; though it was true that they had come by different routes and only met on O'Brien's doorstep.

name: doorstep
trans: n.门阶,厚三明治或面包v.上门访问
example: It had been a rash act to come here at all, and sheer folly to arrive together; though it was true that they had come by different routes and only met on O'Brien's doorstep.

name: nerve
trans: n. 神经；勇敢，胆量
example: But merely to walk into such a place needed an effort of the nerve.

name: rare
trans: a. 稀有的，难得的，珍奇的；稀薄的，稀疏的
example: It was only on very rare occasions that one saw inside the dwelling-places of the Inner Party, or even penetrated into the quarter of the town where they lived.

name: spaciousness
example: The whole atmosphere of the huge block of flats, the richness and spaciousness of everything, the unfamiliar smells of good food and good tobacco, the silent and incredibly rapid lifts sliding up and down, the white-jacketed servants hurrying to and fro--everything was intimidating.

name: incredibly
trans: 难以置信地；非常地
example: The whole atmosphere of the huge block of flats, the richness and spaciousness of everything, the unfamiliar smells of good food and good tobacco, the silent and incredibly rapid lifts sliding up and down, the white-jacketed servants hurrying to and fro--everything was intimidating.

name: sliding
trans: adj.滑行的，变化的v.滑动，滑行( slide的现在分词 ),滑落,下跌,打滑
example: The whole atmosphere of the huge block of flats, the richness and spaciousness of everything, the unfamiliar smells of good food and good tobacco, the silent and incredibly rapid lifts sliding up and down, the white-jacketed servants hurrying to and fro--everything was intimidating.

name: jacketed
trans: n. 短上衣，茄克衫
example: The whole atmosphere of the huge block of flats, the richness and spaciousness of everything, the unfamiliar smells of good food and good tobacco, the silent and incredibly rapid lifts sliding up and down, the white-jacketed servants hurrying to and fro--everything was intimidating.

name: intimidating
trans: adj. 吓人的
example: The whole atmosphere of the huge block of flats, the richness and spaciousness of everything, the unfamiliar smells of good food and good tobacco, the silent and incredibly rapid lifts sliding up and down, the white-jacketed servants hurrying to and fro--everything was intimidating.

name: Although
trans: conj. 尽管，虽然…但是
example: Although he had a good pretext for coming here, he was haunted at every step by the fear that a black-uniformed guard would suddenly appear from round the corner, demand his papers, and order him to get out.

name: haunted
trans: adj.闹鬼的,忧心忡忡的v.“haunt”的过去式和过去分词
example: Although he had a good pretext for coming here, he was haunted at every step by the fear that a black-uniformed guard would suddenly appear from round the corner, demand his papers, and order him to get out.

name: uniformed
trans: adj.穿制服的，穿军服的vt.使统一，穿制服(uniform的过去式和过去分词)
example: Although he had a good pretext for coming here, he was haunted at every step by the fear that a black-uniformed guard would suddenly appear from round the corner, demand his papers, and order him to get out.

name: demur
trans: vi. 反对；抗辩；提出异议 n. 异议；反对 n. （Demur）人名；（德）德穆尔；（法）德米尔
example: O'Brien's servant, however, had admitted the two of them without demur.

name: diamond
trans: n. 金钢石，钻石；菱形
example: He was a small, dark-haired man in a white jacket, with a diamond-shaped, completely expressionless face which might have been that of a Chinese.

name: carpeted
trans: n. 地毯
example: The passage down which he led them was softly carpeted, with cream-papered walls and white wainscoting, all exquisitely clean.

name: cream
trans: n. 乳脂，(鲜)奶油；奶油色
example: The passage down which he led them was softly carpeted, with cream-papered walls and white wainscoting, all exquisitely clean.

name: papered
trans: n. 纸；纸制品；报纸；(pl)文件；试卷；论文
example: The passage down which he led them was softly carpeted, with cream-papered walls and white wainscoting, all exquisitely clean.

name: exquisitely
trans: adv.精致地,强烈地,剧烈地,异常地
example: The passage down which he led them was softly carpeted, with cream-papered walls and white wainscoting, all exquisitely clean.

name: intimidating
trans: adj. 吓人的
example: That too was intimidating.

name: passageway
trans: n.（尤指两面有墙的）通道，走廊
example: Winston could not remember ever to have seen a passageway whose walls were not grimy from the contact of human bodies.

name: studying
trans: vt. 学习；研究；细看vi. 读书n. 学习；研究
example: O'Brien had a slip of paper between his fingers and seemed to be studying it intently.

name: formidable
trans: a. 可怕的,难以对付的
example: His heavy face, bent down so that one could see the line of the nose, looked both formidable and intelligent.

name: stirring
trans: adj.动人的,萌动的
example: For perhaps twenty seconds he sat without stirring.

name: hybrid
trans: n. 杂种，混血儿；混合物
adj. 混合的；杂种的
example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

trans: n. 项目；名目；所有物品（item的复数形式）
v. 记下（item的第三人称单数形式）；逐条记载
example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

name: plusfull
example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

name: estimates
trans: n. 估计,估价 v. 评价,估量
example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

name: overheads
trans: n. 经费
example: Then he pulled the speakwrite towards him and rapped out a message in the hybrid jargon of the Ministries: 'Items one comma five comma seven approved fullwise stop suggestion contained item six doubleplus ridiculous verging crimethink cancel stop unproceed constructionwise antegetting plusfull estimates machinery overheads stop end message.

name: soundless
example: ' He rose deliberately from his chair and came towards them across the soundless carpet.

name: grimmer
trans: a. 严酷的;讨厌的;严厉的
example: A little of the official atmosphere seemed to have fallen away from him with the Newspeak words, but his expression was grimmer than usual, as though he were not pleased at being disturbed.

name: pleased
trans: adj.高兴的，乐意的
example: A little of the official atmosphere seemed to have fallen away from him with the Newspeak words, but his expression was grimmer than usual, as though he were not pleased at being disturbed.

name: disturbed
trans: adj.被扰乱的,心理失常的,为心理失常者服务的v.干扰(disturb的过去分词)
example: A little of the official atmosphere seemed to have fallen away from him with the Newspeak words, but his expression was grimmer than usual, as though he were not pleased at being disturbed.

name: embarrassment
trans: n.窘迫，尴尬
example: The terror that Winston already felt was suddenly shot through by a streak of ordinary embarrassment.

name: mistake
trans: n. 错误，过失，误解v. 弄错；(for)把…误认为
example: It seemed to him quite possible that he had simply made a stupid mistake.

name: conspirator
trans: n.共谋者，阴谋家，反叛者
example: For what evidence had he in reality that O'Brien was any kind of political conspirator?

name: imaginings
trans: v. 想象，设想，料想
example: Nothing but a flash of the eyes and a single equivocal remark: beyond that, only his own secret imaginings, founded on a dream.

name: founded
trans: vt. 建立；创立；创办；使有根据；铸造；熔制
example: Nothing but a flash of the eyes and a single equivocal remark: beyond that, only his own secret imaginings, founded on a dream.

name: borrow
trans: vt. 借，借入；(思想、文字等)采用，抄袭
example: He could not even fall back on the pretence that he had come to borrow the dictionary, because in that case Julia's presence was impossible to explain.

name: strike
trans: n./vi. 罢工vt. 打，击；攻击；给…深刻印象
example: As O'Brien passed the telescreen a thought seemed to strike him.

name: switch
trans: n. 开关；转换；鞭子v. 转变，转换；抽打
example: He stopped, turned aside and pressed a switch on the wall.

name: snap
trans: v. 啪地移动；(使)突然断开，断开(成两截)
example: There was a sharp snap.

name: stopped
trans: v. 停止；塞住；阻止，阻挠；逗留n. 停车站；停止
example: The voice had stopped.

name: squeak
trans: v. 吱吱叫，嘎吱作响；紧张（或激动）得尖声说；<非正式>勉强通过，侥幸成功；<非正式>告密，告发 n. 吱吱声，短促的尖叫声；只言片语；<非正式>机会
example: Julia uttered a tiny sound, a sort of squeak of surprise.

name: midst
trans: n. 中间，当中
example: Even in the midst of his panic, Winston was too much taken aback to be able to hold his tongue.

name: turn
trans: v./n. (使)转动；(使)旋转；(使)转变n. 机会
example: 'You can turn it off!

name: turn
trans: v./n. (使)转动；(使)旋转；(使)转变n. 机会
example: 'Yes,' said O'Brien, 'we can turn it off.

name: privilege
trans: n. 特权;优惠
example: We have that privilege.

name: opposite
trans: a. 对面的,相对的,相反的,对立的 prep. 在…对面
example: ' He was opposite them now.

name: indecipherable
trans: adj. 辨读不出的；无法破译的；无法解释的
example: His solid form towered over the pair of them, and the expression on his face was still indecipherable.

name: sternly
trans: adv.严格地,严厉地,断然地,坚决地
example: He was waiting, somewhat sternly, for Winston to speak, but about what?

name: irritably
example: Even now it was quite conceivable that he was simply a busy man wondering irritably why he had been interrupted.

name: Nobody
trans: pron. 谁也不，无人n. 小人物
example: Nobody spoke.

name: stopping
trans: n.停止，制动(状态)
example: After the stopping of the telescreen the room seemed deadly silent.

name: marched
trans: v. (使)行军，(使)行进n. 行军，行程
example: The seconds marched past, enormous.

name: fixed
trans: adj.固定的，已确定的
example: With difficulty Winston continued to keep his eyes fixed on O'Brien's.

name: beginnings
trans: n. 开始，开端；起源，早期阶段
example: Then suddenly the grim face broke down into what might have been the beginnings of a smile.

name: resettled
trans: vt.& vi.帮助（尤指难民）定居他国vt.使（土地、地区等）重新成为定居点
example: With his characteristic gesture O'Brien resettled his spectacles on his nose.

name: Shall
trans: aux. v. (我，我们)将要，会；必须，应该
example: 'Shall I say it, or will you?

name: promptly
trans: ad.敏捷地，迅速地
example: 'I will say it,' said Winston promptly.

name: really
trans: ad. 确实，实在，真正地，果然
example: 'That thing is really turned off?

name: everything
trans: pron. 每件事，一切；最重要的东西
example: ' 'Yes, everything is turned off.

name: alone
trans: a. 单独的，孤独的ad. 单独地，独自地；仅仅
example: We are alone.

name: realizing
trans: v. 认识到，体会到；实现
example: ' 'We have come here because----' He paused, realizing for the first time the vagueness of his own motives.

name: Since
trans: prep. 自从conj. 自从；因为，既然ad. 后来
example: Since he did not in fact know what kind of help he expected from O'Brien, it was not easy to say why he had come here.

name: pretentious
trans: a. 自负的,自命不凡的
example: He went on, conscious that what he was saying must sound both feeble and pretentious: 'We believe that there is some kind of conspiracy, some kind of secret organization working against the Party, and that you are involved in it.

name: join
trans: v. 参加，加入；联合，连接；和…在一起
example: We want to join it and work for it.

name: enemies
example: We are enemies of the Party.

name: disbelieve
trans: 不信；怀疑
example: We disbelieve in the principles of Ingsoc.

name: criminals
trans: a. 犯罪的,刑事上的 n. 罪犯
example: We are thought-criminals.

name: adulterers
example: We are also adulterers.

name: ourselves
trans: pron.我们自己；我们亲自
example: I tell you this because we want to put ourselves at your mercy.

name: incriminate
trans: vt. 控告；暗示……有罪
example: If you want us to incriminate ourselves in any other way, we are ready.

name: glanced
trans: v. (at，over)扫视n. 匆匆看，一瞥，一眼
example: ' He stopped and glanced over his shoulder, with the feeling that the door had opened.

name: Sure
trans: a. 肯定的；一定会…的；有信心的，有把握的
example: Sure enough, the little yellow-faced servant had come in without knocking.

name: decanter
trans: vt. 移入其他容器；轻轻倒出
example: Winston saw that he was carrying a tray with a decanter and glasses.

name: impassively
trans: adj. 冷漠的；无感觉的
example: 'Martin is one of us,' said O'Brien impassively.

name: Bring
trans: v. 拿来，带来；产生，引起；使处于某种状态
example: 'Bring the drinks over here, Martin.

name: drinks
trans: n. 饮料，饮品；喝酒（drink复数）
example: 'Bring the drinks over here, Martin.

name: Put
trans: vt. 放，搁，置；表达；使处于…状态，记下
example: Put them on the round table.

name: chairs
trans: n. [家具] 椅子（chair的复数）；餐椅；安乐椅
example: Have we enough chairs?

name: comfort
trans: n. 舒适，安逸；安慰，慰问v. 安慰，使舒适
example: Then we may as well sit down and talk in comfort.

name: Bring
trans: v. 拿来，带来；产生，引起；使处于某种状态
example: Bring a chair for yourself, Martin.

name: business
trans: n. 商业，生意；事务，业务，职责
example: This is business.

name: servant
trans: n. 仆人
example: You can stop being a servant for the next ten minutes.

name: valet
trans: n.男子的贴身男仆,（旅馆中洗熨衣服的）侍者,伺候客人停车、用车的人,衣帽架vt.做贴身男仆,为…管理衣物，替…洗熨衣服vi.伺候，服侍,清洗（汽车）
example: ' The little man sat down, quite at his ease, and yet still with a servant-like air, the air of a valet enjoying a privilege.

name: enjoying
trans: vt. 享受…的乐趣；欣赏；喜爱
example: ' The little man sat down, quite at his ease, and yet still with a servant-like air, the air of a valet enjoying a privilege.

name: regarded
trans: v. (as)把…看作为；考虑n. (pl.)敬重，问候
example: Winston regarded him out of the corner of his eye.

name: personality
trans: n. 个性;(有名的)人物
example: It struck him that the man's whole life was playing a part, and that he felt it to be dangerous to drop his assumed personality even for a moment.

name: decanter
trans: vt. 移入其他容器；轻轻倒出
example: O'Brien took the decanter by the neck and filled up the glasses with a dark-red liquid.

name: contents
trans: n./a./vt. 满意(的),使满意(足) n. 内容,目录
example: It aroused in Winston dim memories of something seen long ago on a wall or a hoarding--a vast bottle composed of electric lights which seemed to move up and down and pour its contents into a glass.

name: Seen
example: Seen from the top the stuff looked almost black, but in the decanter it gleamed like a ruby.

name: ruby
trans: n. 红宝石；深红色；（印刷）5点铅字 adj. 深红色的
example: Seen from the top the stuff looked almost black, but in the decanter it gleamed like a ruby.

name: sweet
trans: a. 甜的；可爱的，美好的n. (常pl. )糖果；甜食
example: It had a sour-sweet smell.

name: sniff
trans: vi. 嗅…味道；抽鼻涕；对嗤之以鼻，蔑视
example: He saw Julia pick up her glass and sniff at it with frank curiosity.

name: frank
trans: a. 坦白的，直率的
example: He saw Julia pick up her glass and sniff at it with frank curiosity.

name: wine
trans: n. 葡萄酒，果酒
example: 'It is called wine,' said O'Brien with a faint smile.

name: doubt
trans: n./v. 怀疑，疑虑
example: 'You will have read about it in books, no doubt.

name: gets
trans: v. 获得，得到；使，使得；变得，成为；到达
example: Not much of it gets to the Outer Party, I am afraid.

example: On the sixth day of Hate Week, after the processions, the speeches, the shouting, the singing, the banners, the posters, the films, the waxworks, the rolling of drums and squealing of trumpets, the tramp of marching feet, the grinding of the caterpillars of tanks, the roar of massed planes, the booming of guns--after six days of this, when the great orgasm was quivering to its climax and the general hatred of Eurasia had boiled up into such delirium that if the crowd could have got their hands on the 2,000 Eurasian war-criminals who were to be publicly hanged on the last day of the proceedings, they would unquestionably have torn them to pieces--at just this moment it had been announced that Oceania was not after all at war with Eurasia.

name: Eastasia
example: Oceania was at war with Eastasia.

name: ally
trans: n. 同盟者，同盟国vt. 使结盟；与…有关联
example: Eurasia was an ally.

name: admission
trans: n. 准许进(加)入;入场费,入场券;承认,供认
example: There was, of course, no admission that any change had taken place.

name: extreme
trans: adj. 极度的,极端的;尽头的,末端的 n. 极端,过分
example: Merely it became known, with extreme suddenness and everywhere at once, that Eastasia and not Eurasia was the enemy.

name: suddenness
example: Merely it became known, with extreme suddenness and everywhere at once, that Eastasia and not Eurasia was the enemy.

name: demonstration
trans: n.示范，表演，示威
example: Winston was taking part in a demonstration in one of the central London squares at the moment when it happened.

name: central
trans: a. 中心的，中央的，中枢的；主要的
example: Winston was taking part in a demonstration in one of the central London squares at the moment when it happened.

name: squares
trans: a. 正方形的,直角的,公平的 n. 正方形,广场,平方
example: Winston was taking part in a demonstration in one of the central London squares at the moment when it happened.

name: luridly
trans: 恐怖的，令人反感的
example: It was night, and the white faces and the scarlet banners were luridly floodlit.

name: floodlit
example: It was night, and the white faces and the scarlet banners were luridly floodlit.

name: including
trans: prep. 包括; 包含
example: The square was packed with several thousand people, including a block of about a thousand schoolchildren in the uniform of the Spies.

name: schoolchildren
example: The square was packed with several thousand people, including a block of about a thousand schoolchildren in the uniform of the Spies.

窗帘；褶裥

name: haranguing
trans: n.尤指指责性的, 长篇大论, 夸张的话。vt.向...夸大地讲话, (作)长篇、大声、常带斥责的讲话。
example: On a scarlet-draped platform an orator of the Inner Party, a small lean man with disproportionately long arms and a large bald skull over which a few lank locks straggled, was haranguing the crowd.

name: Rumpelstiltskin
example: A little Rumpelstiltskin figure, contorted with hatred, he gripped the neck of the microphone with one hand while the other, enormous at the end of a bony arm, clawed the air menacingly above his head.

name: gripped
trans: v./n. 紧握,抓紧,握力;柄;吸引

trans: n. 爪，脚爪

trans: adj.威胁的,险恶的v.威胁(menace的现在分词),恐吓
example: A little Rumpelstiltskin figure, contorted with hatred, he gripped the neck of the microphone with one hand while the other, enormous at the end of a bony arm, clawed the air menacingly above his head.

name: amplifiers
trans: n. 放大器，扩大器

trans: n.平民, 公务员, 文官。adj.民间的, 民用的。

trans: a.非正义的；不公平的
example: His voice, made metallic by the amplifiers, boomed forth an endless catalogue of atrocities, massacres, deportations, lootings, rapings, torture of prisoners, bombing of civilians, lying propaganda, unjust aggressions, broken treaties.

name: aggressions
trans: n.侵略
example: His voice, made metallic by the amplifiers, boomed forth an endless catalogue of atrocities, massacres, deportations, lootings, rapings, torture of prisoners, bombing of civilians, lying propaganda, unjust aggressions, broken treaties.

name: treaties
trans: v. 对待；治疗；论述；款待，请客n. 款待，请客
example: His voice, made metallic by the amplifiers, boomed forth an endless catalogue of atrocities, massacres, deportations, lootings, rapings, torture of prisoners, bombing of civilians, lying propaganda, unjust aggressions, broken treaties.

name: maddened
trans: v.发狂。
example: It was almost impossible to listen to him without being first convinced and then maddened.

name: fury
trans: n.狂怒，暴怒；猛烈
example: At every few moments the fury of the crowd boiled over and the voice of the speaker was drowned by a wild beast-like roaring that rose uncontrollably from thousands of throats.

name: beast
trans: n. 兽，牲畜；凶残的人，举止粗鲁的人
example: At every few moments the fury of the crowd boiled over and the voice of the speaker was drowned by a wild beast-like roaring that rose uncontrollably from thousands of throats.

name: uncontrollably
trans: adv.无法控制地
example: At every few moments the fury of the crowd boiled over and the voice of the speaker was drowned by a wild beast-like roaring that rose uncontrollably from thousands of throats.

name: schoolchildren
example: The most savage yells of all came from the schoolchildren.

name: proceeding
trans: n. 行动，进行，(pl.)会议录，学报
example: The speech had been proceeding for perhaps twenty minutes when a messenger hurried on to the platform and a scrap of paper was slipped into the speaker's hand.

name: pausing
trans: v./n. 中止，暂停
example: He unrolled and read it without pausing in his speech.

name: content
trans: n./a./vt. 满意(的),使满意(足) n. 内容,目录
example: Nothing altered in his voice or manner, or in the content of what he was saying, but suddenly the names were different.

name: rippled
trans: n. 涟漪,波纹;vt./vi. (使)泛起层层细浪
example: Without words said, a wave of understanding rippled through the crowd.

name: Eastasia
example: Oceania was at war with Eastasia!

name: commotion
trans: n.骚动, 暴乱。
example: The next moment there was a tremendous commotion.

name: decorated
trans: v.装饰( decorate的过去式和过去分词 ),点缀,粉刷,授予（某人）勋章
example: The banners and posters with which the square was decorated were all wrong!

name: Quite
trans: ad. 十分，完全；相当，颇；的确，真正
example: Quite half of them had the wrong faces on them.

name: sabotage
trans: n.(不满的职工或敌特等的)阴谋破坏, 怠工, 破坏。vi.从事破坏活动。vt.对...采取破坏行动, 妨害, 破坏
example: It was sabotage!

name: agents
trans: n. 间谍；代理人；代理商；特工人员（agent的复数形式）
example: The agents of Goldstein had been at work!

name: riotous
trans: adj.骚乱的，喧扰的,狂暴的
example: There was a riotous interlude while posters were ripped from the walls, banners torn to shreds and trampled underfoot.

name: interlude
trans: n. （两件事情、两种形势之间的）间歇；（戏剧、电影等的）幕间休息；幕间乐曲（或节目、表演），插曲；短暂的幽会，风流韵事
example: There was a riotous interlude while posters were ripped from the walls, banners torn to shreds and trampled underfoot.

name: ripped
trans: adj.<美俚>喝醉的，受毒品麻醉的,有明显的肌肉线条的v.扯破，撕坏( rip的过去式和过去分词 ),撕成,锯,猛地扯开
example: There was a riotous interlude while posters were ripped from the walls, banners torn to shreds and trampled underfoot.

trans: n.碎片, 破布, 少量剩余, 最少量。v.撕碎, 切碎。

name: prodigies
example: The Spies performed prodigies of activity in clambering over the rooftops and cutting the streamers that fluttered from the chimneys.

trans: 攀登，爬上
攀登，爬上
example: The Spies performed prodigies of activity in clambering over the rooftops and cutting the streamers that fluttered from the chimneys.

name: rooftops
trans: n. 屋顶
example: The Spies performed prodigies of activity in clambering over the rooftops and cutting the streamers that fluttered from the chimneys.

name: fluttered
trans: v./n. 振翼;颤动,(心脏)不规则跳动

name: chimneys
trans: n. 烟囱
example: The Spies performed prodigies of activity in clambering over the rooftops and cutting the streamers that fluttered from the chimneys.

name: within
trans: prep. 在…里面，在…以内ad. 在内
example: But within two or three minutes it was all over.

name: gripping
trans: adj.吸引注意力的v.抓紧( grip的现在分词 ),吸引,引起,使感兴趣

name: hunched
trans: n. 预感；大块；肉峰 vt. 耸肩；预感到；弯腰驼背 vi. 隆起；向前移动时 态: hunched, hunching, hunches
example: The orator, still gripping the neck of the microphone, his shoulders hunched forward, his free hand clawing at the air, had gone straight on with his speech.

trans: n. 爪，脚爪
example: The orator, still gripping the neck of the microphone, his shoulders hunched forward, his free hand clawing at the air, had gone straight on with his speech.

name: feral
trans: 野生的
example: One minute more, and the feral roars of rage were again bursting from the crowd.

name: roars
trans: n./v. 吼叫,怒吼,轰鸣
example: One minute more, and the feral roars of rage were again bursting from the crowd.

name: target
trans: n. 目标，对象，靶子
example: The Hate continued exactly as before, except that the target had been changed.

name: midsentence
example: The thing that impressed Winston in looking back was that the speaker had switched from one line to the other actually in midsentence, not only without a pause, but without even breaking the syntax.

name: syntax
trans: n.语法，文法，句法
example: The thing that impressed Winston in looking back was that the speaker had switched from one line to the other actually in midsentence, not only without a pause, but without even breaking the syntax.

name: preoccupy
trans: v.使迷住，专心于
example: But at the moment he had other things to preoccupy him.

name: disorder
trans: n./vt. 混乱,骚动,(身心)失调
example: It was during the moment of disorder while the posters were being torn down that a man whose face he did not see had tapped him on the shoulder and said, 'Excuse me, I think you've dropped your brief-case.

name: tapped
trans: n. 龙头;轻拍,轻敲;v. 轻拍,轻敲
example: It was during the moment of disorder while the posters were being torn down that a man whose face he did not see had tapped him on the shoulder and said, 'Excuse me, I think you've dropped your brief-case.

name: Excuse
trans: v. 原谅，宽恕，免除n. 借口，辩解
example: It was during the moment of disorder while the posters were being torn down that a man whose face he did not see had tapped him on the shoulder and said, 'Excuse me, I think you've dropped your brief-case.

name: abstractedly
example: ' He took the brief-case abstractedly, without speaking.

name: opportunity
trans: n. 机会
example: He knew that it would be days before he had an opportunity to look inside it.

name: demonstration
trans: n.示范，表演，示威
example: The instant that the demonstration was over he went straight to the Ministry of Truth, though the time was now nearly twenty-three hours.

name: staff
trans: n. 木棍,杆,工作人员
example: The entire staff of the Ministry had done likewise.

name: likewise
trans: ad. 同样地,也
example: The entire staff of the Ministry had done likewise.

name: recalling
trans: vt./n. 召回;回忆
example: The orders already issuing from the telescreen, recalling them to their posts, were hardly necessary.

name: Eastasia
example: Oceania was at war with Eastasia: Oceania had always been at war with Eastasia.

name: obsolete
trans: adj.荒废的, 陈旧的。n.废词, 陈腐的人
example: A large part of the political literature of five years was now completely obsolete.

name: Reports
trans: n. 报告（report的复数）；[统计][计] 报表；专题
v. 报告；记录（report的三单形式）；传达
example: Reports and records of all kinds, newspapers, books, pamphlets, films, sound-tracks, photographs--all had to be rectified at lightning speed.

name: lightning
trans: n. 闪电a. 闪电般的，快速的
example: Reports and records of all kinds, newspapers, books, pamphlets, films, sound-tracks, photographs--all had to be rectified at lightning speed.

name: chiefs
trans: n. 领袖;部门主任;a. 主要的,首席的
example: Although no directive was ever issued, it was known that the chiefs of the Department intended that within one week no reference to the war with Eurasia, or the alliance with Eastasia, should remain in existence anywhere.

name: processes
trans: 流程
example: The work was overwhelming, all the more so because the processes that it involved could not be called by their true names.

name: eighteen
trans: num. 十八，十八个
example: Everyone in the Records Department worked eighteen hours in the twenty-four, with two three-hour snatches of sleep.

name: Mattresses
trans: n.床垫
example: Mattresses were brought up from the cellars and pitched all over the corridors: meals consisted of sandwiches and Victory Coffee wheeled round on trolleys by attendants from the canteen.

name: pitched
trans: adj. 有坡度的

trans: n. [食品] 三明治；夹在一起的东西（sandwich的复数）

example: Mattresses were brought up from the cellars and pitched all over the corridors: meals consisted of sandwiches and Victory Coffee wheeled round on trolleys by attendants from the canteen.

name: wheeled
trans: n. 轮，车轮
example: Mattresses were brought up from the cellars and pitched all over the corridors: meals consisted of sandwiches and Victory Coffee wheeled round on trolleys by attendants from the canteen.

name: trolleys
trans: n. 手推车；(英)无轨电车，(美)有轨电车
example: Mattresses were brought up from the cellars and pitched all over the corridors: meals consisted of sandwiches and Victory Coffee wheeled round on trolleys by attendants from the canteen.

name: spells
trans: v. 拼写
example: Each time that Winston broke off for one of his spells of sleep he tried to leave his desk clear of work, and each time that he crawled back sticky-eyed and aching, it was to find that another shower of paper cylinders had covered the desk like a snowdrift, half-burying the speakwrite and overflowing on to the floor, so that the first job was always to stack them into a neat enough pile to give him room to work.

name: crawled
trans: vi,爬行,缓慢地行进,爬满;起鸡皮疙瘩;n. 爬行;自由泳
example: Each time that Winston broke off for one of his spells of sleep he tried to leave his desk clear of work, and each time that he crawled back sticky-eyed and aching, it was to find that another shower of paper cylinders had covered the desk like a snowdrift, half-burying the speakwrite and overflowing on to the floor, so that the first job was always to stack them into a neat enough pile to give him room to work.

name: snowdrift
trans: n. 雪堆；被风刮在一起的雪堆
example: Each time that Winston broke off for one of his spells of sleep he tried to leave his desk clear of work, and each time that he crawled back sticky-eyed and aching, it was to find that another shower of paper cylinders had covered the desk like a snowdrift, half-burying the speakwrite and overflowing on to the floor, so that the first job was always to stack them into a neat enough pile to give him room to work.

name: stack
trans: n. 堆;大量;书库
example: Each time that Winston broke off for one of his spells of sleep he tried to leave his desk clear of work, and each time that he crawled back sticky-eyed and aching, it was to find that another shower of paper cylinders had covered the desk like a snowdrift, half-burying the speakwrite and overflowing on to the floor, so that the first job was always to stack them into a neat enough pile to give him room to work.

name: purely
trans: ad.纯粹地，完全地
example: What was worst of all was that the work was by no means purely mechanical.

name: detailed
trans: adj.详细的，详尽的
example: Often it was enough merely to substitute one name for another, but any detailed report of events demanded care and imagination.

name: geographical
trans: adj.地理学的，地理的
example: Even the geographical knowledge that one needed in transferring the war from one part of the world to another was considerable.

name: considerable
trans: a. 相当大的;重要的
example: Even the geographical knowledge that one needed in transferring the war from one part of the world to another was considerable.

name: ached
trans: vi. 痛；哀怜n. (指连续)疼痛、酸痛
example: By the third day his eyes ached unbearably and his spectacles needed wiping every few minutes.

name: wiping
trans: v./n. 擦，揩，抹
example: By the third day his eyes ached unbearably and his spectacles needed wiping every few minutes.

name: crushing
trans: adj.压倒的,决定性的,支离破碎的v.压碎，压坏( crush的现在分词),镇压，征服,冲入(crush的现在分词)
example: It was like struggling with some crushing physical task, something which one had the right to refuse and which one was nevertheless neurotically anxious to accomplish.

name: task
trans: n. 任务，作业，工作
example: It was like struggling with some crushing physical task, something which one had the right to refuse and which one was nevertheless neurotically anxious to accomplish.

name: neurotically
example: It was like struggling with some crushing physical task, something which one had the right to refuse and which one was nevertheless neurotically anxious to accomplish.

name: accomplish
trans: vt. 完成,实现
example: It was like struggling with some crushing physical task, something which one had the right to refuse and which one was nevertheless neurotically anxious to accomplish.

name: troubled
trans: adj. 动乱的，不安的；混乱的；困惑的
example: In so far as he had time to remember it, he was not troubled by the fact that every word he murmured into the speakwrite, every stroke of his ink-pencil, was a deliberate lie.

name: stroke
trans: n. 击;划;一笔;中风;击
example: In so far as he had time to remember it, he was not troubled by the fact that every word he murmured into the speakwrite, every stroke of his ink-pencil, was a deliberate lie.

name: anxious
trans: a. 焦虑的，担心的；急于(得到的)，渴望的
example: He was as anxious as anyone else in the Department that the forgery should be perfect.

name: dribble
trans: 连击；使滴下；运球
n点滴；运球
example: On the morning of the sixth day the dribble of cylinders slowed down.

name: cylinder
trans: n.圆筒, 圆柱体, 汽缸, 柱面。
example: For as much as half an hour nothing came out of the tube; then one more cylinder, then nothing.

name: Everywhere
trans: ad. 到处，各处，无论何处
example: Everywhere at about the same time the work was easing off.

name: easing
trans: v./n. 减轻,放松,小心移置;舒适
example: Everywhere at about the same time the work was easing off.

name: sigh
trans: v./n. 叹气
example: A deep and as it were secret sigh went through the Department.

name: mighty
trans: a.强大的；巨大的
example: A mighty deed, which could never be mentioned, had been achieved.

name: prove
trans: v. 证明，证实；检验；考验；鉴定；结果是，表明是
example: It was now impossible for any human being to prove by documentary evidence that the war with Eurasia had ever happened.

name: unexpectedly
trans: ad
v. 未料到地,意外地
example: At twelve hundred it was unexpectedly announced that all workers in the Ministry were free till tomorrow morning.

name: shaved
trans: n.剃过的v.（用剃刀）刮（胡须等），为（某人）剃毛发( shave的过去式和过去分词 ),刨（木头等）,削,<口>掠过
example: Winston, still carrying the brief-case containing the book, which had remained between his feet while he worked and under his body while he slept, went home, shaved himself, and almost fell asleep in his bath, although the water was barely more than tepid.

name: tepid
trans: adj. 微温的，温热的；不太热烈的；不热情的
example: Winston, still carrying the brief-case containing the book, which had remained between his feet while he worked and under his body while he slept, went home, shaved himself, and almost fell asleep in his bath, although the water was barely more than tepid.

name: voluptuous
trans: adj.艳丽的, 奢侈逸乐的。
example: With a sort of voluptuous creaking in his joints he climbed the stair above Mr Charrington's shop.

name: stair
trans: n. (pl.)楼梯

name: sleepy
trans: a.想睡的；寂静的
example: He was tired, but not sleepy any longer.

name: oilstove
example: He opened the window, lit the dirty little oilstove and put on a pan of water for coffee.

name: meanwhile
trans: n. 其时，其间ad. 当时，与此同时
example: Julia would arrive presently: meanwhile there was the book.

name: sluttish
trans: 懒惰的， 邋遢的； 放荡的

name: undid

name: amateurishly

name: irregular

name: pages
trans: 页
example: The pages were worn at the edges, and fell apart, easily, as though the book had passed through many hands.

name: subdivided
trans: vt.把…再分

trans: a. 相对的，比较的，有关系的n. 亲戚，关系词

name: upheavals
trans: n. 剧变；隆起；举起

trans: vt. 为…表示感激，感谢；欣赏，赏识，评价

name: keyhole
trans: n.钥匙孔
example: He was alone: no telescreen, no ear at the keyhole, no nervous impulse to glance over his shoulder or cover the page with his hand.

name: sweet
trans: a. 甜的；可爱的，美好的n. (常pl. )糖果；甜食
example: The sweet summer air played against his cheek.

name: insect
trans: n. 昆虫
example: From somewhere far away there floated the faint shouts of children: in the room itself there was no sound except the insect voice of the clock.

name: fender
trans: （汽车等的）挡泥板；防卫物；（暖炉的）炉围；（船只的）碰垫

name: bliss
trans: n. 极乐，天赐之福；天堂，乐园 v. <非正式>乐不可支，欣喜若狂
example: It was bliss, it was eternity.

name: ultimately
trans: ad.最终，最后
example: Suddenly, as one sometimes does with a book of which one knows that one will ultimately read and re-read every word, he opened it at a different place and found himself at Chapter III.

name: III
example: Suddenly, as one sometimes does with a book of which one knows that one will ultimately read and re-read every word, he opened it at a different place and found himself at Chapter III.

name: III

name: warfare

name: bloodthirsty

name: Pacific
trans: a.和平的 n.太平洋
example: Eurasia is protected by its vast land spaces, Oceania by the width of the Atlantic and the Pacific, Eastasia by the fecundity and industriousness of its inhabitants.

trans: n. 多产；富饶；肥沃 产卵力；生殖力；结实性

name: Secondly

name: fight

name: establishment
trans: n. 建立，设立，建立的机构(或组织)
example: With the establishment of self-contained economies, in which production and consumption are geared to one another, the scramble for markets which was a main cause of previous wars has come to an end, while the competition for raw materials is no longer a matter of life and death.

name: obtain
trans: v. 获得，得到
example: In any case each of the three super-states is so vast that it can obtain almost all the materials that it needs within its own boundaries.

name: boundaries
example: In any case each of the three super-states is so vast that it can obtain almost all the materials that it needs within its own boundaries.

name: direct
trans: a./ad. 径直的(地)v. 管理，指导；(at，to)指向
example: In so far as the war has a direct economic purpose, it is a war for labour power.

name: quadrilateral
trans: 四边形
四边形的
example: Between the frontiers of the super-states, and not permanently in the possession of any of them, there lies a rough quadrilateral with its corners at Tangier, Brazzaville, Darwin, and Hong Kong, containing within it about a fifth of the population of the earth.

trans: n. 地区，地带，行政区，(科学等)领域

example: In practice no one power ever controls the whole of the disputed area.

trans: n. 加大份量；部分（portion的复数形式） v. 将…分配（portion的第三人称单数形式）

trans: v. 抓住，逮住；夺取，占领；没收，查封

name: territories
example: All of the disputed territories contain valuable minerals, and some of them yield important vegetable products such as rubber which in colder climates it is necessary to synthesize by comparatively expensive methods.

example: But above all they contain a bottomless reserve of cheap labour.

trans: adj.赤道的，赤道附近的adv.赤道地
example: Whichever power controls equatorial Africa, or the countries of the Middle East, or Southern India, or the Indonesian Archipelago, disposes also of the bodies of scores or hundreds of millions of ill-paid and hard-working coolies.

name: noted
trans: a.著名的，知名的

name: moves
trans: v. 移动，迁移；活动；感动n. 移动，活动，行动
example: It should be noted that the fighting never really moves beyond the edges of the disputed areas.

name: basin
trans: n. 盆，脸盆；内海，盆地
example: The frontiers of Eurasia flow back and forth between the basin of the Congo and the northern shore of the Mediterranean; the islands of the Indian Ocean and the Pacific are constantly being captured and recaptured by Oceania or by Eastasia; in Mongolia the dividing line between Eurasia and Eastasia is never stable; round the Pole all three powers lay claim to enormous territories which in fact are largely uninhabited and unexplored: but the balance of power always remains roughly even, and the territory which forms the heartland of each super-state always remains inviolate.

trans: v.开采( exploit的过去式和过去分词 ),利用（…为自己谋利）,运用,剥削
example: Moreover, the labour of the exploited peoples round the Equator is not really necessary to the world's economy.

name: peoples
trans: n. 人们，人；[the -
example: Moreover, the labour of the exploited peoples round the Equator is not really necessary to the world's economy.

name: Equator
trans: n. 赤道
example: Moreover, the labour of the exploited peoples round the Equator is not really necessary to the world's economy.

name: wealth
trans: n. 财富，财产；大量
example: They add nothing to the wealth of the world, since whatever they produce is used for purposes of war, and the object of waging a war is always to be in a better position in which to wage another war.

name: waging
trans: vt.摇，摇摆，摆动
example: They add nothing to the wealth of the world, since whatever they produce is used for purposes of war, and the object of waging a war is always to be in a better position in which to wage another war.

name: wage

name: tempo
trans: n.(音乐)速度、拍子, 发展速度。
example: By their labour the slave populations allow the tempo of continuous warfare to be speeded up.

name: speeded
trans: n. 速度，快v. 迅速，前进，急行；加速，使加速
example: By their labour the slave populations allow the tempo of continuous warfare to be speeded up.

name: maintains
trans: vt. 维持;抚养;坚持;维修
example: But if they did not exist, the structure of world society, and the process by which it maintains itself, would not be essentially different.

name: essentially
trans: adj.本质上，实质上
example: But if they did not exist, the structure of world society, and the process by which it maintains itself, would not be essentially different.

name: accordance
trans: n. 一致，和谐，符合
example: The primary aim of modern warfare (in accordance with the principles of DOUBLETHINK, this aim is simultaneously recognized and not recognized by the directing brains of the Inner Party) is to use up the products of the machine without raising the general standard of living.

name: Ever
trans: ad. 曾经；永远；在任何时候；究竟
example: Ever since the end of the nineteenth century, the problem of what to do with the surplus of consumption goods has been latent in industrial society.

name: surplus
trans: n. 余款,盈余,剩余,过剩
example: Ever since the end of the nineteenth century, the problem of what to do with the surplus of consumption goods has been latent in industrial society.

name: latent
trans: a. 潜伏的,潜在的
example: Ever since the end of the nineteenth century, the problem of what to do with the surplus of consumption goods has been latent in industrial society.

name: industrial
trans: a. 工业的，产业的
example: Ever since the end of the nineteenth century, the problem of what to do with the surplus of consumption goods has been latent in industrial society.

name: urgent
trans: a. 急迫的，紧要的，紧急的
example: At present, when few human beings even have enough to eat, this problem is obviously not urgent, and it might not have become so, even if no artificial processes of destruction had been at work.

name: dilapidated
trans: adj.毁坏的, 要塌似的, 荒废的。
example: The world of today is a bare, hungry, dilapidated place compared with the world that existed before 1914, and still more so if compared with the imaginary future to which the people of that period looked forward.

name: leisured
trans: adj. 有空闲的
example: In the early twentieth century, the vision of a future society unbelievably rich, leisured, orderly, and efficient--a glittering antiseptic world of glass and steel and snow-white concrete--was part of the consciousness of nearly every literate person.

name: orderly
trans: a. 有秩序的,整齐的,有条不紊的

name: Science

name: impoverishment
