name: empirical
trans: a. 经验主义的
example: This failed to happen, partly because of the impoverishment caused by a long series of wars and revolutions, partly because scientific and technical progress depended on the empirical habit of thought, which could not survive in a strictly regimented society.

name: regimented
trans: n.团，军团；一大群
example: This failed to happen, partly because of the impoverishment caused by a long series of wars and revolutions, partly because scientific and technical progress depended on the empirical habit of thought, which could not survive in a strictly regimented society.

name: primitive
trans: a. 原始的,简单的
example: As a whole the world is more primitive today than it was fifty years ago.

name: Certain
trans: a. 某，某一，某些；(of)一定的，确信的，可靠的
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: advanced
trans: a. 超前的，先进的；高级的；开明的；前进的
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: devices
trans: n. 装置，设备，仪表；方法，设计
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: espionage
trans: 间谍；间谍活动；刺探
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: developed
trans: adj.先进的,发达的（国家或地区）
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验；试验v. (on)进行实验；做试验
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: ravages
trans: n.劫掠后的残迹，破坏的结果，毁坏后的残迹v.毁坏( ravage的第三人称单数 ),蹂躏,劫掠,抢劫
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: repaired
trans: n. 修理，修补v. 补救，纠正；修理
example: Certain backward areas have advanced, and various devices, always in some way connected with warfare and police espionage, have been developed, but experiment and invention have largely stopped, and the ravages of the atomic war of the nineteen-fifties have never been fully repaired.

name: dangers
trans: n. 危险；威胁；危险事物
example: Nevertheless the dangers inherent in the machine are still there.

name: inherent
trans: a. 固有的
example: Nevertheless the dangers inherent in the machine are still there.

name: drudgery
trans: n.苦差事, 苦工。
example: From the moment when the machine first made its appearance it was clear to all thinking people that the need for human drudgery, and therefore to a great extent for human inequality, had disappeared.

name: inequality
trans: n. 不平等,不均等,不等量
example: From the moment when the machine first made its appearance it was clear to all thinking people that the need for human drudgery, and therefore to a great extent for human inequality, had disappeared.

name: overwork
trans: vi. 工作过度 vt. 工作过度 n. 过度工作 过度工作的
example: If the machine were used deliberately for that end, hunger, overwork, dirt, illiteracy, and disease could be eliminated within a few generations.

name: illiteracy
trans: n.文盲
example: If the machine were used deliberately for that end, hunger, overwork, dirt, illiteracy, and disease could be eliminated within a few generations.

name: eliminated
trans: vt. 排除,清楚;消灭;淘汰(常指在比赛中打 败团队或个人,使他们不在参加)
example: If the machine were used deliberately for that end, hunger, overwork, dirt, illiteracy, and disease could be eliminated within a few generations.

name: distribute
trans: vt. 分发,分配,散布
example: And in fact, without being used for any such purpose, but by a sort of automatic process--by producing wealth which it was sometimes impossible not to distribute--the machine did raise the living standards of the average human being very greatly over a period of about fifty years at the end of the nineteenth and the beginning of the twentieth centuries.

name: raise
trans: v. 举起，提升；增加；饲养；引起；竖起；提出
example: And in fact, without being used for any such purpose, but by a sort of automatic process--by producing wealth which it was sometimes impossible not to distribute--the machine did raise the living standards of the average human being very greatly over a period of about fifty years at the end of the nineteenth and the beginning of the twentieth centuries.

name: increase
trans: v. 增加，增长，增进n. 增加，增长，增进
example: But it was also clear that an all-round increase in wealth threatened the destruction--indeed, in some sense was the destruction--of a hierarchical society.

name: threatened
trans: adj.受到威胁的v.威胁(threaten的过去分词)
example: But it was also clear that an all-round increase in wealth threatened the destruction--indeed, in some sense was the destruction--of a hierarchical society.

name: hierarchical
trans: adj. 分层的；等级体系的
example: But it was also clear that an all-round increase in wealth threatened the destruction--indeed, in some sense was the destruction--of a hierarchical society.

name: refrigerator
trans: n. 冰箱
example: In a world in which everyone worked short hours, had enough to eat, lived in a house with a bathroom and a refrigerator, and possessed a motor-car or even an aeroplane, the most obvious and perhaps the most important form of inequality would already have disappeared.

name: car
trans: n. 汽车，车辆，车；(火车)车厢
example: In a world in which everyone worked short hours, had enough to eat, lived in a house with a bathroom and a refrigerator, and possessed a motor-car or even an aeroplane, the most obvious and perhaps the most important form of inequality would already have disappeared.

name: confer
trans: v. 协商;授予
example: If it once became general, wealth would confer no distinction.

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别，差别；级别；特性；声望；显赫
example: If it once became general, wealth would confer no distinction.

name: WEALTH
trans: n. 财富，财产；大量
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: possessions
trans: n. 所有,拥有,财产
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: luxuries
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: distributed
trans: adj.分布式的v.分配( distribute的过去式和过去分词),散发,分销,常用被动语态将…分类(into)
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: POWER
trans: n. 力，精力；功率，电力；(数学)幂；权力，势力
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: privileged
trans: adj.有特权的,幸运的,保密的,秘密的
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: caste
trans: （印度社会中的）种姓；（具有严格等级差别的）社会地位；（排他的）社会团体
example: It was possible, no doubt, to imagine a society in which WEALTH, in the sense of personal possessions and luxuries, should be evenly distributed, while POWER remained in the hands of a small privileged caste.

name: stable
trans: a. 稳定的，安定的n. 马厩，马棚
example: But in practice such a society could not long remain stable.

name: leisure
trans: n. 空闲，闲暇；悠闲，安逸
example: For if leisure and security were enjoyed by all alike, the great mass of human beings who are normally stupefied by poverty would become literate and would learn to think for themselves; and when once they had done this, they would sooner or later realize that the privileged minority had no function, and they would sweep it away.

name: security
trans: n. 安全(感)，防御(物)，保证(人)，(pl.)证券
example: For if leisure and security were enjoyed by all alike, the great mass of human beings who are normally stupefied by poverty would become literate and would learn to think for themselves; and when once they had done this, they would sooner or later realize that the privileged minority had no function, and they would sweep it away.

name: stupefied
example: For if leisure and security were enjoyed by all alike, the great mass of human beings who are normally stupefied by poverty would become literate and would learn to think for themselves; and when once they had done this, they would sooner or later realize that the privileged minority had no function, and they would sweep it away.

name: sweep
trans: n. 扫,扫除;连绵区域;激流;vt. 扫除;掠过;连绵,延伸
example: For if leisure and security were enjoyed by all alike, the great mass of human beings who are normally stupefied by poverty would become literate and would learn to think for themselves; and when once they had done this, they would sooner or later realize that the privileged minority had no function, and they would sweep it away.

name: basis
trans: n. 基础，根据
example: In the long run, a hierarchical society was only possible on a basis of poverty and ignorance.

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知,愚昧
example: In the long run, a hierarchical society was only possible on a basis of poverty and ignorance.

name: agricultural
trans: adj.农业的
example: To return to the agricultural past, as some thinkers about the beginning of the twentieth century dreamed of doing, was not a practicable solution.

name: thinkers
trans: n.思想家
example: To return to the agricultural past, as some thinkers about the beginning of the twentieth century dreamed of doing, was not a practicable solution.

name: solution
trans: n. 解答，解决办法；溶解，溶液
example: To return to the agricultural past, as some thinkers about the beginning of the twentieth century dreamed of doing, was not a practicable solution.

name: mechanization
trans: n. 机械化；机动化
example: It conflicted with the tendency towards mechanization which had become quasi-instinctive throughout almost the whole world, and moreover, any country which remained industrially backward was helpless in a military sense and was bound to be dominated, directly or indirectly, by its more advanced rivals.

name: quasi
example: It conflicted with the tendency towards mechanization which had become quasi-instinctive throughout almost the whole world, and moreover, any country which remained industrially backward was helpless in a military sense and was bound to be dominated, directly or indirectly, by its more advanced rivals.

name: industrially
trans: a. 工业的，产业的
example: It conflicted with the tendency towards mechanization which had become quasi-instinctive throughout almost the whole world, and moreover, any country which remained industrially backward was helpless in a military sense and was bound to be dominated, directly or indirectly, by its more advanced rivals.

name: dominated
trans: vt. 在…中占首要地位;支配,统治;俯视 vi. 处于支配地位
example: It conflicted with the tendency towards mechanization which had become quasi-instinctive throughout almost the whole world, and moreover, any country which remained industrially backward was helpless in a military sense and was bound to be dominated, directly or indirectly, by its more advanced rivals.

name: indirectly
trans: adj.间接地
example: It conflicted with the tendency towards mechanization which had become quasi-instinctive throughout almost the whole world, and moreover, any country which remained industrially backward was helpless in a military sense and was bound to be dominated, directly or indirectly, by its more advanced rivals.

name: rivals
trans: 竞争对手
example: It conflicted with the tendency towards mechanization which had become quasi-instinctive throughout almost the whole world, and moreover, any country which remained industrially backward was helpless in a military sense and was bound to be dominated, directly or indirectly, by its more advanced rivals.

name: satisfactory
trans: a. 令人满意的，圆满的，良好的，符合要求的
example: Nor was it a satisfactory solution to keep the masses in poverty by restricting the output of goods.

name: restricting
example: Nor was it a satisfactory solution to keep the masses in poverty by restricting the output of goods.

name: phase
trans: n. 阶段，状态，时期；相，相位
example: This happened to a great extent during the final phase of capitalism, roughly between 1920 and 1940.

name: stagnate
trans: vt. 使淤塞；使沉滞；使萧条
vi. 停滞；淤塞；变萧条
example: The economy of many countries was allowed to stagnate, land went out of cultivation, capital equipment was not added to, great blocks of the population were prevented from working and kept half alive by State charity.

name: cultivation
trans: n.耕作，培养
example: The economy of many countries was allowed to stagnate, land went out of cultivation, capital equipment was not added to, great blocks of the population were prevented from working and kept half alive by State charity.

name: equipment
trans: n. 设备，器材，装置；才能
example: The economy of many countries was allowed to stagnate, land went out of cultivation, capital equipment was not added to, great blocks of the population were prevented from working and kept half alive by State charity.

name: blocks
trans: 街区
example: The economy of many countries was allowed to stagnate, land went out of cultivation, capital equipment was not added to, great blocks of the population were prevented from working and kept half alive by State charity.

name: prevented
trans: v. (from)预防，防止，阻止，制止，妨碍
example: The economy of many countries was allowed to stagnate, land went out of cultivation, capital equipment was not added to, great blocks of the population were prevented from working and kept half alive by State charity.

name: charity
trans: n. 赈济款、物,慈善团体,博爱
example: The economy of many countries was allowed to stagnate, land went out of cultivation, capital equipment was not added to, great blocks of the population were prevented from working and kept half alive by State charity.

name: privations
trans: 缺乏，穷困
example: But this, too, entailed military weakness, and since the privations it inflicted were obviously unnecessary, it made opposition inevitable.

name: inflicted
trans: vt. 使遭受,强加
example: But this, too, entailed military weakness, and since the privations it inflicted were obviously unnecessary, it made opposition inevitable.

name: wheels
trans: n. [车辆] 车轮（wheel的复数）；旋转
v. 推动；改变…的方向；装以车轮（wheel的三单形式）
example: The problem was how to keep the wheels of industry turning without increasing the real wealth of the world.

name: industry
trans: n. 工业，产业；勤劳，勤奋
example: The problem was how to keep the wheels of industry turning without increasing the real wealth of the world.

name: increasing
trans: adj.不断增长的
example: The problem was how to keep the wheels of industry turning without increasing the real wealth of the world.

name: Goods
trans: n. (pl.)货物，商品
example: Goods must be produced, but they must not be distributed.

name: achieving
trans: vt. 完成,达到
example: And in practice the only way of achieving this was by continuous warfare.

name: necessarily
trans: ad.必然，必定
example: The essential act of war is destruction, not necessarily of human lives, but of the products of human labour.

name: shattering
trans: n.“shatter”的派生v.打碎(shatter的现在分词),大大扰乱,毁坏,使极为惊愕难过
example: War is a way of shattering to pieces, or pouring into the stratosphere, or sinking in the depths of the sea, materials which might otherwise be used to make the masses too comfortable, and hence, in the long run, too intelligent.

name: stratosphere
trans: n.气平流层，同温层,最上层，最高栏,艰深的学科领域
example: War is a way of shattering to pieces, or pouring into the stratosphere, or sinking in the depths of the sea, materials which might otherwise be used to make the masses too comfortable, and hence, in the long run, too intelligent.

name: manufacture
trans: vt. 大量制造加工; n. (大量)制造;产品
example: Even when weapons of war are not actually destroyed, their manufacture is still a convenient way of expending labour power without producing anything that can be consumed.

name: convenient
trans: a. (to)便利的，方便的
example: Even when weapons of war are not actually destroyed, their manufacture is still a convenient way of expending labour power without producing anything that can be consumed.

name: expending
trans: vt. 消费,用尽
example: Even when weapons of war are not actually destroyed, their manufacture is still a convenient way of expending labour power without producing anything that can be consumed.

name: consumed
trans: 充满的；对…着迷的
消耗（consume的过去式和过去分词）
example: Even when weapons of war are not actually destroyed, their manufacture is still a convenient way of expending labour power without producing anything that can be consumed.

name: build
trans: vt. 建造，建筑；建设，建立vi. 增大，增强
example: A Floating Fortress, for example, has locked up in it the labour that would build several hundred cargo-ships.

name: cargo
trans: n. 船货，货物
example: A Floating Fortress, for example, has locked up in it the labour that would build several hundred cargo-ships.

name: Ultimately
trans: ad.最终，最后
example: Ultimately it is scrapped as obsolete, never having brought any material benefit to anybody, and with further enormous labours another Floating Fortress is built.

name: scrapped
trans: n. 碎片,碎屑;少许,少量
example: Ultimately it is scrapped as obsolete, never having brought any material benefit to anybody, and with further enormous labours another Floating Fortress is built.

name: labours
trans: n.劳动
example: Ultimately it is scrapped as obsolete, never having brought any material benefit to anybody, and with further enormous labours another Floating Fortress is built.

name: planned
trans: adj.计划了的，根据计划的v.计划，打算，设计( plan的过去式和过去分词 )
example: In principle the war effort is always so planned as to eat up any surplus that might exist after meeting the bare needs of the population.

name: underestimated
trans: 低估的
example: In practice the needs of the population are always underestimated, with the result that there is a chronic shortage of half the necessities of life; but this is looked on as an advantage.

name: chronic
trans: adj.慢性的, 延续很长的。
example: In practice the needs of the population are always underestimated, with the result that there is a chronic shortage of half the necessities of life; but this is looked on as an advantage.

name: necessities
trans: 必需品
example: In practice the needs of the population are always underestimated, with the result that there is a chronic shortage of half the necessities of life; but this is looked on as an advantage.

name: advantage
trans: n. 优点，长处，有利条件；利益，好处
example: In practice the needs of the population are always underestimated, with the result that there is a chronic shortage of half the necessities of life; but this is looked on as an advantage.

name: brink
trans: n. 边缘(通常指处于某种糟糕的局势中)
example: It is deliberate policy to keep even the favoured groups somewhere near the brink of hardship, because a general state of scarcity increases the importance of small privileges and thus magnifies the distinction between one group and another.

name: increases
trans: v. 增加，增长，增进n. 增加，增长，增进
example: It is deliberate policy to keep even the favoured groups somewhere near the brink of hardship, because a general state of scarcity increases the importance of small privileges and thus magnifies the distinction between one group and another.

name: privileges
trans: n. 特权;优惠
example: It is deliberate policy to keep even the favoured groups somewhere near the brink of hardship, because a general state of scarcity increases the importance of small privileges and thus magnifies the distinction between one group and another.

name: thus
trans: ad. 如此；像这样；于是；因此
example: It is deliberate policy to keep even the favoured groups somewhere near the brink of hardship, because a general state of scarcity increases the importance of small privileges and thus magnifies the distinction between one group and another.

name: magnifies
example: It is deliberate policy to keep even the favoured groups somewhere near the brink of hardship, because a general state of scarcity increases the importance of small privileges and thus magnifies the distinction between one group and another.

name: austere
trans: 朴素的，朴实无华的
example: By the standards of the early twentieth century, even a member of the Inner Party lives an austere, laborious kind of life.

name: laborious
trans: adj.(指工作)艰苦的, 费力的, (指人)勤劳的。
example: By the standards of the early twentieth century, even a member of the Inner Party lives an austere, laborious kind of life.

name: luxuries
example: Nevertheless, the few luxuries that he does enjoy his large, well-appointed flat, the better texture of his clothes, the better quality of his food and drink and tobacco, his two or three servants, his private motor-car or helicopter--set him in a different world from a member of the Outer Party, and the members of the Outer Party have a similar advantage in comparison with the submerged masses whom we call 'the proles'.

name: comparison
trans: n. 比较，对比，比喻，比拟
example: Nevertheless, the few luxuries that he does enjoy his large, well-appointed flat, the better texture of his clothes, the better quality of his food and drink and tobacco, his two or three servants, his private motor-car or helicopter--set him in a different world from a member of the Outer Party, and the members of the Outer Party have a similar advantage in comparison with the submerged masses whom we call 'the proles'.

name: social
trans: a. 社会的；交际的
example: The social atmosphere is that of a besieged city, where the possession of a lump of horseflesh makes the difference between wealth and poverty.

name: besieged
trans: vt. 包围；围困；围攻时 态: besieged，besieging，besieges 名 词: besieger
example: The social atmosphere is that of a besieged city, where the possession of a lump of horseflesh makes the difference between wealth and poverty.

name: horseflesh
example: The social atmosphere is that of a besieged city, where the possession of a lump of horseflesh makes the difference between wealth and poverty.

name: handing
trans: n. 手，人手，雇员；专门业人员；指针v. 支持, 搀扶, 交给
example: And at the same time the consciousness of being at war, and therefore in danger, makes the handing-over of all power to a small caste seem the natural, unavoidable condition of survival.

name: accomplishes
trans: vt. 完成,实现
example: War, it will be seen, accomplishes the necessary destruction, but accomplishes it in a psychologically acceptable way.

name: psychologically
trans: 心理地
example: War, it will be seen, accomplishes the necessary destruction, but accomplishes it in a psychologically acceptable way.

name: acceptable
trans: a.可接受的，合意的
example: War, it will be seen, accomplishes the necessary destruction, but accomplishes it in a psychologically acceptable way.

name: temples
trans: 寺庙
example: In principle it would be quite simple to waste the surplus labour of the world by building temples and pyramids, by digging holes and filling them up again, or even by producing vast quantities of goods and then setting fire to them.

name: pyramids
trans: n. 金字塔
example: In principle it would be quite simple to waste the surplus labour of the world by building temples and pyramids, by digging holes and filling them up again, or even by producing vast quantities of goods and then setting fire to them.

name: digging
trans: n.挖掘v.挖，掘( dig的现在分词 ),（如用铲、锨或推土机等）挖掘,挖得,寻找
example: In principle it would be quite simple to waste the surplus labour of the world by building temples and pyramids, by digging holes and filling them up again, or even by producing vast quantities of goods and then setting fire to them.

name: quantities
trans: n. 数量，量
example: In principle it would be quite simple to waste the surplus labour of the world by building temples and pyramids, by digging holes and filling them up again, or even by producing vast quantities of goods and then setting fire to them.

name: provide
trans: v. 供应，供给，准备，预防，规定
example: But this would provide only the economic and not the emotional basis for a hierarchical society.

name: emotional
trans: a.感情的，情绪的
example: But this would provide only the economic and not the emotional basis for a hierarchical society.

name: morale
trans: n.士气，斗志
example: What is concerned here is not the morale of masses, whose attitude is unimportant so long as they are kept steadily at work, but the morale of the Party itself.

name: humblest
trans: a. 谦卑的,恭顺的;地位低下的;简陋的;vt. 使卑下,贬抑
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: competent
trans: a. 有能力的，能胜任的；足够的
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: industrious
trans: a.勤劳的，勤奋的
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: limits
trans: n. 界限，限度，范围v. (to)限制，限定
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: credulous
trans: adj. 轻信的；因轻信而产生的
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: ignorant
trans: a. 无知的，愚昧的；不知道的
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: moods
trans: n. 情绪（mood的复数）
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: adulation
trans: approbation, sycophant
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: orgiastic
example: Even the humblest Party member is expected to be competent, industrious, and even intelligent within narrow limits, but it is also necessary that he should be a credulous and ignorant fanatic whose prevailing moods are fear, hatred, adulation, and orgiastic triumph.

name: mentality
trans: n. 智力,心理状态
example: In other words it is necessary that he should have the mentality appropriate to a state of war.

name: badly
trans: ad. 非常，严重地；坏地，差地，拙劣地
example: It does not matter whether the war is actually happening, and, since no decisive victory is possible, it does not matter whether the war is going well or badly.

name: state
trans: n. 状态，情况；国，州v. 陈述，说明
example: All that is needed is that a state of war should exist.

name: requires
trans: v. 需要；(of)要求，命令
example: The splitting of the intelligence which the Party requires of its members, and which is more easily achieved in an atmosphere of war, is now almost universal, but the higher up the ranks one goes, the more marked it becomes.

name: ranks
trans: n. 军衔，社会阶层；排v. 分等级，把…分类
example: The splitting of the intelligence which the Party requires of its members, and which is more easily achieved in an atmosphere of war, is now almost universal, but the higher up the ranks one goes, the more marked it becomes.

name: strongest
trans: a. 强壮的，强大的；强烈的，浓的
example: It is precisely in the Inner Party that war hysteria and hatred of the enemy are strongest.

name: capacity
trans: n. 容量,容积;理解力;地位;资格
example: In his capacity as an administrator, it is often necessary for a member of the Inner Party to know that this or that item of war news is untruthful, and he may often be aware that the entire war is spurious and is either not happening or is being waged for purposes quite other than the declared ones: but such knowledge is easily neutralized by the technique of DOUBLETHINK.

name: administrator
trans: n. 管理者；行政官员；行政人员有管理(或行政)才能的人(由遗嘱检验法庭指定的)遗产管理人奉派暂管主教教区的牧师
example: In his capacity as an administrator, it is often necessary for a member of the Inner Party to know that this or that item of war news is untruthful, and he may often be aware that the entire war is spurious and is either not happening or is being waged for purposes quite other than the declared ones: but such knowledge is easily neutralized by the technique of DOUBLETHINK.

name: neutralized
trans: v.压制。5nju:trElaIz;

name: wavers
trans: vi.摇摆；犹豫不决
example: Meanwhile no Inner Party member wavers for an instant in his mystical belief that the war is real, and that it is bound to end victoriously, with Oceania the undisputed master of the entire world.

name: victoriously
trans: a.胜利的，得胜的
example: Meanwhile no Inner Party member wavers for an instant in his mystical belief that the war is real, and that it is bound to end victoriously, with Oceania the undisputed master of the entire world.

name: undisputed
trans: adj.无可置疑的,毫无疑问的,无可争辩的,无异议的
example: Meanwhile no Inner Party member wavers for an instant in his mystical belief that the war is real, and that it is bound to end victoriously, with Oceania the undisputed master of the entire world.

name: conquest
trans: n. 征服，征服地，掠取物
example: All members of the Inner Party believe in this coming conquest as an article of faith.

name: faith
trans: n. 信任,信仰
example: All members of the Inner Party believe in this coming conquest as an article of faith.

name: acquiring
trans: vt. 获得,取得
example: It is to be achieved either by gradually acquiring more and more territory and so building up an overwhelming preponderance of power, or by the discovery of some new and unanswerable weapon.

name: preponderance
trans: n.数量上的优势
example: It is to be achieved either by gradually acquiring more and more territory and so building up an overwhelming preponderance of power, or by the discovery of some new and unanswerable weapon.

name: weapon
trans: n. 武器，兵器
example: It is to be achieved either by gradually acquiring more and more territory and so building up an overwhelming preponderance of power, or by the discovery of some new and unanswerable weapon.

name: continues
trans: v. 继续，连续，延伸
example: The search for new weapons continues unceasingly, and is one of the very few remaining activities in which the inventive or speculative type of mind can find any outlet.

name: unceasingly
trans: unremitting
example: The search for new weapons continues unceasingly, and is one of the very few remaining activities in which the inventive or speculative type of mind can find any outlet.

name: inventive
trans: 发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的
example: The search for new weapons continues unceasingly, and is one of the very few remaining activities in which the inventive or speculative type of mind can find any outlet.

name: speculative
trans: adj. 投机的；推测的；思索性的
example: The search for new weapons continues unceasingly, and is one of the very few remaining activities in which the inventive or speculative type of mind can find any outlet.

name: Science
trans: n. 科学；学科
example: In Oceania at the present day, Science, in the old sense, has almost ceased to exist.

name: Science
trans: n. 科学；学科
example: In Newspeak there is no word for 'Science'.

name: method
trans: n. 方法，办法
example: The empirical method of thought, on which all the scientific achievements of the past were founded, is opposed to the most fundamental principles of Ingsoc.

name: achievements
trans: 成就
example: The empirical method of thought, on which all the scientific achievements of the past were founded, is opposed to the most fundamental principles of Ingsoc.

name: opposed
trans: adj. 敌对的；相反的
v. 使对立；反对（oppose的过去分词）
example: The empirical method of thought, on which all the scientific achievements of the past were founded, is opposed to the most fundamental principles of Ingsoc.

name: technological
trans: adj.技术的，工艺的
example: And even technological progress only happens when its products can in some way be used for the diminution of human liberty.

name: happens
trans: v. (偶然)发生；碰巧，恰好
example: And even technological progress only happens when its products can in some way be used for the diminution of human liberty.

name: diminution
trans: n. 减少，降低；缩小
example: And even technological progress only happens when its products can in some way be used for the diminution of human liberty.

name: useful
trans: a. 有用的，实用的；有益的，有帮助的
example: In all the useful arts the world is either standing still or going backwards.

name: arts
trans: n.人文学科;文科;
example: In all the useful arts the world is either standing still or going backwards.

name: cultivated
trans: v. 发展（cultivate的过去分词）；耕作；教化
adj. 耕种的；有教养的
example: The fields are cultivated with horse-ploughs while books are written by machinery.

name: ploughs
trans: n./v. 犁,犁形器具;犁地
example: The fields are cultivated with horse-ploughs while books are written by machinery.

name: vital
trans: a. 生命的;必需的;极其重要的
example: But in matters of vital importance--meaning, in effect, war and police espionage--the empirical approach is still encouraged, or at least tolerated.

name: tolerated
trans: vt. 容忍，默许；对(药物、毒品等)有耐力
example: But in matters of vital importance--meaning, in effect, war and police espionage--the empirical approach is still encouraged, or at least tolerated.

name: conquer
trans: vt. 征服,攻克
example: The two aims of the Party are to conquer the whole surface of the earth and to extinguish once and for all the possibility of independent thought.

name: extinguish
trans: vt. 熄灭,扑灭;根除,消灭
example: The two aims of the Party are to conquer the whole surface of the earth and to extinguish once and for all the possibility of independent thought.

name: solve
trans: v. 解决，解答
example: There are therefore two great problems which the Party is concerned to solve.

name: beforehand
trans: ad. 预先,事先
example: One is how to discover, against his will, what another human being is thinking, and the other is how to kill several hundred million people in a few seconds without giving warning beforehand.

name: research
trans: v. (into，on)研究，调查n.研究，调查
example: In so far as scientific research still continues, this is its subject matter.

name: scientist
trans: n. 科学家
example: The scientist of today is either a mixture of psychologist and inquisitor, studying with real ordinary minuteness the meaning of facial expressions, gestures, and tones of voice, and testing the truth-producing effects of drugs, shock therapy, hypnosis, and physical torture; or he is chemist, physicist, or biologist concerned only with such branches of his special subject as are relevant to the taking of life.

name: laboratories
trans: n. 实验室（laboratory的复数）
example: In the vast laboratories of the Ministry of Peace, and in the experimental stations hidden in the Brazilian forests, or in the Australian desert, or on lost islands of the Antarctic, the teams of experts are indefatigably at work.

name: planning
trans: n. 计划编制；规划
v. 设计；计划；预期（plan的ing形式）
example: Some are concerned simply with planning the logistics of future wars; others devise larger and larger rocket bombs, more and more powerful explosives, and more and more impenetrable armour-plating; others search for new and deadlier gases, or for soluble poisons capable of being produced in such quantities as to destroy the vegetation of whole continents, or for breeds of disease germs immunized against all possible antibodies; others strive to produce a vehicle that shall bore its way under the soil like a submarine under the water, or an aeroplane as independent of its base as a sailing-ship; others explore even remoter possibilities such as focusing the sun's rays through lenses suspended thousands of kilometres away in space, or producing artificial earthquakes and tidal waves by tapping the heat at the earth's centre.

example: Some are concerned simply with planning the logistics of future wars; others devise larger and larger rocket bombs, more and more powerful explosives, and more and more impenetrable armour-plating; others search for new and deadlier gases, or for soluble poisons capable of being produced in such quantities as to destroy the vegetation of whole continents, or for breeds of disease germs immunized against all possible antibodies; others strive to produce a vehicle that shall bore its way under the soil like a submarine under the water, or an aeroplane as independent of its base as a sailing-ship; others explore even remoter possibilities such as focusing the sun's rays through lenses suspended thousands of kilometres away in space, or producing artificial earthquakes and tidal waves by tapping the heat at the earth's centre.

name: projects
trans: n. 方案;计划;v. 设计;投影;抛
example: But none of these projects ever comes anywhere near realization, and none of the three super-states ever gains a significant lead on the others.

name: realization
trans: n.(理想等的)实现
example: But none of these projects ever comes anywhere near realization, and none of the three super-states ever gains a significant lead on the others.

name: gains
trans: v. 获得；增加；表等走快n. 增进，增加；收益
example: But none of these projects ever comes anywhere near realization, and none of the three super-states ever gains a significant lead on the others.

name: researches
trans: v. (into，on)研究，调查n.研究，调查
example: What is more remarkable is that all three powers already possess, in the atomic bomb, a weapon far more powerful than any that their present researches are likely to discover.

name: claims
trans: n. 要求;有所根据而索取的款项;要求权;要求之物; v. 要求承认;宣称;值得
example: Although the Party, according to its habit, claims the invention for itself, atomic bombs first appeared as early as the nineteen-forties, and were first used on a large scale about ten years later.

name: Western
trans: a. 西方的，西部的
example: At that time some hundreds of bombs were dropped on industrial centres, chiefly in European Russia, Western Europe, and North America.

name: America
example: At that time some hundreds of bombs were dropped on industrial centres, chiefly in European Russia, Western Europe, and North America.

name: convince
trans: vt. 使信服
example: The effect was to convince the ruling groups of all countries that a few more atomic bombs would mean the end of organized society, and hence of their own power.

name: Thereafter
trans: ad. 此后，以后
example: Thereafter, although no formal agreement was ever made or hinted at, no more bombs were dropped.

name: formal
trans: a. 正式的；形式的
example: Thereafter, although no formal agreement was ever made or hinted at, no more bombs were dropped.

name: store
trans: n. 商店，店铺；贮藏，贮备品v. 贮藏，贮备
example: All three powers merely continue to produce atomic bombs and store them up against the decisive opportunity which they all believe will come sooner or later.

name: art
trans: n. 艺术，美术；技术，技艺；文科，人文科学
example: And meanwhile the art of war has remained almost stationary for thirty or forty years.

name: stationary
trans: a. 固定的,定置的;不变动的, 不移动的
example: And meanwhile the art of war has remained almost stationary for thirty or forty years.

name: Helicopters
trans: n. 直升机
example: Helicopters are more used than they were formerly, bombing planes have been largely superseded by self-propelled projectiles, and the fragile movable battleship has given way to the almost unsinkable Floating Fortress; but otherwise there has been little development.

name: formerly
trans: ad.以前，从前
example: Helicopters are more used than they were formerly, bombing planes have been largely superseded by self-propelled projectiles, and the fragile movable battleship has given way to the almost unsinkable Floating Fortress; but otherwise there has been little development.

trans: vt. 推进,推动;激励,驱使

example: Helicopters are more used than they were formerly, bombing planes have been largely superseded by self-propelled projectiles, and the fragile movable battleship has given way to the almost unsinkable Floating Fortress; but otherwise there has been little development.

name: movable

动产；可移动的东西
example: Helicopters are more used than they were formerly, bombing planes have been largely superseded by self-propelled projectiles, and the fragile movable battleship has given way to the almost unsinkable Floating Fortress; but otherwise there has been little development.

trans: n.战舰
example: Helicopters are more used than they were formerly, bombing planes have been largely superseded by self-propelled projectiles, and the fragile movable battleship has given way to the almost unsinkable Floating Fortress; but otherwise there has been little development.

name: unsinkable
example: Helicopters are more used than they were formerly, bombing planes have been largely superseded by self-propelled projectiles, and the fragile movable battleship has given way to the almost unsinkable Floating Fortress; but otherwise there has been little development.

name: tank
trans: n. 罐，槽，箱；坦克vt. 储于槽中
example: The tank, the submarine, the torpedo, the machine gun, even the rifle and the hand grenade are still in use.

name: torpedo
trans: n.鱼雷，水雷
example: The tank, the submarine, the torpedo, the machine gun, even the rifle and the hand grenade are still in use.

name: slaughters
trans: n./vt. 屠宰,屠杀
example: And in spite of the endless slaughters reported in the Press and on the telescreens, the desperate battles of earlier wars, in which hundreds of thousands or even millions of men were often killed in a few weeks, have never been repeated.

name: reported
trans: adj.据报告的，据报导的，据传闻的
example: And in spite of the endless slaughters reported in the Press and on the telescreens, the desperate battles of earlier wars, in which hundreds of thousands or even millions of men were often killed in a few weeks, have never been repeated.

name: attempts
trans: vt./n. 尝试,企图
example: None of the three super-states ever attempts any manoeuvre which involves the risk of serious defeat.

name: manoeuvre
trans: vi. 调动；演习；用策略 vt. 诱使；操纵；耍花招 n. 策略（等于maneuvre）
example: None of the three super-states ever attempts any manoeuvre which involves the risk of serious defeat.

name: operation
trans: n. 运转，开动，操作，手术，运算，经营
example: When any large operation is undertaken, it is usually a surprise attack against an ally.

name: strategy
trans: n. 战略，策略；对策，政策
example: The strategy that all three powers are following, or pretend to themselves that they are following, is the same.

name: bargaining
trans: n.议价,讨价,商讨,商谈v.讨价还价，商谈( bargain的现在分词 ),提出条件，要求得到
example: The plan is, by a combination of fighting, bargaining, and well-timed strokes of treachery, to acquire a ring of bases completely encircling one or other of the rival states, and then to sign a pact of friendship with that rival and remain on peaceful terms for so many years as to lull suspicion to sleep.

name: timed
trans: n. 时间，时刻；次，回；时代，时期；倍，乘

name: lull
trans: n.暂停, 麻痹。vt.使平静, 哄骗, 使安静。vi.变平静
example: The plan is, by a combination of fighting, bargaining, and well-timed strokes of treachery, to acquire a ring of bases completely encircling one or other of the rival states, and then to sign a pact of friendship with that rival and remain on peaceful terms for so many years as to lull suspicion to sleep.

name: loaded
trans: a.有负载的
example: During this time rockets loaded with atomic bombs can be assembled at all the strategic spots; finally they will all be fired simultaneously, with effects so devastating as to make retaliation impossible.

name: devastating
trans: adj.破坏性的, 全然的。
example: During this time rockets loaded with atomic bombs can be assembled at all the strategic spots; finally they will all be fired simultaneously, with effects so devastating as to make retaliation impossible.

name: retaliation
trans: n.报复，反击
example: During this time rockets loaded with atomic bombs can be assembled at all the strategic spots; finally they will all be fired simultaneously, with effects so devastating as to make retaliation impossible.

name: pact
trans: n. 条约，协议，公约
example: It will then be time to sign a pact of friendship with the remaining world-power, in preparation for another attack.

name: scheme
trans: n./v. 安排;计划;阴谋
example: This scheme, it is hardly necessary to say, is a mere daydream, impossible of realization.

name: invasion
trans: n. 入侵，侵略，侵犯
example: Moreover, no fighting ever occurs except in the disputed areas round the Equator and the Pole: no invasion of enemy territory is ever undertaken.

name: explains
trans: v. 解释，说明
example: This explains the fact that in some places the frontiers between the super-states are arbitrary.

name: geographically
trans: adv.地理学上，在地理上，地理方面
example: Eurasia, for example, could easily conquer the British Isles, which are geographically part of Europe, or on the other hand it would be possible for Oceania to push its frontiers to the Rhine or even to the Vistula.

name: Rhine
example: Eurasia, for example, could easily conquer the British Isles, which are geographically part of Europe, or on the other hand it would be possible for Oceania to push its frontiers to the Rhine or even to the Vistula.

name: Vistula
example: Eurasia, for example, could easily conquer the British Isles, which are geographically part of Europe, or on the other hand it would be possible for Oceania to push its frontiers to the Rhine or even to the Vistula.

name: violate
trans: vt.
example: But this would violate the principle, followed on all sides though never formulated, of cultural integrity.

name: formulated
trans: vt. 精确地表达;制定;用公式表示
example: But this would violate the principle, followed on all sides though never formulated, of cultural integrity.

name: cultural
trans: adj.文化的
example: But this would violate the principle, followed on all sides though never formulated, of cultural integrity.

name: integrity
trans: n. 诚实,正直;完整,完整性
example: But this would violate the principle, followed on all sides though never formulated, of cultural integrity.

name: France
example: If Oceania were to conquer the areas that used once to be known as France and Germany, it would be necessary either to exterminate the inhabitants, a task of great physical difficulty, or to assimilate a population of about a hundred million people, who, so far as technical development goes, are roughly on the Oceanic level.

name: Germany
example: If Oceania were to conquer the areas that used once to be known as France and Germany, it would be necessary either to exterminate the inhabitants, a task of great physical difficulty, or to assimilate a population of about a hundred million people, who, so far as technical development goes, are roughly on the Oceanic level.

name: exterminate
trans: v.消除。
example: If Oceania were to conquer the areas that used once to be known as France and Germany, it would be necessary either to exterminate the inhabitants, a task of great physical difficulty, or to assimilate a population of about a hundred million people, who, so far as technical development goes, are roughly on the Oceanic level.

name: assimilate
trans: v.吸收。

name: Oceanic
trans: adj.海洋的，海洋产出的，生活于海洋的,远洋
example: If Oceania were to conquer the areas that used once to be known as France and Germany, it would be necessary either to exterminate the inhabitants, a task of great physical difficulty, or to assimilate a population of about a hundred million people, who, so far as technical development goes, are roughly on the Oceanic level.

name: problem
trans: n. 问题，疑难问题；思考题，讨论题
example: The problem is the same for all three super-states.

name: foreigners
trans: n. 外国人
example: It is absolutely necessary to their structure that there should be no contact with foreigners, except, to a limited extent, with war prisoners and coloured slaves.

name: darkest
trans: a. 黑暗的，深(色)的；隐秘的n. 无光，黑暗
example: Even the official ally of the moment is always regarded with the darkest suspicion.

name: citizen
trans: n. 公民；市民，居民
example: War prisoners apart, the average citizen of Oceania never sets eyes on a citizen of either Eurasia or Eastasia, and he is forbidden the knowledge of foreign languages.

name: sets
trans: n. 一套，一副，装置，接受机v. 提出，调整，日落
example: War prisoners apart, the average citizen of Oceania never sets eyes on a citizen of either Eurasia or Eastasia, and he is forbidden the knowledge of foreign languages.

name: languages
trans: n. 语系，语种；语言文字（language复数）
example: War prisoners apart, the average citizen of Oceania never sets eyes on a citizen of either Eurasia or Eastasia, and he is forbidden the knowledge of foreign languages.

name: foreigners
trans: n. 外国人
example: If he were allowed contact with foreigners he would discover that they are creatures similar to himself and that most of what he has been told about them is lies.

name: righteousness
trans: n.正直,正当,正义
example: The sealed world in which he lives would be broken, and the fear, hatred, and self-righteousness on which his morale depends might evaporate.

name: depends
trans: v. (on)取决于，依靠，信赖，相信
example: The sealed world in which he lives would be broken, and the fear, hatred, and self-righteousness on which his morale depends might evaporate.

name: evaporate
trans: v. 使蒸发,使脱水,消失
example: The sealed world in which he lives would be broken, and the fear, hatred, and self-righteousness on which his morale depends might evaporate.

name: Persia
example: It is therefore realized on all sides that however often Persia, or Egypt, or Java, or Ceylon may change hands, the main frontiers must never be crossed by anything except bombs.

name: Egypt
example: It is therefore realized on all sides that however often Persia, or Egypt, or Java, or Ceylon may change hands, the main frontiers must never be crossed by anything except bombs.

name: Java
example: It is therefore realized on all sides that however often Persia, or Egypt, or Java, or Ceylon may change hands, the main frontiers must never be crossed by anything except bombs.

name: Ceylon
example: It is therefore realized on all sides that however often Persia, or Egypt, or Java, or Ceylon may change hands, the main frontiers must never be crossed by anything except bombs.

name: namely
trans: ad. 即,也就是
example: Under this lies a fact never mentioned aloud, but tacitly understood and acted upon: namely, that the conditions of life in all three super-states are very much the same.

name: Neo
example: In Oceania the prevailing philosophy is called Ingsoc, in Eurasia it is called Neo-Bolshevism, and in Eastasia it is called by a Chinese name usually translated as Death-Worship, but perhaps better rendered as Obliteration of the Self.

name: Bolshevism
example: In Oceania the prevailing philosophy is called Ingsoc, in Eurasia it is called Neo-Bolshevism, and in Eastasia it is called by a Chinese name usually translated as Death-Worship, but perhaps better rendered as Obliteration of the Self.

name: translated
trans: v. 翻译，解释；转化，
example: In Oceania the prevailing philosophy is called Ingsoc, in Eurasia it is called Neo-Bolshevism, and in Eastasia it is called by a Chinese name usually translated as Death-Worship, but perhaps better rendered as Obliteration of the Self.

name: Worship
trans: n. 礼拜，礼拜仪式；崇拜v. 崇拜，敬仰；做礼拜
example: In Oceania the prevailing philosophy is called Ingsoc, in Eurasia it is called Neo-Bolshevism, and in Eastasia it is called by a Chinese name usually translated as Death-Worship, but perhaps better rendered as Obliteration of the Self.

example: In Oceania the prevailing philosophy is called Ingsoc, in Eurasia it is called Neo-Bolshevism, and in Eastasia it is called by a Chinese name usually translated as Death-Worship, but perhaps better rendered as Obliteration of the Self.

name: tenets
trans: n. 原则, 信条, 教义, 教条
example: The citizen of Oceania is not allowed to know anything of the tenets of the other two philosophies, but he is taught to execrate them as barbarous outrages upon morality and common sense.

name: philosophies
example: The citizen of Oceania is not allowed to know anything of the tenets of the other two philosophies, but he is taught to execrate them as barbarous outrages upon morality and common sense.

name: execrate
trans: 痛恨

name: barbarous
trans: 野蛮的；残暴的
example: The citizen of Oceania is not allowed to know anything of the tenets of the other two philosophies, but he is taught to execrate them as barbarous outrages upon morality and common sense.

name: outrages
trans: n. 暴行，侮辱，愤怒v. 凌辱，引起…义愤，强奸
example: The citizen of Oceania is not allowed to know anything of the tenets of the other two philosophies, but he is taught to execrate them as barbarous outrages upon morality and common sense.

name: philosophies
example: Actually the three philosophies are barely distinguishable, and the social systems which they support are not distinguishable at all.

name: support
trans: n./vt. 支撑；支持；赡养；维持n. 支持者；支柱
example: Actually the three philosophies are barely distinguishable, and the social systems which they support are not distinguishable at all.

name: semi
example: Everywhere there is the same pyramidal structure, the same worship of semi-divine leader, the same economy existing by and for continuous warfare.

name: divine
trans: a. 神的;极好的;v. 占卜
example: Everywhere there is the same pyramidal structure, the same worship of semi-divine leader, the same economy existing by and for continuous warfare.

name: gain
trans: v. 获得；增加；表等走快n. 增进，增加；收益
example: It follows that the three super-states not only cannot conquer one another, but would gain no advantage by doing so.

name: conflict
trans: n. 战斗,斗争;(意见)分歧;vi. 抵触,冲突
example: On the contrary, so long as they remain in conflict they prop one another up, like three sheaves of corn.

name: prop
trans: n. 支柱, 支柱物; vt. 支撑, 支持, 维持 时 态: propped, propping, props
example: On the contrary, so long as they remain in conflict they prop one another up, like three sheaves of corn.

name: sheaves
example: On the contrary, so long as they remain in conflict they prop one another up, like three sheaves of corn.

name: unaware
trans: adj. 不知道的，无意的；未察觉到的
adv. 意外地；不知不觉地
example: And, as usual, the ruling groups of all three powers are simultaneously aware and unaware of what they are doing.

name: everlastingly
trans: a. 永久的,永恒的
example: Their lives are dedicated to world conquest, but they also know that it is necessary that the war should continue everlastingly and without victory.

name: feature
trans: n./vt. 脸一部分,面貌,特征,特写,故事片;以…为特色
example: Meanwhile the fact that there IS no danger of conquest makes possible the denial of reality which is the special feature of Ingsoc and its rival systems of thought.

name: fundamentally
trans: ad
v. 基础地;根本地;重要地
example: Here it is necessary to repeat what has been said earlier, that by becoming continuous war has fundamentally changed its character.

name: ages
trans: abbr. 晚期糖基化终末产物（Advanced Glycation End Products）
example: In past ages, a war, almost by definition, was something that sooner or later came to an end, usually in unmistakable victory or defeat.

name: definition
trans: n. 定义，解释；(轮廓影像等的)清晰度；阐明；
example: In past ages, a war, almost by definition, was something that sooner or later came to an end, usually in unmistakable victory or defeat.

name: societies
example: In the past, also, war was one of the main instruments by which human societies were kept in touch with physical reality.

name: rulers
trans: n. 统治者，支配者；尺，直尺
example: All rulers in all ages have tried to impose a false view of the world upon their followers, but they could not afford to encourage any illusion that tended to impair military efficiency.

name: impose
trans: v. 征(税);把…强加于;利用
example: All rulers in all ages have tried to impose a false view of the world upon their followers, but they could not afford to encourage any illusion that tended to impair military efficiency.

name: followers
trans: n.契据的附面；从动件
example: All rulers in all ages have tried to impose a false view of the world upon their followers, but they could not afford to encourage any illusion that tended to impair military efficiency.

name: impair
trans: v.削弱。

name: loss
trans: n. 丧失，遗失；损失，损耗，亏损；失败
example: So long as defeat meant the loss of independence, or some other result generally held to be undesirable, the precautions against defeat had to be serious.

name: independence
trans: n. 独立，自主
example: So long as defeat meant the loss of independence, or some other result generally held to be undesirable, the precautions against defeat had to be serious.

name: undesirable
trans: n. 不良分子；不受欢迎的人

example: So long as defeat meant the loss of independence, or some other result generally held to be undesirable, the precautions against defeat had to be serious.

name: precautions
trans: 措施
example: So long as defeat meant the loss of independence, or some other result generally held to be undesirable, the precautions against defeat had to be serious.

name: Physical
trans: a. 物质的；肉体的，身体的；自然科学的，物理的
example: Physical facts could not be ignored.

name: religion
trans: n. 宗教，信仰
example: In philosophy, or religion, or ethics, or politics, two and two might make five, but when one was designing a gun or an aeroplane they had to make four.

name: ethics
trans: n. 行为准则，道德原则；伦理学，道德学
example: In philosophy, or religion, or ethics, or politics, two and two might make five, but when one was designing a gun or an aeroplane they had to make four.

name: politics
trans: n. 政治，政治学；政纲，政见
example: In philosophy, or religion, or ethics, or politics, two and two might make five, but when one was designing a gun or an aeroplane they had to make four.

name: designing
trans: adj. 有计划的；狡猾的，不怀好意的 n. 设计；阴谋 v. 设计；计划（design 的现在分词）
example: In philosophy, or religion, or ethics, or politics, two and two might make five, but when one was designing a gun or an aeroplane they had to make four.

name: Inefficient
trans: a.效率低的，无能的

name: nations
trans: n. 民族，国家
example: Inefficient nations were always conquered sooner or later, and the struggle for efficiency was inimical to illusions.

name: inimical
trans: 带有敌意的

name: illusions
trans: n. 幻象,错觉
example: Inefficient nations were always conquered sooner or later, and the struggle for efficiency was inimical to illusions.

name: efficient
trans: a. 能胜任的,效率高的
example: Moreover, to be efficient it was necessary to be able to learn from the past, which meant having a fairly accurate idea of what had happened in the past.

name: accurate
trans: a. 正确无误的；准确的，精确的
example: Moreover, to be efficient it was necessary to be able to learn from the past, which meant having a fairly accurate idea of what had happened in the past.

name: Newspapers
trans: n. 报纸，报章（newspaper的复数）
v. 从事报纸工作（newspaper的三单形式）
example: Newspapers and history books were, of course, always coloured and biased, but falsification of the kind that is practised today would have been impossible.

name: biased
trans: adj.有偏见的,有偏的,结果偏倚的v.使存偏见(bias的过去式和过去分词)
example: Newspapers and history books were, of course, always coloured and biased, but falsification of the kind that is practised today would have been impossible.

name: practised
trans: v. 练习，实习，实践，实行，使…练习，训练
example: Newspapers and history books were, of course, always coloured and biased, but falsification of the kind that is practised today would have been impossible.

name: safeguard
trans: vt.维护, 保护, 捍卫。n.安全装置, 安全措施
example: War was a sure safeguard of sanity, and so far as the ruling classes were concerned it was probably the most important of all safeguards.

name: safeguards
trans: vt.维护, 保护, 捍卫。n.安全装置, 安全措施
example: War was a sure safeguard of sanity, and so far as the ruling classes were concerned it was probably the most important of all safeguards.

name: irresponsible
trans: adj. 不负责任的；不可靠的
example: While wars could be won or lost, no ruling class could be completely irresponsible.

name: ceases
trans: v. 停止
example: But when war becomes literally continuous, it also ceases to be dangerous.

name: necessity
trans: n. 必要性，需要；必然性；(pl.)必需品
example: When war is continuous there is no such thing as military necessity.

name: Technical
trans: a. 技术(性)的，工艺的；专门性的，专业性的
example: Technical progress can cease and the most palpable facts can be denied or disregarded.

name: cease
trans: v. 停止
example: Technical progress can cease and the most palpable facts can be denied or disregarded.

name: daydreaming
trans: n. 白日梦
vi. 做白日梦
example: As we have seen, researches that could be called scientific are still carried out for the purposes of war, but they are essentially a kind of daydreaming, and their failure to show results is not important.

name: Efficiency
trans: n. 效率；功效
example: Efficiency, even military efficiency, is no longer needed.

name: efficient
trans: a. 能胜任的,效率高的
example: Nothing is efficient in Oceania except the Thought Police.

name: perversion
trans: n.歪曲，曲解,变坏,医性欲倒错,心性变态
example: Since each of the three super-states is unconquerable, each is in effect a separate universe within which almost any perversion of thought can be safely practised.

name: safely
trans: ad.安全地；可靠地
example: Since each of the three super-states is unconquerable, each is in effect a separate universe within which almost any perversion of thought can be safely practised.

name: exerts
trans: vt. 发挥,行使,尽力

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别，差别；级别；特性；声望；显赫
example: Between life and death, and between physical pleasure and physical pain, there is still a distinction, but that is all.

name: Cut
trans: n./v. 切，割，削；削减，删节n. 切口，伤口
example: Cut off from contact with the outer world, and with the past, the citizen of Oceania is like a man in interstellar space, who has no way of knowing which direction is up and which is down.

name: interstellar
trans: adj. [航][天] 星际的
example: Cut off from contact with the outer world, and with the past, the citizen of Oceania is like a man in interstellar space, who has no way of knowing which direction is up and which is down.

name: Pharaohs
trans: n.法老王（古埃及君主称号）, 暴君。
example: The rulers of such a state are absolute, as the Pharaohs or the Caesars could not be.

name: Caesars
example: The rulers of such a state are absolute, as the Pharaohs or the Caesars could not be.

name: followers
trans: n.契据的附面；从动件
example: They are obliged to prevent their followers from starving to death in numbers large enough to be inconvenient, and they are obliged to remain at the same low level of military technique as their rivals; but once that minimum is achieved, they can twist reality into whatever shape they choose.

name: minimum
trans: n. 最小量,最低限度

name: imposture
trans: n. 欺诈，欺骗；冒牌
example: The war, therefore, if we judge it by the standards of previous wars, is merely an imposture.

name: ruminant
trans: adj. 沉思的；反刍的 n. 反刍动物
example: It is like the battles between certain ruminant animals whose horns are set at such an angle that they are incapable of hurting one another.

name: horns
trans: n. (牛羊等的)角；号，喇叭；角状物；角制品
example: It is like the battles between certain ruminant animals whose horns are set at such an angle that they are incapable of hurting one another.

trans: n. 伤痛，伤害v. 刺痛，伤害；伤…的感情

name: unreal
trans: 不真实的；假的；幻想的；虚构的

name: eats
trans: vt. 吃，喝vi. 吃饭，吃东西

name: consumable
example: It eats up the surplus of consumable goods, and it helps to preserve the special mental atmosphere that a hierarchical society needs.

name: helps

example: It eats up the surplus of consumable goods, and it helps to preserve the special mental atmosphere that a hierarchical society needs.

name: mental
trans: a. 精神的，思想的，心理的，智力的，脑力的

name: purely
trans: ad.纯粹地，完全地

name: limit
trans: n. 界限，限度，范围v. (to)限制，限定
example: In the past, the ruling groups of all countries, although they might recognize their common interest and therefore limit the destructiveness of war, did fight against one another, and the victor always plundered the vanquished.

name: destructiveness

name: fighting
trans: adj. 好战的；战斗的；适于格斗的

v. 打仗；与…进行拳击；奋斗（fight的ing形式）

name: conquests
trans: n. 征服，征服地，掠取物

trans: adj.完整无缺的, 尚未被人碰过的, (女子)保持童贞的, (家畜)未经阉割的。

name: accurate
trans: a. 正确无误的；准确的，精确的

name: exerted
trans: vt. 发挥,行使,尽力

name: perpetual
trans: a. 永久的,永恒的

name: freed
trans: a. 自由的；免费的；免税的；空闲的vt. 释放

name: sobering
trans: staid

name: shallower
trans: a. 浅的,肤浅的

name: reading
trans: n. 读书，读物，(仪表等的)读数，阅读

name: Solitude

name: scattered

name: enormously

name: week
trans: n. 星期，周

name: disentangled
trans: vi.解脱, 解开纠结, 松开, 解决(纠纷)。vt.解开, 松开。

name: got
trans: vbl. get 的过去式

name: stove

name: return
trans: v./n. 返回，回来；归还，送还；回答

name: pull

name: flagstones

name: brawny
trans: adj. 强壮的；肌肉结实的

example: The brawny red-armed woman whom Winston had seen there on his first visit was almost a fixture in the yard.

name: gagging
trans: 笑话；玩笑之举

name: settled
trans: adj.不变的，稳定的,固定的,妥,停当

name: bedhead

name: read
trans: v.读书

name: too
trans: ad. 也，还；太，过于；很，非常

name: Brotherhood

name: shut

name: Read
trans: v.读书
example: 'Read it aloud.

name: best
trans: a. 最好的(good和well的最高级)ad. 最好地；最
example: That's the best way.

name: explain
trans: v. 解释，说明
example: Then you can explain it to me as you go.

name: eighteen
trans: num. 十八，十八个
example: ' The clock's hands said six, meaning eighteen.

name: ahead
trans: ad. 在前面(头)；向(朝)前；提前
example: They had three or four hours ahead of them.

trans: n. 支柱, 支柱物; vt. 支撑, 支持, 维持 时 态: propped, propping, props

name: upheavals
trans: n. 剧变；隆起；举起
example: Even after enormous upheavals and seemingly irrevocable changes, the same pattern has always reasserted itself, just as a gyroscope will always return to equilibrium, however far it is pushed one way or the other 'Julia, are you awake?

name: listening
trans: 倾听(动词listen的动名词)

name: marvellous

example: It's marvellous.

name: irreconcilable
trans: adj. 矛盾的；不能和解的；不能协调的
example: ' He continued reading: The aims of these three groups are entirely irreconcilable.

name: High
trans: a. 高的，高度的，高级的，高尚的ad. 高高地
example: The aim of the High is to remain where they are.

name: places
trans: n. 地点；位置；位数（place的复数）
v. 放置（place的第三人称单数）

name: abiding
trans: v. 容忍；居住；接受（规则、劝告等）；（感情）始终不渝（abide 的现在分词） adj. 持久的；始终不渝的
example: The aim of the Low, when they have an aim--for it is an abiding characteristic of the Low that they are too much crushed by drudgery to be more than intermittently conscious of anything outside their daily lives--is to abolish all distinctions and create a society in which all men shall be equal.

name: abolish
trans: vt. 废除

name: distinctions
trans: n. 区别，差别；级别；特性；声望；显赫
example: The aim of the Low, when they have an aim--for it is an abiding characteristic of the Low that they are too much crushed by drudgery to be more than intermittently conscious of anything outside their daily lives--is to abolish all distinctions and create a society in which all men shall be equal.

name: outlines
trans: n. 提纲;外形,轮廓,略图; vt. 概述,概括;描…外形,描…轮廊

name: govern
