name: efficiently
trans: ad
v. 效率高地有效地
example: For long periods the High seem to be securely in power, but sooner or later there always comes a moment when they lose either their belief in themselves or their capacity to govern efficiently, or both.

name: enlist
trans: vt. 使入伍；征募；谋取…的赞助或帮助
vi. 支持；从军；应募；赞助
example: They are then overthrown by the Middle, who enlist the Low on their side by pretending to them that they are fighting for liberty and justice.

name: justice
trans: n. 公正，公平；审判，司法
example: They are then overthrown by the Middle, who enlist the Low on their side by pretending to them that they are fighting for liberty and justice.

name: servitude
trans: 劳役，奴役；地役权；奴隶状态
example: As soon as they have reached their objective, the Middle thrust the Low back into their old position of servitude, and themselves become the High.

name: splits
trans: vt./vi. 劈开,使裂开;分离
example: Presently a new Middle group splits off from one of the other groups, or from both of them, and the struggle begins over again.

name: achieving
trans: vt. 完成,达到
example: Of the three groups, only the Low are never even temporarily successful in achieving their aims.

name: exaggeration
trans: n.夸张
example: It would be an exaggeration to say that throughout history there has been no progress of a material kind.

name: decline
trans: n./v. 下降;衰退,减弱;谢绝
example: Even today, in a period of decline, the average human being is physically better off than he was a few centuries ago.

name: softening
trans: vt.使软化vi.变软弱
example: But no advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimetre nearer.

name: manners
trans: n. 方式；举止；(pl.)风度，礼貌；规矩；风俗
example: But no advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimetre nearer.

name: reform
trans: v. 改革，改造，改良n. 改革，改造，改良
example: But no advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimetre nearer.

name: equality
trans: n. 同等；平等；相等；等式；等同性
example: But no advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimetre nearer.

name: millimetre
trans: n.毫米
example: But no advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimetre nearer.

name: historic
trans: a. 有历史意义的
example: From the point of view of the Low, no historic change has ever meant much more than a change in the name of their masters.

name: recurrence
trans: n.再发生
example: By the late nineteenth century the recurrence of this pattern had become obvious to many observers.

name: observers
trans: n.观察员，观测者
example: By the late nineteenth century the recurrence of this pattern had become obvious to many observers.

name: schools
trans: n. 学校（school的复数形式）
example: There then rose schools of thinkers who interpreted history as a cyclical process and claimed to show that inequality was the unalterable law of human life.

name: interpreted
trans: v. 解释,说明,认为…的意思,口译
example: There then rose schools of thinkers who interpreted history as a cyclical process and claimed to show that inequality was the unalterable law of human life.

name: cyclical
trans: 周期的，循环的
example: There then rose schools of thinkers who interpreted history as a cyclical process and claimed to show that inequality was the unalterable law of human life.

name: adherents
trans: n. （政党、思想的）拥护者 adj. 粘着的；遵守的；（植物）联生的
example: This doctrine, of course, had always had its adherents, but in the manner in which it was now put forward there was a significant change.

name: specifically
trans: ad
v. 特有地, 特定地, 具体地明确地说明确些, 亦即, 就是
example: In the past the need for a hierarchical form of society had been the doctrine specifically of the High.

name: preached
trans: vt./vi. 传教;讲道;劝诫;鼓吹
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: kings
trans: n. 君主，国王
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: aristocrats
trans: n.贵族
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: parasitical
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: softened
trans: v.（使）变软( soften的过去式和过去分词 ),缓解打击,缓和,安慰
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: promises
trans: n./v. 诺言;指望;前途
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: compensation
trans: n. 补偿(或赔偿)的款物；补偿，赔偿
example: It had been preached by kings and aristocrats and by the priests, lawyers, and the like who were parasitical upon them, and it had generally been softened by promises of compensation in an imaginary world beyond the grave.

name: fraternity
trans: 友爱；兄弟会；互助会；大学生联谊会
example: The Middle, so long as it was struggling for power, had always made use of such terms as freedom, justice, and fraternity.

name: brotherhood
trans: n.兄弟情谊
example: Now, however, the concept of human brotherhood began to be assailed by people who were not yet in positions of command, but merely hoped to be so before long.

name: assailed
trans: vt. 攻击；质问；着手解决
example: Now, however, the concept of human brotherhood began to be assailed by people who were not yet in positions of command, but merely hoped to be so before long.

name: positions
trans: n. 位置；职位；姿势，姿态；见解，立场，形势
example: Now, however, the concept of human brotherhood began to be assailed by people who were not yet in positions of command, but merely hoped to be so before long.

name: banner
trans: n. 旗
example: In the past the Middle had made revolutions under the banner of equality, and then had established a fresh tyranny as soon as the old one was overthrown.

name: established
trans: adj.已建立的
example: In the past the Middle had made revolutions under the banner of equality, and then had established a fresh tyranny as soon as the old one was overthrown.

name: tyranny
trans: n.暴政，专制；残暴
example: In the past the Middle had made revolutions under the banner of equality, and then had established a fresh tyranny as soon as the old one was overthrown.

name: proclaimed
trans: vt. 宣告,声明;显示
example: The new Middle groups in effect proclaimed their tyranny beforehand.

name: rebellions
trans: n. 叛乱，反抗，起义
example: Socialism, a theory which appeared in the early nineteenth century and was the last link in a chain of thought stretching back to the slave rebellions of antiquity, was still deeply infected by the Utopianism of past ages.

name: antiquity
trans: n. 古代（尤指古希腊和古罗马时期）；年代久远；文物，古物；古代，古时（尤指古埃及、古希腊、古罗马时期）
example: Socialism, a theory which appeared in the early nineteenth century and was the last link in a chain of thought stretching back to the slave rebellions of antiquity, was still deeply infected by the Utopianism of past ages.

name: Utopianism
example: Socialism, a theory which appeared in the early nineteenth century and was the last link in a chain of thought stretching back to the slave rebellions of antiquity, was still deeply infected by the Utopianism of past ages.

name: variant
trans: adj.不同的，不一致的
example: But in each variant of Socialism that appeared from about 1900 onwards the aim of establishing liberty and equality was more and more openly abandoned.

name: establishing
trans: vt. 建立;确立;证实;使人接受
example: But in each variant of Socialism that appeared from about 1900 onwards the aim of establishing liberty and equality was more and more openly abandoned.

name: perpetuating
trans: vt.使永存, 使不朽。
example: The new movements which appeared in the middle years of the century, Ingsoc in Oceania, Neo-Bolshevism in Eurasia, Death-Worship, as it is commonly called, in Eastasia, had the conscious aim of perpetuating UNfreedom and INequality.

name: UNfreedom
trans: n. 自由，自主，免除，特权
example: The new movements which appeared in the middle years of the century, Ingsoc in Oceania, Neo-Bolshevism in Eurasia, Death-Worship, as it is commonly called, in Eastasia, had the conscious aim of perpetuating UNfreedom and INequality.

name: INequality
trans: n. 不平等,不均等,不等量
example: The new movements which appeared in the middle years of the century, Ingsoc in Oceania, Neo-Bolshevism in Eurasia, Death-Worship, as it is commonly called, in Eastasia, had the conscious aim of perpetuating UNfreedom and INequality.

name: lip
trans: n. 嘴唇
example: These new movements, of course, grew out of the old ones and tended to keep their names and pay lip-service to their ideology.

name: freeze
trans: v. 使结冰，使凝固
example: But the purpose of all of them was to arrest progress and freeze history at a chosen moment.

name: pendulum
trans: n.钟摆, 摇锤。
example: The familiar pendulum swing was to happen once more, and then stop.

name: maintain
trans: vt. 维持;抚养;坚持;维修
example: As usual, the High were to be turned out by the Middle, who would then become the High; but this time, by conscious strategy, the High would be able to maintain their position permanently.

name: arose
example: The new doctrines arose partly because of the accumulation of historical knowledge, and the growth of the historical sense, which had hardly existed before the nineteenth century.

name: accumulation
trans: n.积累
example: The new doctrines arose partly because of the accumulation of historical knowledge, and the growth of the historical sense, which had hardly existed before the nineteenth century.

name: growth
trans: n. 生长，增长，发展
example: The new doctrines arose partly because of the accumulation of historical knowledge, and the growth of the historical sense, which had hardly existed before the nineteenth century.

name: cyclical
trans: 周期的，循环的
example: The cyclical movement of history was now intelligible, or appeared to be so; and if it was intelligible, then it was alterable.

name: intelligible
trans: adj.可理解的。
example: The cyclical movement of history was now intelligible, or appeared to be so; and if it was intelligible, then it was alterable.

name: underlying
trans: a. 含蓄的,潜在的;在下面的
example: But the principal, underlying cause was that, as early as the beginning of the twentieth century, human equality had become technically possible.

name: technically
trans: adv. 技术上；专门地；学术上；工艺上
example: But the principal, underlying cause was that, as early as the beginning of the twentieth century, human equality had become technically possible.

name: talents
trans: n. 才能，天资；人才
example: It was still true that men were not equal in their native talents and that functions had to be specialized in ways that favoured some individuals against others; but there was no longer any real need for class distinctions or for large differences of wealth.

name: functions
trans: n. 职责,作用,正式社会集会 vi. 起作用,运行
example: It was still true that men were not equal in their native talents and that functions had to be specialized in ways that favoured some individuals against others; but there was no longer any real need for class distinctions or for large differences of wealth.

name: specialized
trans: adj.专业的，专门的
example: It was still true that men were not equal in their native talents and that functions had to be specialized in ways that favoured some individuals against others; but there was no longer any real need for class distinctions or for large differences of wealth.

name: differences
trans: n. 差别，差异，分歧
example: It was still true that men were not equal in their native talents and that functions had to be specialized in ways that favoured some individuals against others; but there was no longer any real need for class distinctions or for large differences of wealth.

name: distinctions
trans: n. 区别，差别；级别；特性；声望；显赫
example: In earlier ages, class distinctions had been not only inevitable but desirable.

name: Inequality
trans: n. 不平等,不均等,不等量
example: Inequality was the price of civilization.

name: development
trans: n.发展；开发；生长
example: With the development of machine production, however, the case was altered.

name: levels
trans: n. 水平，标准（level复数形式）；色阶调整；控制色阶
v. 拉平，变平（level的第三人称单数形式）
example: Even if it was still necessary for human beings to do different kinds of work, it was no longer necessary for them to live at different social or economic levels.

name: Therefore
trans: ad. 因此，所以conj. 因此
example: Therefore, from the point of view of the new groups who were on the point of seizing power, human equality was no longer an ideal to be striven after, but a danger to be averted.

name: striven
example: Therefore, from the point of view of the new groups who were on the point of seizing power, human equality was no longer an ideal to be striven after, but a danger to be averted.

name: averted
trans: v.转移。
example: Therefore, from the point of view of the new groups who were on the point of seizing power, human equality was no longer an ideal to be striven after, but a danger to be averted.

name: primitive
trans: a. 原始的,简单的
example: In more primitive ages, when a just and peaceful society was in fact not possible, it had been fairly easy to believe it.

name: earthly
trans: adj.世俗的
example: The idea of an earthly paradise in which men should live together in a state of brotherhood, without laws and without brute labour, had haunted the human imagination for thousands of years.

name: profited
trans: n. 利益,利润
example: And this vision had had a certain hold even on the groups who actually profited by each historical change.

name: heirs
trans: n. 继承人
example: The heirs of the French, English, and American revolutions had partly believed in their own phrases about the rights of man, freedom of speech, equality before the law, and the like, and have even allowed their conduct to be influenced by them to some extent.

name: French
example: The heirs of the French, English, and American revolutions had partly believed in their own phrases about the rights of man, freedom of speech, equality before the law, and the like, and have even allowed their conduct to be influenced by them to some extent.

name: American
trans: a.美国的
example: The heirs of the French, English, and American revolutions had partly believed in their own phrases about the rights of man, freedom of speech, equality before the law, and the like, and have even allowed their conduct to be influenced by them to some extent.

name: rights
trans: a. 右的，正确的n. 右，权利ad. 在右边，正确地
example: The heirs of the French, English, and American revolutions had partly believed in their own phrases about the rights of man, freedom of speech, equality before the law, and the like, and have even allowed their conduct to be influenced by them to some extent.

name: influenced
trans: n. (on)影响，感化；势力，权势v. 影响，感化
example: The heirs of the French, English, and American revolutions had partly believed in their own phrases about the rights of man, freedom of speech, equality before the law, and the like, and have even allowed their conduct to be influenced by them to some extent.

name: currents
trans: n. 电流，水流；潮流，趋势a. 当前的；流通的
example: But by the fourth decade of the twentieth century all the main currents of political thought were authoritarian.

name: authoritarian
trans: 独裁主义的；权力主义的
权力主义者；独裁主义者
example: But by the fourth decade of the twentieth century all the main currents of political thought were authoritarian.

name: realizable
example: The earthly paradise had been discredited at exactly the moment when it became realizable.

name: hierarchy
trans: n.层次。层级。
example: Every new political theory, by whatever name it called itself, led back to hierarchy and regimentation.

name: regimentation
trans: n. 编组团队 组织化;系统化
example: Every new political theory, by whatever name it called itself, led back to hierarchy and regimentation.

name: hardening
trans: v. (使)变硬
example: And in the general hardening of outlook that set in round about 1930, practices which had been long abandoned, in some cases for hundreds of years--imprisonment without trial, the use of war prisoners as slaves, public executions, torture to extract confessions, the use of hostages, and the deportation of whole populations--not only became common again, but were tolerated and even defended by people who considered themselves enlightened and progressive.

name: outlook
trans: n. 景色，风光；观点，见解；展望，前景
example: And in the general hardening of outlook that set in round about 1930, practices which had been long abandoned, in some cases for hundreds of years--imprisonment without trial, the use of war prisoners as slaves, public executions, torture to extract confessions, the use of hostages, and the deportation of whole populations--not only became common again, but were tolerated and even defended by people who considered themselves enlightened and progressive.

name: practices
trans: n. 实践（practice的复数）；练习
v. 练习（practice的第三人称单数形式）

trans: adj.开明的,有知识的,有见识的,进步的v.启发,开导

trans: a. 进步的，先进的；前进的

name: national
trans: a. 民族的，国家的，国立的
example: It was only after a decade of national wars, civil wars, revolutions, and counter-revolutions in all parts of the world that Ingsoc and its rivals emerged as fully worked-out political theories.

name: foreshadowed
trans: vt. 预示；成为…的前兆
n. 预兆
example: But they had been foreshadowed by the various systems, generally called totalitarian, which had appeared earlier in the century, and the main outlines of the world which would emerge from the prevailing chaos had long been obvious.

name: totalitarian
trans: 极权主义的
极权主义者
example: But they had been foreshadowed by the various systems, generally called totalitarian, which had appeared earlier in the century, and the main outlines of the world which would emerge from the prevailing chaos had long been obvious.

example: But they had been foreshadowed by the various systems, generally called totalitarian, which had appeared earlier in the century, and the main outlines of the world which would emerge from the prevailing chaos had long been obvious.

name: chaos
trans: n. 混乱,纷乱
example: But they had been foreshadowed by the various systems, generally called totalitarian, which had appeared earlier in the century, and the main outlines of the world which would emerge from the prevailing chaos had long been obvious.

name: equally
trans: adv.相等地，相同地
example: What kind of people would control this world had been equally obvious.

name: aristocracy
trans: n.贵族阶层
example: The new aristocracy was made up for the most part of bureaucrats, scientists, technicians, trade-union organizers, publicity experts, sociologists, teachers, journalists, and professional politicians.

name: bureaucrats
trans: 官僚；官僚主义者

trans: a. 职业的 n. 专业人员

name: origins
trans: n. 起源（origin的复数）
example: These people, whose origins lay in the salaried middle class and the upper grades of the working class, had been shaped and brought together by the barren world of monopoly industry and centralized government.

trans: adj. 有薪水的；领薪水的
v. 给…薪水（salary的过去式和过去分词）

name: avaricious
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪得无厌的
example: As compared with their opposite numbers in past ages, they were less avaricious, less tempted by luxury, hungrier for pure power, and, above all, more conscious of what they were doing and more intent on crushing opposition.

name: luxury
trans: n. 奢侈,奢侈品
example: As compared with their opposite numbers in past ages, they were less avaricious, less tempted by luxury, hungrier for pure power, and, above all, more conscious of what they were doing and more intent on crushing opposition.
