example: As compared with their opposite numbers in past ages, they were less avaricious, less tempted by luxury, hungrier for pure power, and, above all, more conscious of what they were doing and more intent on crushing opposition.

name: intent
trans: a. (目光)不能移的,集中的,专心的;坚决的 n. 意图,意向,目的
example: As compared with their opposite numbers in past ages, they were less avaricious, less tempted by luxury, hungrier for pure power, and, above all, more conscious of what they were doing and more intent on crushing opposition.

name: cardinal
trans: a. 主要的,基本的;n. 深红色;基数
example: This last difference was cardinal.

name: tyrannies
example: By comparison with that existing today, all the tyrannies of the past were half-hearted and inefficient.

name: hearted
trans: n. 心(脏)；内心，感情；热忱；中心，要点
example: By comparison with that existing today, all the tyrannies of the past were half-hearted and inefficient.

name: inefficient
trans: a.效率低的，无能的
example: By comparison with that existing today, all the tyrannies of the past were half-hearted and inefficient.

name: liberal
trans: a. 慷慨的,大方的,胸怀宽大的;n. 自由主义者
example: The ruling groups were always infected to some extent by liberal ideas, and were content to leave loose ends everywhere, to regard only the overt act and to be uninterested in what their subjects were thinking.

name: regard
trans: v. (as)把…看作为；考虑n. (pl.)敬重，问候
example: The ruling groups were always infected to some extent by liberal ideas, and were content to leave loose ends everywhere, to regard only the overt act and to be uninterested in what their subjects were thinking.

name: overt
trans: adj.明显的, 公然的。
example: The ruling groups were always infected to some extent by liberal ideas, and were content to leave loose ends everywhere, to regard only the overt act and to be uninterested in what their subjects were thinking.

name: uninterested
trans: adj.不感兴趣的
example: The ruling groups were always infected to some extent by liberal ideas, and were content to leave loose ends everywhere, to regard only the overt act and to be uninterested in what their subjects were thinking.

name: Catholic
trans: n. 天主教教徒
example: Even the Catholic Church of the Middle Ages was tolerant by modern standards.

name: Part
trans: n. 部分，角色，一方，零件，地区，部，篇v. 使分开
example: Part of the reason for this was that in the past no government had the power to keep its citizens under constant surveillance.

name: surveillance
trans: n. 盯梢, 监视
example: Part of the reason for this was that in the past no government had the power to keep its citizens under constant surveillance.

name: easier
example: The invention of print, however, made it easier to manipulate public opinion, and the film and the radio carried the process further.

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 操纵,控制;(熟练地)操作,使用
example: The invention of print, however, made it easier to manipulate public opinion, and the film and the radio carried the process further.

name: radio
trans: n. 收音机；无线电报，无线电话v. 无线电通讯
example: The invention of print, however, made it easier to manipulate public opinion, and the film and the radio carried the process further.

name: television
trans: n. 电视；电视机
example: With the development of television, and the technical advance which made it possible to receive and transmit simultaneously on the same instrument, private life came to an end.

name: transmit
trans: vt. 传输/导；转送；发射vi. 发射信号；发报
example: With the development of television, and the technical advance which made it possible to receive and transmit simultaneously on the same instrument, private life came to an end.

name: channels
trans: n. 海峡，水道；信道，波道；路线，途径
example: Every citizen, or at least every citizen important enough to be worth watching, could be kept for twenty-four hours a day under the eyes of the police and in the sound of official propaganda, with all other channels of communication closed.

name: enforcing
trans: vt. 强迫服从;实施;加强
example: The possibility of enforcing not only complete obedience to the will of the State, but complete uniformity of opinion on all subjects, now existed for the first time.

name: obedience
trans: n. 服从，顺从
example: The possibility of enforcing not only complete obedience to the will of the State, but complete uniformity of opinion on all subjects, now existed for the first time.

name: regrouped
trans: vt.重新组合,重新分类,军重新编制,重新部署vi.重新聚集,重新组合,重新编制,重新部署
example: After the revolutionary period of the fifties and sixties, society regrouped itself, as always, into High, Middle, and Low.

name: unlike
trans: a. 不同的，不相似的prep. 不象，和…不同
example: But the new High group, unlike all its forerunners, did not act upon instinct but knew what was needed to safeguard its position.

name: forerunners
trans: n.先驱(者), 传令官, 预兆。
example: But the new High group, unlike all its forerunners, did not act upon instinct but knew what was needed to safeguard its position.

name: oligarchy
trans: n. 寡头统治的政府 寡头政治的执政集团 寡头统治的国家
example: It had long been realized that the only secure basis for oligarchy is collectivism.

name: collectivism
example: It had long been realized that the only secure basis for oligarchy is collectivism.

name: Wealth
trans: n. 财富，财产；大量
example: Wealth and privilege are most easily defended when they are possessed jointly.

name: jointly
trans: ad
v. 共同地；连带地
example: Wealth and privilege are most easily defended when they are possessed jointly.

name: abolition
trans: n.废除，取消
example: The so-called 'abolition of private property' which took place in the middle years of the century meant, in effect, the concentration of property in far fewer hands than before: but with this difference, that the new owners were a group instead of a mass of individuals.

name: property
trans: n. 财产,房产,性质
example: The so-called 'abolition of private property' which took place in the middle years of the century meant, in effect, the concentration of property in far fewer hands than before: but with this difference, that the new owners were a group instead of a mass of individuals.

name: concentration
trans: n.集中；专注；浓缩
example: The so-called 'abolition of private property' which took place in the middle years of the century meant, in effect, the concentration of property in far fewer hands than before: but with this difference, that the new owners were a group instead of a mass of individuals.

name: owners
trans: n. 物主，所有者
example: The so-called 'abolition of private property' which took place in the middle years of the century meant, in effect, the concentration of property in far fewer hands than before: but with this difference, that the new owners were a group instead of a mass of individuals.

name: Individually
trans: adv. 个别地，单独地
example: Individually, no member of the Party owns anything, except petty personal belongings.

name: owns
trans: a. (用在所有格后面，加强语气)自己的
example: Individually, no member of the Party owns anything, except petty personal belongings.

name: belongings
trans: 财产，东西，所有物
example: Individually, no member of the Party owns anything, except petty personal belongings.

name: Collectively
trans: adv. 全体地；共同地
example: Collectively, the Party owns everything in Oceania, because it controls everything, and disposes of the products as it thinks fit.

name: thinks
trans: v. 想，思索；认为，以为；想要；料想，预料
example: Collectively, the Party owns everything in Oceania, because it controls everything, and disposes of the products as it thinks fit.

name: unopposed
trans: adj. 敌对的；相反的
v. 使对立；反对（oppose的过去分词）
example: In the years following the Revolution it was able to step into this commanding position almost unopposed, because the whole process was represented as an act of collectivization.

name: collectivization
example: In the years following the Revolution it was able to step into this commanding position almost unopposed, because the whole process was represented as an act of collectivization.

name: expropriated
trans: 没收，征用；剥夺
example: It had always been assumed that if the capitalist class were expropriated, Socialism must follow: and unquestionably the capitalists had been expropriated.

name: Factories
trans: n. 工厂，车厂（factory复数形式）
example: Factories, mines, land, houses, transport--everything had been taken away from them: and since these things were no longer private property, it followed that they must be public property.

name: transport
trans: n. 运输 vt. 运输
example: Factories, mines, land, houses, transport--everything had been taken away from them: and since these things were no longer private property, it followed that they must be public property.

name: Socialist
trans: a.社会主义的
example: Ingsoc, which grew out of the earlier Socialist movement and inherited its phraseology, has in fact carried out the main item in the Socialist programme; with the result, foreseen and intended beforehand, that economic inequality has been made permanent.

name: inherited
trans: adj.通过继承得到的，遗传的,继承权的v.继承( inherit的过去式和过去分词 ),经遗传获得（品质、身体特征等）接替（责任等），继任
example: Ingsoc, which grew out of the earlier Socialist movement and inherited its phraseology, has in fact carried out the main item in the Socialist programme; with the result, foreseen and intended beforehand, that economic inequality has been made permanent.

name: phraseology
example: Ingsoc, which grew out of the earlier Socialist movement and inherited its phraseology, has in fact carried out the main item in the Socialist programme; with the result, foreseen and intended beforehand, that economic inequality has been made permanent.

name: programme
trans: n. 节目；节目单计划；规划；大纲
vt. 计划，安排
example: Ingsoc, which grew out of the earlier Socialist movement and inherited its phraseology, has in fact carried out the main item in the Socialist programme; with the result, foreseen and intended beforehand, that economic inequality has been made permanent.

name: problems
trans: n. [数] 问题；难题（problem的复数）
example: But the problems of perpetuating a hierarchical society go deeper than this.

name: fall
trans: v. 跌倒；下降；减弱；坠落；变成，陷于n. 秋季
example: There are only four ways in which a ruling group can fall from power.

name: governs
trans: v. 统治，管理；决定，支配
example: Either it is conquered from without, or it governs so inefficiently that the masses are stirred to revolt, or it allows a strong and discontented Middle group to come into being, or it loses its own self-confidence and willingness to govern.

name: inefficiently
trans: a.效率低的，无能的
example: Either it is conquered from without, or it governs so inefficiently that the masses are stirred to revolt, or it allows a strong and discontented Middle group to come into being, or it loses its own self-confidence and willingness to govern.

name: allows
trans: vt. 允许，准许；承认；给予；(for)考虑到
example: Either it is conquered from without, or it governs so inefficiently that the masses are stirred to revolt, or it allows a strong and discontented Middle group to come into being, or it loses its own self-confidence and willingness to govern.

name: loses
trans: v. 丢失，迷路，输掉，亏本，失败，走慢，使沉湎于
example: Either it is conquered from without, or it governs so inefficiently that the masses are stirred to revolt, or it allows a strong and discontented Middle group to come into being, or it loses its own self-confidence and willingness to govern.

name: willingness
trans: n.乐意，自愿
example: Either it is conquered from without, or it governs so inefficiently that the masses are stirred to revolt, or it allows a strong and discontented Middle group to come into being, or it loses its own self-confidence and willingness to govern.

name: operate
trans: v. 操作，运转，开动，起作用，动手术
example: These causes do not operate singly, and as a rule all four of them are present in some degree.

name: singly
trans: v. 唱，演唱；鸡叫
example: These causes do not operate singly, and as a rule all four of them are present in some degree.

name: degree
trans: n. 程度；度数；学位；等级
example: These causes do not operate singly, and as a rule all four of them are present in some degree.

name: permanently
trans: ad.永久地，持久地
example: A ruling class which could guard against all of them would remain in power permanently.

name: determining
trans: v.（使）下决心， （使）做出决定( determine的现在分词 ),决定,确定,使决定
example: Ultimately the determining factor is the mental attitude of the ruling class itself.

name: factor
trans: n. 因素,要素
example: Ultimately the determining factor is the mental attitude of the ruling class itself.

name: After
trans: prep. 在…以后；在…后面adv. 以后，后来
example: After the middle of the present century, the first danger had in reality disappeared.

name: divide
trans: v. 分，划分，分开；分配；(by)除
example: Each of the three powers which now divide the world is in fact unconquerable, and could only become conquerable through slow demographic changes which a government with wide powers can easily avert.

name: conquerable
example: Each of the three powers which now divide the world is in fact unconquerable, and could only become conquerable through slow demographic changes which a government with wide powers can easily avert.

name: demographic
trans: adj. 人口统计学的；人口学的
example: Each of the three powers which now divide the world is in fact unconquerable, and could only become conquerable through slow demographic changes which a government with wide powers can easily avert.

name: theoretical
trans: a. 理论(上)的
example: The second danger, also, is only a theoretical one.

name: oppressed
trans: adj.受压迫的，受压制的v.使烦恼( oppress的过去式和过去分词),压迫，压制
example: The masses never revolt of their own accord, and they never revolt merely because they are oppressed.

name: Indeed
trans: ad. 确实，实在；真正地，多么
example: Indeed, so long as they are not permitted to have standards of comparison, they never even become aware that they are oppressed.

name: recurrent
trans: 复发的；周期性的，经常发生的
example: The recurrent economic crises of past times were totally unnecessary and are not now permitted to happen, but other and equally large dislocations can and do happen without having political results, because there is no way in which discontent can become articulate.

name: crises
example: The recurrent economic crises of past times were totally unnecessary and are not now permitted to happen, but other and equally large dislocations can and do happen without having political results, because there is no way in which discontent can become articulate.

name: dislocations
trans: n.医脱位，脱臼,物位错,混乱，紊乱,地断层
example: The recurrent economic crises of past times were totally unnecessary and are not now permitted to happen, but other and equally large dislocations can and do happen without having political results, because there is no way in which discontent can become articulate.

name: articulate
trans: adj.有关节的, 发音清晰的。vt.用关节连接, 接合, 清晰明白地说。
example: The recurrent economic crises of past times were totally unnecessary and are not now permitted to happen, but other and equally large dislocations can and do happen without having political results, because there is no way in which discontent can become articulate.

name: keying
trans: n. 钥匙；答案；关键；键a. 主要的，关键的
example: As for the problem of over-production, which has been latent in our society since the development of machine technique, it is solved by the device of continuous warfare (see Chapter III), which is also useful in keying up public morale to the necessary pitch.

name: liberalism
trans: 自由主义；开明的思想或见解
example: From the point of view of our present rulers, therefore, the only genuine dangers are the splitting-off of a new group of able, under-employed, power-hungry people, and the growth of liberalism and scepticism in their own ranks.

name: scepticism
trans: n. 怀疑；怀疑论；怀疑主义
example: From the point of view of our present rulers, therefore, the only genuine dangers are the splitting-off of a new group of able, under-employed, power-hungry people, and the growth of liberalism and scepticism in their own ranks.

name: educational
trans: adj.教育的
example: The problem, that is to say, is educational.

name: moulding
trans: n. 模子,模型;模制品
example: It is a problem of continuously moulding the consciousness both of the directing group and of the larger executive group that lies immediately below it.

name: executive
trans: n. 总经理，董事，行政负责人a. 执行的，实施的
example: It is a problem of continuously moulding the consciousness both of the directing group and of the larger executive group that lies immediately below it.

name: influenced
trans: n. (on)影响，感化；势力，权势v. 影响，感化
example: The consciousness of the masses needs only to be influenced in a negative way.

name: Given
trans: adj.赠予的, 沉溺的, 特定的, 假设的。vbl.give的过去分词
example: Given this background, one could infer, if one did not know it already, the general structure of Oceanic society.

name: infer
trans: v. 推论，推断
example: Given this background, one could infer, if one did not know it already, the general structure of Oceanic society.

name: apex
trans: 顶点；尖端
example: At the apex of the pyramid comes Big Brother.

name: pyramid
trans: n. 金字塔
example: At the apex of the pyramid comes Big Brother.

name: infallible
trans: adj. 绝对可靠的；绝无错误的 n. 永远正确的人；绝无谬误的事物
example: Big Brother is infallible and all-powerful.

name: achievement
trans: n.完成；成就，成绩
example: Every success, every achievement, every victory, every scientific discovery, all knowledge, all wisdom, all happiness, all virtue, are held to issue directly from his leadership and inspiration.

name: inspiration
trans: n. 灵感；鼓舞，激励
example: Every success, every achievement, every victory, every scientific discovery, all knowledge, all wisdom, all happiness, all virtue, are held to issue directly from his leadership and inspiration.

name: Nobody
trans: pron. 谁也不，无人n. 小人物
example: Nobody has ever seen Big Brother.

name: hoardings
trans: [贸易] 囤积；贮藏；临时围墙
贮藏（hoard的ing形式）
example: He is a face on the hoardings, a voice on the telescreen.

name: uncertainty
trans: n.不定，易变
example: We may be reasonably sure that he will never die, and there is already considerable uncertainty as to when he was born.

name: guise
trans: n. 伪装；装束；外观 vt. 使化装 vi. 伪装 n. （Guise）人名；（葡）吉塞；（英、法）吉斯
example: Big Brother is the guise in which the Party chooses to exhibit itself to the world.

name: chooses
trans: v. 选择，挑选；甘愿
example: Big Brother is the guise in which the Party chooses to exhibit itself to the world.

name: exhibit
trans: v. 展出，陈列n. 展览品，陈列品
example: Big Brother is the guise in which the Party chooses to exhibit itself to the world.

name: focusing
trans: n./v. 焦点,集中;(兴趣活动等的)中心;聚集
example: His function is to act as a focusing point for love, fear, and reverence, emotions which are more easily felt towards an individual than towards an organization.

name: Below
trans: prep. 在…下面，在…以下ad. 在下面，向下
example: Below Big Brother comes the Inner Party.

name: limited
trans: a. 有限的，被限制的
example: Its numbers limited to six millions, or something less than 2 per cent of the population of Oceania.

name: justly
trans: adv. 公正地；正当地；恰当地；正直地
example: Below the Inner Party comes the Outer Party, which, if the Inner Party is described as the brain of the State, may be justly likened to the hands.

name: likened
trans: vt. 把…比作；比拟 时 态: likened, likening, likens
example: Below the Inner Party comes the Outer Party, which, if the Inner Party is described as the brain of the State, may be justly likened to the hands.

name: dumb
trans: a. 哑的,暂不说话的,愚笨的
example: Below that come the dumb masses whom we habitually refer to as 'the proles', numbering perhaps 85 per cent of the population.

name: habitually
trans: adv. 习惯地；日常地
example: Below that come the dumb masses whom we habitually refer to as 'the proles', numbering perhaps 85 per cent of the population.

name: numbering
trans: n. 数，数字，数量，号码，一群v. 共计，编号
example: Below that come the dumb masses whom we habitually refer to as 'the proles', numbering perhaps 85 per cent of the population.

name: classification
trans: n. 分类，分级
example: In the terms of our earlier classification, the proles are the Low: for the slave population of the equatorial lands who pass constantly from conqueror to conqueror, are not a permanent or necessary part of the structure.

name: lands
trans: n. 陆地，土地，国家v. (使)靠岸(登陆，降落)
example: In the terms of our earlier classification, the proles are the Low: for the slave population of the equatorial lands who pass constantly from conqueror to conqueror, are not a permanent or necessary part of the structure.

name: membership
trans: n. 会员资格，成员资格
example: In principle, membership of these three groups is not hereditary.

name: hereditary
trans: adj.世袭的, 遗传的。
example: In principle, membership of these three groups is not hereditary.

name: parents
trans: n. 父母，双亲(注意复数)
example: The child of Inner Party parents is in theory not born into the Inner Party.

name: Admission
trans: n. 准许进(加)入;入场费,入场券;承认,供认
example: Admission to either branch of the Party is by examination, taken at the age of sixteen.

name: examination
trans: n. 考试，测验
example: Admission to either branch of the Party is by examination, taken at the age of sixteen.

name: racial
trans: a. 种的，种族的
example: Nor is there any racial discrimination, or any marked domination of one province by another.

name: discrimination
trans: n.辨别；识别力；歧视
example: Nor is there any racial discrimination, or any marked domination of one province by another.

name: domination
trans: n.控制，统治
example: Nor is there any racial discrimination, or any marked domination of one province by another.

name: province
trans: n. 省；领域，范围，本分
example: Nor is there any racial discrimination, or any marked domination of one province by another.

name: Negroes
trans: n. 黑人a. 黑人的
example: Jews, Negroes, South Americans of pure Indian blood are to be found in the highest ranks of the Party, and the administrators of any area are always drawn from the inhabitants of that area.

name: Americans
trans: a.美国的
example: Jews, Negroes, South Americans of pure Indian blood are to be found in the highest ranks of the Party, and the administrators of any area are always drawn from the inhabitants of that area.

name: highest
trans: a.最高的
example: Jews, Negroes, South Americans of pure Indian blood are to be found in the highest ranks of the Party, and the administrators of any area are always drawn from the inhabitants of that area.

name: administrators
trans: n. 管理者；行政官员；行政人员有管理(或行政)才能的人(由遗嘱检验法庭指定的)遗产管理人奉派暂管主教教区的牧师
example: Jews, Negroes, South Americans of pure Indian blood are to be found in the highest ranks of the Party, and the administrators of any area are always drawn from the inhabitants of that area.

name: colonial
trans: a. 殖民地的,关于殖民的;n. 殖民地居民
example: In no part of Oceania do the inhabitants have the feeling that they are a colonial population ruled from a distant capital.

name: ruled
trans: v. 统治；支配；裁定n. 规章，条例；习惯；统治
example: In no part of Oceania do the inhabitants have the feeling that they are a colonial population ruled from a distant capital.

name: titular
trans: adj. 有名无实的；有头衔的；标题的 n. 有称号或头衔的人；只有名义的人
example: Oceania has no capital, and its titular head is a person whose whereabouts nobody knows.

name: LINGUA
example: Except that English is its chief LINGUA FRANCA and Newspeak its official language, it is not centralized in any way.

name: FRANCA
example: Except that English is its chief LINGUA FRANCA and Newspeak its official language, it is not centralized in any way.

name: ties
trans: n. 领带；联系，关系，纽带；束缚v. 扎，系，捆
example: Its rulers are not held together by blood-ties but by adherence to a common doctrine.

name: adherence
trans: n. 坚持；依附；忠诚
example: Its rulers are not held together by blood-ties but by adherence to a common doctrine.

name: stratified
trans: hierarchical
example: It is true that our society is stratified, and very rigidly stratified, on what at first sight appear to be hereditary lines.

name: pre
example: There is far less to-and-fro movement between the different groups than happened under capitalism or even in the pre-industrial age.

name: interchange
trans: （指两人等）交换；互换
互换；立体交叉道
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: ensure
trans: v. 确保，保证；使安全
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: weaklings
trans: a. 虚弱的，软弱的；不够标准的；淡薄的，稀的
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: excluded
trans: v. 拒绝，把…排除在外，排斥
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: ambitious
trans: a. 有抱负的，雄心勃勃的；有野心的
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: harmless
trans: adj.无害的，无恶意的
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: allowing
trans: vt. 允许，准许；承认；给予；(for)考虑到
example: Between the two branches of the Party there is a certain amount of interchange, but only so much as will ensure that weaklings are excluded from the Inner Party and that ambitious members of the Outer Party are made harmless by allowing them to rise.

name: Proletarians
trans: adj. &n.无产阶级
example: Proletarians, in practice, are not allowed to graduate into the Party.

name: graduate
trans: n. 大学毕业生，研究生a. 毕了业的v. 大学毕业
example: Proletarians, in practice, are not allowed to graduate into the Party.

name: gifted
trans: adj. 有天赋的；有才华的
v. 给予（gift的过去分词）
example: The most gifted among them, who might possibly become nuclei of discontent, are simply marked down by the Thought Police and eliminated.

name: nuclei
example: The most gifted among them, who might possibly become nuclei of discontent, are simply marked down by the Thought Police and eliminated.

name: affairs
trans: n.事务；事情(件)；(个人的)事
example: But this state of affairs is not necessarily permanent, nor is it a matter of principle.

name: class
trans: n. 班级，年级；种类，等级，阶级；(一节)课
example: The Party is not a class in the old sense of the word.

name: transmitting
trans: vt. 传输/导；转送；发射vi. 发射信号；发报
example: It does not aim at transmitting power to its own children, as such; and if there were no other way of keeping the ablest people at the top, it would be perfectly prepared to recruit an entire new generation from the ranks of the proletariat.

name: ablest
trans: a. 有(能力、时间、知识等)做某事，有本事的
example: It does not aim at transmitting power to its own children, as such; and if there were no other way of keeping the ablest people at the top, it would be perfectly prepared to recruit an entire new generation from the ranks of the proletariat.

name: recruit
trans: v./n. 招募,吸收
example: It does not aim at transmitting power to its own children, as such; and if there were no other way of keeping the ablest people at the top, it would be perfectly prepared to recruit an entire new generation from the ranks of the proletariat.

name: crucial
trans: adj.至关紧要的。
example: In the crucial years, the fact that the Party was not a hereditary body did a great deal to neutralize opposition.

name: neutralize
trans: v.压制。5nju:trElaIz;
example: In the crucial years, the fact that the Party was not a hereditary body did a great deal to neutralize opposition.

name: trained
trans: adj.训练过的，受训的v.训练，锻炼，培养( train的过去式和过去分词 ),教育,使（植物）朝某方向生长,园艺学修剪
example: The older kind of Socialist, who had been trained to fight against something called 'class privilege' assumed that what is not hereditary cannot be permanent.

name: reflect
trans: v. 反射，反映，表现，反省，沉思
example: He did not see that the continuity of an oligarchy need not be physical, nor did he pause to reflect that hereditary aristocracies have always been shortlived, whereas adoptive organizations such as the Catholic Church have sometimes lasted for hundreds or thousands of years.

name: aristocracies
example: He did not see that the continuity of an oligarchy need not be physical, nor did he pause to reflect that hereditary aristocracies have always been shortlived, whereas adoptive organizations such as the Catholic Church have sometimes lasted for hundreds or thousands of years.

name: shortlived
example: He did not see that the continuity of an oligarchy need not be physical, nor did he pause to reflect that hereditary aristocracies have always been shortlived, whereas adoptive organizations such as the Catholic Church have sometimes lasted for hundreds or thousands of years.

name: adoptive
trans: adj.收养关系的, 采用的。
example: He did not see that the continuity of an oligarchy need not be physical, nor did he pause to reflect that hereditary aristocracies have always been shortlived, whereas adoptive organizations such as the Catholic Church have sometimes lasted for hundreds or thousands of years.

name: lasted
trans: a. 最后的，刚过去的ad. 最后n. 最后v. 持续
example: He did not see that the continuity of an oligarchy need not be physical, nor did he pause to reflect that hereditary aristocracies have always been shortlived, whereas adoptive organizations such as the Catholic Church have sometimes lasted for hundreds or thousands of years.

name: essence
trans: n. 本质，实质
example: The essence of oligarchical rule is not father-to-son inheritance, but the persistence of a certain world-view and a certain way of life, imposed by the dead upon the living.

name: oligarchical
example: The essence of oligarchical rule is not father-to-son inheritance, but the persistence of a certain world-view and a certain way of life, imposed by the dead upon the living.

name: inheritance
trans: n. 继承；遗传；遗产
example: The essence of oligarchical rule is not father-to-son inheritance, but the persistence of a certain world-view and a certain way of life, imposed by the dead upon the living.

name: persistence
trans: n.坚持；持续，存留
example: The essence of oligarchical rule is not father-to-son inheritance, but the persistence of a certain world-view and a certain way of life, imposed by the dead upon the living.

name: nominate
trans: vt. 提名
example: A ruling group is a ruling group so long as it can nominate its successors.

name: successors
trans: n. 接替的人或事物，继任者
example: A ruling group is a ruling group so long as it can nominate its successors.

name: perpetuating
trans: vt.使永存, 使不朽。
example: The Party is not concerned with perpetuating its blood but with perpetuating itself.

name: WHO
trans: pron. 谁，什么人；…的人；他，她，他们
example: WHO wields power is not important, provided that the hierarchical structure remains always the same.

name: wields
trans: vt. 使用,行使
example: WHO wields power is not important, provided that the hierarchical structure remains always the same.

name: habits
trans: n. 习惯，习性，脾性
example: All the beliefs, habits, tastes, emotions, mental attitudes that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party and prevent the true nature of present-day society from being perceived.

name: attitudes
trans: n. 态度，看法(to, toward, about)；姿势
example: All the beliefs, habits, tastes, emotions, mental attitudes that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party and prevent the true nature of present-day society from being perceived.

name: characterize
trans: v. 表示…的特性；描述…特性
example: All the beliefs, habits, tastes, emotions, mental attitudes that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party and prevent the true nature of present-day society from being perceived.

name: mystique
trans: n.神秘性,奥秘，秘诀
example: All the beliefs, habits, tastes, emotions, mental attitudes that characterize our time are really designed to sustain the mystique of the Party and prevent the true nature of present-day society from being perceived.

name: Physical
trans: a. 物质的；肉体的，身体的；自然科学的，物理的
example: Physical rebellion, or any preliminary move towards rebellion, is at present not possible.

name: proletarians
trans: adj. &n.无产阶级
example: From the proletarians nothing is to be feared.

name: breeding
trans: 繁殖
example: Left to themselves, they will continue from generation to generation and from century to century, working, breeding, and dying, not only without any impulse to rebel, but without the power of grasping that the world could be other than it is.

name: educate
trans: v. 教育，培养，训练
example: They could only become dangerous if the advance of industrial technique made it necessary to educate them more highly; but, since military and commercial rivalry are no longer important, the level of popular education is actually declining.

name: commercial
trans: a. 贸易的,商业的 n. 电视电台广告
example: They could only become dangerous if the advance of industrial technique made it necessary to educate them more highly; but, since military and commercial rivalry are no longer important, the level of popular education is actually declining.

name: rivalry
trans: n.竞争，对抗
example: They could only become dangerous if the advance of industrial technique made it necessary to educate them more highly; but, since military and commercial rivalry are no longer important, the level of popular education is actually declining.

name: declining
trans: adj.下降的，衰落的
example: They could only become dangerous if the advance of industrial technique made it necessary to educate them more highly; but, since military and commercial rivalry are no longer important, the level of popular education is actually declining.

name: indifference
trans: n.冷淡，不关心
example: What opinions the masses hold, or do not hold, is looked on as a matter of indifference.

name: intellect
trans: n.理智，智力，才智
example: They can be granted intellectual liberty because they have no intellect.

name: deviation
trans: n.背离，偏离；偏差数
example: In a Party member, on the other hand, not even the smallest deviation of opinion on the most unimportant subject can be tolerated.

name: birth
trans: n. 出生，诞生；出身，血统；起源；出现
example: A Party member lives from birth to death under the eye of the Thought Police.

name: sure
trans: a. 肯定的；一定会…的；有信心的，有把握的
example: Even when he is alone he can never be sure that he is alone.

name: Wherever
trans: conj. 无论在哪里ad. 无论在哪里，究竟在哪里
example: Wherever he may be, asleep or awake, working or resting, in his bath or in bed, he can be inspected without warning and without knowing that he is being inspected.

name: inspected
trans: vt. 检查，调查，视察
example: Wherever he may be, asleep or awake, working or resting, in his bath or in bed, he can be inspected without warning and without knowing that he is being inspected.

name: indifferent
trans: a. 不感兴趣的,不关心的,质量不高的
example: Nothing that he does is indifferent.

name: friendships
trans: n. 友谊，友好
example: His friendships, his relaxations, his behaviour towards his wife and children, the expression of his face when he is alone, the words he mutters in sleep, even the characteristic movements of his body, are all jealously scrutinized.

name: relaxations
trans: n.放松，松弛
example: His friendships, his relaxations, his behaviour towards his wife and children, the expression of his face when he is alone, the words he mutters in sleep, even the characteristic movements of his body, are all jealously scrutinized.

name: behaviour
trans: n. 行为, 举止, 表现
example: His friendships, his relaxations, his behaviour towards his wife and children, the expression of his face when he is alone, the words he mutters in sleep, even the characteristic movements of his body, are all jealously scrutinized.

name: mutters
trans: v./n. 轻声低语;怨言
example: His friendships, his relaxations, his behaviour towards his wife and children, the expression of his face when he is alone, the words he mutters in sleep, even the characteristic movements of his body, are all jealously scrutinized.

name: jealously
trans: adv. 妒忌地,猜疑地
example: His friendships, his relaxations, his behaviour towards his wife and children, the expression of his face when he is alone, the words he mutters in sleep, even the characteristic movements of his body, are all jealously scrutinized.

name: misdemeanour
trans: 轻罪
example: Not only any actual misdemeanour, but any eccentricity, however small, any change of habits, any nervous mannerism that could possibly be the symptom of an inner struggle, is certain to be detected.

name: mannerism
trans: n.(言语、写作中的)特殊习惯, 怪癖。
example: Not only any actual misdemeanour, but any eccentricity, however small, any change of habits, any nervous mannerism that could possibly be the symptom of an inner struggle, is certain to be detected.

name: choice
trans: n. 选择(机会)，抉择，选择项；入选者a. 精选的
example: He has no freedom of choice in any direction whatever.

name: regulated
trans: v.控制( regulate的过去式和过去分词 ),管理,调整,调节
example: On the other hand his actions are not regulated by law or by any clearly formulated code of behaviour.

name: law
trans: n. 法律，法规，法学，规律，定律
example: In Oceania there is no law.

name: Thoughts
trans: n. 思想，思考，思维；意图，打算；想法
example: Thoughts and actions which, when detected, mean certain death are not formally forbidden, and the endless purges, arrests, tortures, imprisonments, and vaporizations are not inflicted as punishment for crimes which have actually been committed, but are merely the wiping-out of persons who might perhaps commit a crime at some time in the future.

name: formally
trans: ad
v. 正式地；形式上
example: Thoughts and actions which, when detected, mean certain death are not formally forbidden, and the endless purges, arrests, tortures, imprisonments, and vaporizations are not inflicted as punishment for crimes which have actually been committed, but are merely the wiping-out of persons who might perhaps commit a crime at some time in the future.

name: imprisonments
trans: n.监禁，徒刑
example: Thoughts and actions which, when detected, mean certain death are not formally forbidden, and the endless purges, arrests, tortures, imprisonments, and vaporizations are not inflicted as punishment for crimes which have actually been committed, but are merely the wiping-out of persons who might perhaps commit a crime at some time in the future.

name: punishment
trans: n.罚，惩罚，处罚
example: Thoughts and actions which, when detected, mean certain death are not formally forbidden, and the endless purges, arrests, tortures, imprisonments, and vaporizations are not inflicted as punishment for crimes which have actually been committed, but are merely the wiping-out of persons who might perhaps commit a crime at some time in the future.

name: instincts
trans: n. 本能
example: A Party member is required to have not only the right opinions, but the right instincts.

name: Many
trans: a. 许多的，多的pron. 许多人或物，许多
example: Many of the beliefs and attitudes demanded of him are never plainly stated, and could not be stated without laying bare the contradictions inherent in Ingsoc.

name: contradictions
trans: n. 反驳，否认；矛盾，不一致
example: Many of the beliefs and attitudes demanded of him are never plainly stated, and could not be stated without laying bare the contradictions inherent in Ingsoc.

name: GOODTHINKER
example: If he is a person naturally orthodox (in Newspeak a GOODTHINKER), he will in all circumstances know, without taking thought, what is the true belief or the desirable emotion.

name: elaborate
trans: a. 精心计划的;复杂的,详尽的;vt. 做详细说明
example: But in any case an elaborate mental training, undergone in childhood and grouping itself round the Newspeak words CRIMESTOP, BLACKWHITE, and DOUBLETHINK, makes him unwilling and unable to think too deeply on any subject whatever.

name: undergone
example: But in any case an elaborate mental training, undergone in childhood and grouping itself round the Newspeak words CRIMESTOP, BLACKWHITE, and DOUBLETHINK, makes him unwilling and unable to think too deeply on any subject whatever.

name: CRIMESTOP
example: But in any case an elaborate mental training, undergone in childhood and grouping itself round the Newspeak words CRIMESTOP, BLACKWHITE, and DOUBLETHINK, makes him unwilling and unable to think too deeply on any subject whatever.

name: BLACKWHITE
example: But in any case an elaborate mental training, undergone in childhood and grouping itself round the Newspeak words CRIMESTOP, BLACKWHITE, and DOUBLETHINK, makes him unwilling and unable to think too deeply on any subject whatever.

name: unwilling
trans: a.不愿意的
example: But in any case an elaborate mental training, undergone in childhood and grouping itself round the Newspeak words CRIMESTOP, BLACKWHITE, and DOUBLETHINK, makes him unwilling and unable to think too deeply on any subject whatever.

name: respites
trans: 间歇，休息
example: A Party member is expected to have no private emotions and no respites from enthusiasm.

name: frenzy
trans: n. 疯狂，狂乱；一阵狂热 v. 使发狂，使狂怒
example: He is supposed to live in a continuous frenzy of hatred of foreign enemies and internal traitors, triumph over victories, and self-abasement before the power and wisdom of the Party.

name: abasement
trans: n.身份低微；屈尊；降低
example: He is supposed to live in a continuous frenzy of hatred of foreign enemies and internal traitors, triumph over victories, and self-abasement before the power and wisdom of the Party.

name: discontents
trans: n. 不满
adj. 不满的
vt. 使不满
example: The discontents produced by his bare, unsatisfying life are deliberately turned outwards and dissipated by such devices as the Two Minutes Hate, and the speculations which might possibly induce a sceptical or rebellious attitude are killed in advance by his early acquired inner discipline.

name: unsatisfying
trans: adj. 令人满意的,令人满足的
example: The discontents produced by his bare, unsatisfying life are deliberately turned outwards and dissipated by such devices as the Two Minutes Hate, and the speculations which might possibly induce a sceptical or rebellious attitude are killed in advance by his early acquired inner discipline.

name: dissipated
trans: 消散的；沉迷于酒色的；闲游浪荡的；放荡的
消散；浪费（dissipate的过去式）
example: The discontents produced by his bare, unsatisfying life are deliberately turned outwards and dissipated by such devices as the Two Minutes Hate, and the speculations which might possibly induce a sceptical or rebellious attitude are killed in advance by his early acquired inner discipline.

name: sceptical
trans: adj.怀疑论的, 怀疑的。
example: The discontents produced by his bare, unsatisfying life are deliberately turned outwards and dissipated by such devices as the Two Minutes Hate, and the speculations which might possibly induce a sceptical or rebellious attitude are killed in advance by his early acquired inner discipline.

name: rebellious
trans: 反抗的；造反的；难控制的
example: The discontents produced by his bare, unsatisfying life are deliberately turned outwards and dissipated by such devices as the Two Minutes Hate, and the speculations which might possibly induce a sceptical or rebellious attitude are killed in advance by his early acquired inner discipline.

name: simplest
trans: adj. 简化的
example: The first and simplest stage in the discipline, which can be taught even to young children, is called, in Newspeak, CRIMESTOP.

name: stage
trans: n. 舞台，戏剧；阶段，时期
example: The first and simplest stage in the discipline, which can be taught even to young children, is called, in Newspeak, CRIMESTOP.

name: faculty
trans: n.才能, 本领, 能力, 全体教员, (大学的)系, 科, (授予的)权力。
example: CRIMESTOP means the faculty of stopping short, as though by instinct, at the threshold of any dangerous thought.

name: threshold
trans: n. 门槛;开始;开端,入门
example: CRIMESTOP means the faculty of stopping short, as though by instinct, at the threshold of any dangerous thought.

name: includes
trans: v. 包括，包含，计入
example: It includes the power of not grasping analogies, of failing to perceive logical errors, of misunderstanding the simplest arguments if they are inimical to Ingsoc, and of being bored or repelled by any train of thought which is capable of leading in a heretical direction.

name: analogies
trans: n.类似物，同源语,<电脑>模拟adj.（钟表）有长短针的,<电脑>模拟的
example: It includes the power of not grasping analogies, of failing to perceive logical errors, of misunderstanding the simplest arguments if they are inimical to Ingsoc, and of being bored or repelled by any train of thought which is capable of leading in a heretical direction.

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉,发觉;理解
example: It includes the power of not grasping analogies, of failing to perceive logical errors, of misunderstanding the simplest arguments if they are inimical to Ingsoc, and of being bored or repelled by any train of thought which is capable of leading in a heretical direction.

name: logical
trans: a. 逻辑的，符合逻辑的
example: It includes the power of not grasping analogies, of failing to perceive logical errors, of misunderstanding the simplest arguments if they are inimical to Ingsoc, and of being bored or repelled by any train of thought which is capable of leading in a heretical direction.

name: misunderstanding
trans: n.误会，曲解
example: It includes the power of not grasping analogies, of failing to perceive logical errors, of misunderstanding the simplest arguments if they are inimical to Ingsoc, and of being bored or repelled by any train of thought which is capable of leading in a heretical direction.

name: repelled
trans: vt. 击退,逐回,驱逐;排斥;使厌恶
example: It includes the power of not grasping analogies, of failing to perceive logical errors, of misunderstanding the simplest arguments if they are inimical to Ingsoc, and of being bored or repelled by any train of thought which is capable of leading in a heretical direction.

name: protective
trans: a.保护的，防护的
example: CRIMESTOP, in short, means protective stupidity.

name: stupidity
trans: n.愚蠢
example: But stupidity is not enough.

name: demands
trans: n./v. 要求，请求，需要(量)v. 查问
example: On the contrary, orthodoxy in the full sense demands a control over one's own mental processes as complete as that of a contortionist over his body.

name: contortionist
example: On the contrary, orthodoxy in the full sense demands a control over one's own mental processes as complete as that of a contortionist over his body.

name: rests
trans: n. 休息；剩余部分v. 休息；睡；放，靠，搁
example: Oceanic society rests ultimately on the belief that Big Brother is omnipotent and that the Party is infallible.

name: omnipotent
trans: adj. 全能的；无所不能的；有无限权力的
example: Oceanic society rests ultimately on the belief that Big Brother is omnipotent and that the Party is infallible.

name: unwearying
example: But since in reality Big Brother is not omnipotent and the party is not infallible, there is need for an unwearying, moment-to-moment flexibility in the treatment of facts.

name: flexibility
trans: n.柔韧，灵活性
example: But since in reality Big Brother is not omnipotent and the party is not infallible, there is need for an unwearying, moment-to-moment flexibility in the treatment of facts.

name: treatment
trans: n.待遇；治疗，疗法
example: But since in reality Big Brother is not omnipotent and the party is not infallible, there is need for an unwearying, moment-to-moment flexibility in the treatment of facts.

name: keyword
trans: n.关键字(词)
example: The keyword here is BLACKWHITE.

name: mutually
trans: adv.互相地，互助,对
example: Like so many Newspeak words, this word has two mutually contradictory meanings.

name: impudently
trans: adj. 无耻的；鲁莽的；放肆无礼的
example: Applied to an opponent, it means the habit of impudently claiming that black is white, in contradiction of the plain facts.

name: contradiction
trans: n. 反驳，否认；矛盾，不一致
example: Applied to an opponent, it means the habit of impudently claiming that black is white, in contradiction of the plain facts.

name: willingness
trans: n.乐意，自愿
example: Applied to a Party member, it means a loyal willingness to say that black is white when Party discipline demands this.

name: ability
trans: n. 能力；本领；才能，才干；专门技能，天资
example: But it means also the ability to BELIEVE that black is white, and more, to KNOW that black is white, and to forget that one has ever believed the contrary.

name: BELIEVE
trans: vt. 相信，认为vi. 相信，信任，信奉
example: But it means also the ability to BELIEVE that black is white, and more, to KNOW that black is white, and to forget that one has ever believed the contrary.

name: KNOW
trans: vt. 知道，了解；认识；识别vi. 知道，了解
example: But it means also the ability to BELIEVE that black is white, and more, to KNOW that black is white, and to forget that one has ever believed the contrary.

name: embraces
trans: v./n. 拥抱;利用;包含
example: This demands a continuous alteration of the past, made possible by the system of thought which really embraces all the rest, and which is known in Newspeak as DOUBLETHINK.

name: precautionary
example: The alteration of the past is necessary for two reasons, one of which is subsidiary and, so to speak, precautionary.

name: tolerates
trans: vt. 容忍，默许；对(药物、毒品等)有耐力
example: The subsidiary reason is that the Party member, like the proletarian, tolerates present-day conditions partly because he has no standards of comparison.

name: ancestors
trans: n. 祖先
example: He must be cut off from the past, just as he must be cut off from foreign countries, because it is necessary for him to believe that he is better off than his ancestors and that the average level of material comfort is constantly rising.

name: readjustment
trans: n.再整理，再调整
example: But by far the more important reason for the readjustment of the past is the need to safeguard the infallibility of the Party.

name: infallibility
trans: n. incapable of error 无过失
example: But by far the more important reason for the readjustment of the past is the need to safeguard the infallibility of the Party.

name: predictions
trans: n.预言，预告；预报
example: It is not merely that speeches, statistics, and records of every kind must be constantly brought up to date in order to show that the predictions of the Party were in all cases right.

name: alignment
trans: n.队列；结盟，联合
example: It is also that no change in doctrine or in political alignment can ever be admitted.

name: policy
trans: n. 政策;保险单
example: For to change one's mind, or even one's policy, is a confession of weakness.

name: whichever
trans: pron./a. 无论哪个，无论哪些
example: If, for example, Eurasia or Eastasia (whichever it may be) is the enemy today, then that country must always have been the enemy.

name: otherwise
trans: ad. 另样，用别的方法；在其他方面conj. 要不然
example: And if the facts say otherwise then the facts must be altered.

name: continuously
trans: adv.连续不断地
example: Thus history is continuously rewritten.

name: regime
trans: n. 政体,政权,政治制度
example: This day-to-day falsification of the past, carried out by the Ministry of Truth, is as necessary to the stability of the regime as the work of repression and espionage carried out by the Ministry of Love.

name: repression
trans: 抑制，[心理] 压抑；镇压
example: This day-to-day falsification of the past, carried out by the Ministry of Truth, is as necessary to the stability of the regime as the work of repression and espionage carried out by the Ministry of Love.

name: tenet
trans: n. 原则, 信条, 教义, 教条
example: The mutability of the past is the central tenet of Ingsoc.

name: Past
trans: a. 过去的ad. 过n. 过去，昔日prep. (经)过
example: Past events, it is argued, have no objective existence, but survive only in written records and in human memories.

name: agree
trans: vi. 答应，赞同；适合，一致；商定，约定
example: The past is whatever the records and the memories agree upon.

name: chooses
trans: v. 选择，挑选；甘愿
example: And since the Party is in full control of all records and in equally full control of the minds of its members, it follows that the past is whatever the Party chooses to make it.

name: specific
trans: a. 明确的，具体的；特定的，特有的
example: It also follows that though the past is alterable, it never has been altered in any specific instance.

name: recreated
trans: 娱乐；消遣
example: For when it has been recreated in whatever shape is needed at the moment, then this new version IS the past, and no different past can ever have existed.

name: holds
trans: v. 拿着；保有；托住；举行；继续n. 握住；船舱
example: This holds good even when, as often happens, the same event has to be altered out of recognition several times in the course of a year.

name: clearly
trans: ad.明白地，清晰地
example: At all times the Party is in possession of absolute truth, and clearly the absolute can never have been different from what it is now.

name: training
trans: n. 训练，培养
example: It will be seen that the control of the past depends above all on the training of memory.

name: mechanical
trans: a. 机械的，由机构制成的；机械似的，呆板的
example: To make sure that all written records agree with the orthodoxy of the moment is merely a mechanical act.

name: REMEMBER
trans: v. 记住；(to)转达问候，代…致意，代…问好
example: But it is also necessary to REMEMBER that events happened in the desired manner.

name: desired
trans: adj.渴望的，想得到的v.希望( desire的过去式和过去分词 ),渴望,要求,请求
example: But it is also necessary to REMEMBER that events happened in the desired manner.

name: rearrange
trans: v.重新整理，重新排序
example: And if it is necessary to rearrange one's memories or to tamper with written records, then it is necessary to FORGET that one has done so.

name: tamper
trans: vi.干预, 玩弄, 贿赂, 损害, 削弱, 篡改。vt.篡改。n.捣棒, 夯, 填塞者
example: And if it is necessary to rearrange one's memories or to tamper with written records, then it is necessary to FORGET that one has done so.

name: FORGET
trans: v. 忘记，遗忘
example: And if it is necessary to rearrange one's memories or to tamper with written records, then it is necessary to FORGET that one has done so.

name: technique
trans: n. 技术,技能,行家手法
example: The trick of doing this can be learned like any other mental technique.

name: certainly
trans: ad. 一定，必定，无疑；当然，行
example: It is learned by the majority of Party members, and certainly by all who are intelligent as well as orthodox.

name: frankly
trans: adv.坦率地
example: In Oldspeak it is called, quite frankly, 'reality control'.

name: comprises
trans: vt. 包含,包括
example: In Newspeak it is called DOUBLETHINK, though DOUBLETHINK comprises much else as well.

name: accepting
trans: vt. 接受，领受；认可，同意vi. 同意，认可
example: DOUBLETHINK means the power of holding two contradictory beliefs in one's mind simultaneously, and accepting both of them.

name: tricks
trans: n. 诡计,恶作剧,技艺
example: The Party intellectual knows in which direction his memories must be altered; he therefore knows that he is playing tricks with reality; but by the exercise of DOUBLETHINK he also satisfies himself that reality is not violated.

name: satisfies
example: The Party intellectual knows in which direction his memories must be altered; he therefore knows that he is playing tricks with reality; but by the exercise of DOUBLETHINK he also satisfies himself that reality is not violated.

name: violated
trans: vt.
example: The Party intellectual knows in which direction his memories must be altered; he therefore knows that he is playing tricks with reality; but by the exercise of DOUBLETHINK he also satisfies himself that reality is not violated.

name: falsity
trans: 虚伪；错误；谎言；不真实
example: The process has to be conscious, or it would not be carried out with sufficient precision, but it also has to be unconscious, or it would bring with it a feeling of falsity and hence of guilt.

name: firmness
trans: n.坚固，坚定，稳固
example: DOUBLETHINK lies at the very heart of Ingsoc, since the essential act of the Party is to use conscious deception while retaining the firmness of purpose that goes with complete honesty.

name: honesty
trans: n.诚实，正直
example: DOUBLETHINK lies at the very heart of Ingsoc, since the essential act of the Party is to use conscious deception while retaining the firmness of purpose that goes with complete honesty.

name: genuinely
trans: ad
v. 真地;真正地真诚地;诚实地
example: To tell deliberate lies while genuinely believing in them, to forget any fact that has become inconvenient, and then, when it becomes necessary again, to draw it back from oblivion for just so long as it is needed, to deny the existence of objective reality and all the while to take account of the reality which one denies--all this is indispensably necessary.

name: oblivion
trans: n. 遗忘；湮没；赦免
example: To tell deliberate lies while genuinely believing in them, to forget any fact that has become inconvenient, and then, when it becomes necessary again, to draw it back from oblivion for just so long as it is needed, to deny the existence of objective reality and all the while to take account of the reality which one denies--all this is indispensably necessary.

name: denies
trans: n.窝
example: To tell deliberate lies while genuinely believing in them, to forget any fact that has become inconvenient, and then, when it becomes necessary again, to draw it back from oblivion for just so long as it is needed, to deny the existence of objective reality and all the while to take account of the reality which one denies--all this is indispensably necessary.

name: indispensably
example: To tell deliberate lies while genuinely believing in them, to forget any fact that has become inconvenient, and then, when it becomes necessary again, to draw it back from oblivion for just so long as it is needed, to deny the existence of objective reality and all the while to take account of the reality which one denies--all this is indispensably necessary.

name: exercise
trans: n. 练习，习题；训练，锻练v. 训练，锻练；行使
example: Even in using the word DOUBLETHINK it is necessary to exercise DOUBLETHINK.

name: admits
trans: vt. 承认，供认；准许…进入，准许…加入
example: For by using the word one admits that one is tampering with reality; by a fresh act of DOUBLETHINK one erases this knowledge; and so on indefinitely, with the lie always one leap ahead of the truth.

name: tampering
trans: vi.干预, 玩弄, 贿赂, 损害, 削弱, 篡改。vt.篡改。n.捣棒, 夯, 填塞者
example: For by using the word one admits that one is tampering with reality; by a fresh act of DOUBLETHINK one erases this knowledge; and so on indefinitely, with the lie always one leap ahead of the truth.

name: erases
trans: vt. 擦掉,抹掉
example: For by using the word one admits that one is tampering with reality; by a fresh act of DOUBLETHINK one erases this knowledge; and so on indefinitely, with the lie always one leap ahead of the truth.

name: leap
trans: v. 扑向,欣然接受;n. 跳,跃
example: For by using the word one admits that one is tampering with reality; by a fresh act of DOUBLETHINK one erases this knowledge; and so on indefinitely, with the lie always one leap ahead of the truth.

name: Ultimately
trans: ad.最终，最后
example: Ultimately it is by means of DOUBLETHINK that the Party has been able--and may, for all we know, continue to be able for thousands of years--to arrest the course of history.

name: oligarchies
trans: 寡头政治； 寡头统治集团
example: All past oligarchies have fallen from power either because they ossified or because they grew soft.

name: ossified
example: All past oligarchies have fallen from power either because they ossified or because they grew soft.

name: arrogant
trans: a. 傲慢的,自负的
example: Either they became stupid and arrogant, failed to adjust themselves to changing circumstances, and were overthrown; or they became liberal and cowardly, made concessions when they should have used force, and once again were overthrown.

name: adjust
trans: vt. 校准,调整;改变…以适应
example: Either they became stupid and arrogant, failed to adjust themselves to changing circumstances, and were overthrown; or they became liberal and cowardly, made concessions when they should have used force, and once again were overthrown.

name: cowardly
trans: adv.胆小地
example: Either they became stupid and arrogant, failed to adjust themselves to changing circumstances, and were overthrown; or they became liberal and cowardly, made concessions when they should have used force, and once again were overthrown.

name: concessions
trans: n. 让步，妥协；特许(权)
example: Either they became stupid and arrogant, failed to adjust themselves to changing circumstances, and were overthrown; or they became liberal and cowardly, made concessions when they should have used force, and once again were overthrown.

name: unconsciousness
trans: n.意识，觉悟；知觉
example: They fell, that is to say, either through consciousness or through unconsciousness.

name: achievement
trans: n.完成；成就，成绩
example: It is the achievement of the Party to have produced a system of thought in which both conditions can exist simultaneously.

name: dominion
trans: n. 主权，统治权；支配；领土
example: And upon no other intellectual basis could the dominion of the Party be made permanent.

name: dislocate
trans: 使脱臼；使混乱
example: If one is to rule, and to continue ruling, one must be able to dislocate the sense of reality.

name: rulership
example: For the secret of rulership is to combine a belief in one's own infallibility with the Power to learn from past mistakes.

name: combine
trans: v. 联合;连结;n. 集团,联合企业
example: For the secret of rulership is to combine a belief in one's own infallibility with the Power to learn from past mistakes.

name: Power
trans: n. 力，精力；功率，电力；(数学)幂；权力，势力
example: For the secret of rulership is to combine a belief in one's own infallibility with the Power to learn from past mistakes.

name: mistakes
trans: n. 错误，过失，误解v. 弄错；(for)把…误认为
example: For the secret of rulership is to combine a belief in one's own infallibility with the Power to learn from past mistakes.

name: subtlest
trans: a. 微妙的,难于捉摸的;诡秘的,狡诈的;隐约的
example: It need hardly be said that the subtlest practitioners of DOUBLETHINK are those who invented DOUBLETHINK and know that it is a vast system of mental cheating.

name: practitioners
trans: n.从业者, 开业者。
example: It need hardly be said that the subtlest practitioners of DOUBLETHINK are those who invented DOUBLETHINK and know that it is a vast system of mental cheating.

name: furthest
example: In our society, those who have the best knowledge of what is happening are also those who are furthest from seeing the world as it is.

name: delusion
trans: n.错觉
example: In general, the greater the understanding, the greater the delusion; the more intelligent, the less sane.

name: illustration
trans: n. 说明；例证，插图；举例说明
example: One clear illustration of this is the fact that war hysteria increases in intensity as one rises in the social scale.

name: rises
trans: v. 升起；起立；上涨；起义n. 上涨，增高；起源
example: One clear illustration of this is the fact that war hysteria increases in intensity as one rises in the social scale.

name: rational
trans: a. 有推理能力的,合理的
example: Those whose attitude towards the war is most nearly rational are the subject peoples of the disputed territories.

name: calamity
trans: n.灾难, 不幸事件。
example: To these people the war is simply a continuous calamity which sweeps to and fro over their bodies like a tidal wave.

name: sweeps
trans: n. 扫,扫除;连绵区域;激流;vt. 扫除;掠过;连绵,延伸
example: To these people the war is simply a continuous calamity which sweeps to and fro over their bodies like a tidal wave.

name: winning
trans: adj. 胜利的；获胜的
n. 胜利；获得；成功
v. 获胜（win的ing形式）副 词:winningly
名 词:winningness
example: Which side is winning is a matter of complete indifference to them.

name: overlordship
example: They are aware that a change of overlordship means simply that they will be doing the same work as before for new masters who treat them in the same manner as the old ones.

name: favoured
trans: 喜爱的；受优惠的；有特权的
example: The slightly more favoured workers whom we call 'the proles' are only intermittently conscious of the war.

name: prodded
trans: v. 刺，戳；刺激，督促 n. 戳，捅；刺戳的工具；刺激，提醒；（贬称）新教徒
example: When it is necessary they can be prodded into frenzies of fear and hatred, but when left to themselves they are capable of forgetting for long periods that the war is happening.

name: ranks
trans: n. 军衔，社会阶层；排v. 分等级，把…分类
example: It is in the ranks of the Party, and above all of the Inner Party, that the true war enthusiasm is found.

name: World
trans: n. 世界，地球；…界，领域；世间；全世界
example: World-conquest is believed in most firmly by those who know it to be impossible.

name: firmly
trans: adv.坚定地，坚固地
example: World-conquest is believed in most firmly by those who know it to be impossible.

name: linking
trans: v. 连接，联系n. 环节，链环
example: This peculiar linking-together of opposites--knowledge with ignorance, cynicism with fanaticism--is one of the chief distinguishing marks of Oceanic society.

name: opposites
trans: a. 对面的,相对的,相反的,对立的 prep. 在…对面
example: This peculiar linking-together of opposites--knowledge with ignorance, cynicism with fanaticism--is one of the chief distinguishing marks of Oceanic society.

name: cynicism
trans: 玩世不恭，愤世嫉俗；犬儒主义；冷嘲热讽
example: This peculiar linking-together of opposites--knowledge with ignorance, cynicism with fanaticism--is one of the chief distinguishing marks of Oceanic society.

name: fanaticism
trans: n. 狂热，著迷；盲信
example: This peculiar linking-together of opposites--knowledge with ignorance, cynicism with fanaticism--is one of the chief distinguishing marks of Oceanic society.

name: distinguishing
trans: adj.有区别的v.辨别，区别( distinguish的现在分词 ),使出众,（凭任何感觉器官）识别出,看清
example: This peculiar linking-together of opposites--knowledge with ignorance, cynicism with fanaticism--is one of the chief distinguishing marks of Oceanic society.

name: marks
trans: n. 痕迹；记号；分数v. 标记，打分，使有特色
example: This peculiar linking-together of opposites--knowledge with ignorance, cynicism with fanaticism--is one of the chief distinguishing marks of Oceanic society.

name: abounds
trans: vi.多, 大量存在, 富于, 充满。
example: The official ideology abounds with contradictions even when there is no practical reason for them.

name: rejects
trans: v. 拒绝，抵制，丢弃，排斥，退掉n. 落选者
example: Thus, the Party rejects and vilifies every principle for which the Socialist movement originally stood, and it chooses to do this in the name of Socialism.

name: vilifies
example: Thus, the Party rejects and vilifies every principle for which the Socialist movement originally stood, and it chooses to do this in the name of Socialism.

name: preaches
trans: vt./vi. 传教;讲道;劝诫;鼓吹
example: It preaches a contempt for the working class unexampled for centuries past, and it dresses its members in a uniform which was at one time peculiar to manual workers and was adopted for that reason.

name: unexampled
trans: novel
example: It preaches a contempt for the working class unexampled for centuries past, and it dresses its members in a uniform which was at one time peculiar to manual workers and was adopted for that reason.

name: dresses
trans: n. 服装，童装，女装v. 穿衣，打扮
example: It preaches a contempt for the working class unexampled for centuries past, and it dresses its members in a uniform which was at one time peculiar to manual workers and was adopted for that reason.

name: undermines
trans: vt. (暗中)破坏;(逐渐)削弱
example: It systematically undermines the solidarity of the family, and it calls its leader by a name which is a direct appeal to the sentiment of family loyalty.

name: solidarity
trans: n. 团结一致
example: It systematically undermines the solidarity of the family, and it calls its leader by a name which is a direct appeal to the sentiment of family loyalty.

name: calls
trans: n. 电话（call的复数）；呼吁；调用
v. 呼叫（call的三单）
example: It systematically undermines the solidarity of the family, and it calls its leader by a name which is a direct appeal to the sentiment of family loyalty.

name: sentiment
trans: n. 情操,思想感情;情绪
example: It systematically undermines the solidarity of the family, and it calls its leader by a name which is a direct appeal to the sentiment of family loyalty.

name: impudence
example: Even the names of the four Ministries by which we are governed exhibit a sort of impudence in their deliberate reversal of the facts.

name: reversal
trans: 逆转；[摄] 反转；[法] 撤销
example: Even the names of the four Ministries by which we are governed exhibit a sort of impudence in their deliberate reversal of the facts.

name: concerns
trans: vt. 影响;涉及;忙于;关心;n. 所关切的事;企业;关心
example: The Ministry of Peace concerns itself with war, the Ministry of Truth with lies, the Ministry of Love with torture and the Ministry of Plenty with starvation.

name: hypocrisy
trans: n. 伪善，虚伪
example: These contradictions are not accidental, nor do they result from ordinary hypocrisy; they are deliberate exercises in DOUBLETHINK.

name: exercises
trans: 运动，练习
example: These contradictions are not accidental, nor do they result from ordinary hypocrisy; they are deliberate exercises in DOUBLETHINK.

name: reconciling
trans: vt. 使和解;使复交;调解,调停
example: For it is only by reconciling contradictions that power can be retained indefinitely.

name: cycle
trans: n. 自行车；周期，循环v. 骑自行车；循环
example: In no other way could the ancient cycle be broken.

name: insanity
trans: 疯狂；精神错乱；精神病；愚顽
example: If human equality is to be for ever averted--if the High, as we have called them, are to keep their places permanently--then the prevailing mental condition must be controlled insanity.

name: ignored
trans: v. 不理，不顾，忽视
example: But there is one question which until this moment we have almost ignored.

name: averted
trans: v.转移。
example: It is; WHY should human equality be averted?

name: Supposing
trans: conj.假使
example: Supposing that the mechanics of the process have been rightly described, what is the motive for this huge, accurately planned effort to freeze history at a particular moment of time?

name: rightly
trans: ad
v. 正确地，确实地公正地，公平地肯定地；无疑地
example: Supposing that the mechanics of the process have been rightly described, what is the motive for this huge, accurately planned effort to freeze history at a particular moment of time?

name: central
trans: a. 中心的，中央的，中枢的；主要的
example: Here we reach the central secret.

name: seen
example: As we have seen.

name: seizure
trans: n.强占，没收,发作,赃物
example: the mystique of the Party, and above all of the Inner Party, depends upon DOUBLETHINK But deeper than this lies the original motive, the never-questioned instinct that first led to the seizure of power and brought DOUBLETHINK, the Thought Police, continuous warfare, and all the other necessary paraphernalia into existence afterwards.

name: paraphernalia
trans: n.随身用具。
example: the mystique of the Party, and above all of the Inner Party, depends upon DOUBLETHINK But deeper than this lies the original motive, the never-questioned instinct that first led to the seizure of power and brought DOUBLETHINK, the Thought Police, continuous warfare, and all the other necessary paraphernalia into existence afterwards.

name: consists
trans: vi. 组成,存在
example: This motive really consists.

name: silence
trans: n. 寂静，沉默v. 使沉默，使安静
example: Winston became aware of silence, as one becomes aware of a new sound.

name: Julia
example: It seemed to him that Julia had been very still for some time past.

name: upwards
trans: ad
v. 向上；在上部；向上游
example: She was lying on her side, naked from the waist upwards, with her cheek pillowed on her hand and one dark lock tumbling across her eyes.

name: lock
trans: n. 锁v. 锁，锁上
example: She was lying on her side, naked from the waist upwards, with her cheek pillowed on her hand and one dark lock tumbling across her eyes.

name: tumbling
trans: n.摔跤，翻跟头，翻筋斗adj.歪斜状的v.倒塌( tumble的现在分词 ),翻滚,突然摔倒,<非正>恍然大悟
example: She was lying on her side, naked from the waist upwards, with her cheek pillowed on her hand and one dark lock tumbling across her eyes.

name: regularly
trans: ad.有规律地
example: Her breast rose and fell slowly and regularly.

name: answer
trans: vt. 回答，答复，答案v. 回答，答复，响应
example: ' No answer.

name: awake
trans: a. 醒着的vt. 唤醒，使觉醒vi. 醒来，醒悟到
example: 'Julia, are you awake?

name: asleep
trans: a. 睡觉，睡着(用作表语)
example: She was asleep.

name: coverlet
example: He shut the book, put it carefully on the floor, lay down, and pulled the coverlet over both of them.

name: ultimate
trans: a. 最后的，最终的；根本的
example: He had still, he reflected, not learned the ultimate secret.

name: HOW
trans: ad. 1. (表示方法、手段、状态)怎样；如何
example: He understood HOW; he did not understand WHY.

name: systematized
example: Chapter I, like Chapter III, had not actually told him anything that he did not know, it had merely systematized the knowledge that he possessed already.

name: mad
trans: a. 发疯的；狂热的，着迷的；恼火的，生气的
example: But after reading it he knew better than before that he was not mad.

name: Being
trans: n. 生物，生命，存在；
example: Being in a minority, even a minority of one, did not make you mad.

name: untruth
trans: 虚假，不真实；谎言
example: There was truth and there was untruth, and if you clung to the truth even against the whole world, you were not mad.

name: beam
trans: n. 梁;光束;飞机导航无线电射束; v. 发光,发热;微笑;定向发出(无线电信号)
example: A yellow beam from the sinking sun slanted in through the window and fell across the pillow.

name: slanted
trans: v. （使）倾斜，（使）歪斜；有偏向性地陈述，带偏向性地报道 n. 倾斜，歪斜；（有倾向性的）观点，态度 adj. 斜的
example: A yellow beam from the sinking sun slanted in through the window and fell across the pillow.

name: shut
trans: v. 关，关闭
example: He shut his eyes.

name: confident
trans: a. 确信的,有把握的
example: The sun on his face and the girl's smooth body touching his own gave him a strong, sleepy, confident feeling.

name: safe
trans: a. 安全的，牢靠的；谨慎的，可靠的n. 保险箱
example: He was safe, everything was all right.

name: Sanity
trans: n.心智健全。
example: He fell asleep murmuring 'Sanity is not statistical,' with the feeling that this remark contained in it a profound wisdom.

name: statistical
trans: a. 统计的，统计学的
example: He fell asleep murmuring 'Sanity is not statistical,' with the feeling that this remark contained in it a profound wisdom.

name: fashioned
trans: n. 流行式样(或货品)，风尚，风气；样子，方式
example: ***** When he woke it was with the sensation of having slept for a long time, but a glance at the old-fashioned clock told him that it was only twenty-thirty.

name: dozing
trans: v./n. 瞌睡；假寐
example: He lay dozing for a while; then the usual deep-lunged singing struck up from the yard below: 'It was only an 'opeless fancy, It passed like an Ipril dye, But a look an' a word an' the dreams they stirred They 'ave stolen my 'eart awye!

name: lunged
trans: n. 肺
example: He lay dozing for a while; then the usual deep-lunged singing struck up from the yard below: 'It was only an 'opeless fancy, It passed like an Ipril dye, But a look an' a word an' the dreams they stirred They 'ave stolen my 'eart awye!

name: popularity
trans: n.通俗性；普及，流行
example: ' The drivelling song seemed to have kept its popularity.

name: heard
trans: v. 听见；审讯；(from)收到…的信/电话；听说
example: You still heard it all over the place.

name: outlived
trans: vt. 比…活得长；比…经久；经受住；渡过…而存在
example: It had outlived the Hate Song.

name: stretched
trans: vt./vi. 伸长,扩大,拉长;滥用,曲解;n. 伸展;一段持续时间
example: Julia woke at the sound, stretched herself luxuriously, and got out of bed.

name: luxuriously
trans: a.爱好奢侈的，豪华的
example: Julia woke at the sound, stretched herself luxuriously, and got out of bed.

name: hungry
trans: a. 饥饿的，渴望的
example: 'I'm hungry,' she said.

name: Let
trans: v. 让，允许，听任；设，假设；出租，租给
example: 'Let's make some more coffee.

name: Damn
trans: int. 该死vt. 遣责；使失败a. 十足的ad. 极
example: Damn!

name: stove
trans: n. 炉子，火炉

name: unforgivable

name: beat

example: He remembered a cell with a plank bed, a sort of shelf sticking out from the wall, and a tin wash-basin, and meals of hot soup and bread and sometimes coffee.

name: surly
trans: 脾气不好的
example: He remembered a surly barber arriving to scrape his chin and crop his hair, and businesslike, unsympathetic men in white coats feeling his pulse, tapping his reflexes, turning up his eyelids, running harsh fingers over him in search for broken bones, and shooting needles into his arm to make him sleep.

反射的；反省的；反作用的；优角的

name: mainly
trans: ad.主要地，大体上
example: The beatings grew less frequent, and became mainly a threat, a horror to which he could be sent back at any moment when his answers were unsatisfactory.

name: questioners
trans: n.发问者，质问者
example: His questioners now were not ruffians in black uniforms but Party intellectuals, little rotund men with quick movements and flashing spectacles, who worked on him in relays over periods which lasted--he thought, he could not be sure--ten or twelve hours at a stretch.

name: ruffians
trans: 恶棍；流氓；无赖
残暴的；凶恶的；无法无天的
example: His questioners now were not ruffians in black uniforms but Party intellectuals, little rotund men with quick movements and flashing spectacles, who worked on him in relays over periods which lasted--he thought, he could not be sure--ten or twelve hours at a stretch.

trans: a. 智力的,理智的,有理解力的; n. 知识分子

trans: adj. (指人)圆胖的；(声音)洪亮的
example: His questioners now were not ruffians in black uniforms but Party intellectuals, little rotund men with quick movements and flashing spectacles, who worked on him in relays over periods which lasted--he thought, he could not be sure--ten or twelve hours at a stretch.

trans: n.闪光，防水板，遮雨板v.发出闪光( flash的现在分词 ),（使）闪现,映出,显示
example: His questioners now were not ruffians in black uniforms but Party intellectuals, little rotund men with quick movements and flashing spectacles, who worked on him in relays over periods which lasted--he thought, he could not be sure--ten or twelve hours at a stretch.

trans: vt. 转播;传递 n. 替班;转播;接力赛跑
example: His questioners now were not ruffians in black uniforms but Party intellectuals, little rotund men with quick movements and flashing spectacles, who worked on him in relays over periods which lasted--he thought, he could not be sure--ten or twelve hours at a stretch.

name: relied
example: These other questioners saw to it that he was in constant slight pain, but it was not chiefly pain that they relied on.

name: slapped
trans: vt. 掌击,拍打
example: They slapped his face, wrung his ears, pulled his hair, made him stand on one leg, refused him leave to urinate, shone glaring lights in his face until his eyes ran with water; but the aim of this was simply to humiliate him and destroy his power of arguing and reasoning.

name: humiliate
trans: vt. 羞辱,使丢脸
example: They slapped his face, wrung his ears, pulled his hair, made him stand on one leg, refused him leave to urinate, shone glaring lights in his face until his eyes ran with water; but the aim of this was simply to humiliate him and destroy his power of arguing and reasoning.

name: reasoning
trans: n. 运用思考、理解、推想等能力的做法或过程;推理
example: They slapped his face, wrung his ears, pulled his hair, made him stand on one leg, refused him leave to urinate, shone glaring lights in his face until his eyes ran with water; but the aim of this was simply to humiliate him and destroy his power of arguing and reasoning.

name: merciless
trans: 残忍的；无慈悲心的
example: Their real weapon was the merciless questioning that went on and on, hour after hour, tripping him up, laying traps for him, twisting everything that he said, convicting him at every step of lies and self-contradiction until he began weeping as much from shame as from nervous fatigue.

name: tripping
trans: n. 旅行，远足v. 绊倒；失足；犯错
example: Their real weapon was the merciless questioning that went on and on, hour after hour, tripping him up, laying traps for him, twisting everything that he said, convicting him at every step of lies and self-contradiction until he began weeping as much from shame as from nervous fatigue.

name: traps
trans: n. 陷阱;圈套;双轮轻便马车
