name: twisting
trans: n.翘曲，扭曲v.扭，搓，缠绕（ twist的现在分词 ）adj.缠绕的,曲折的,转动的
example: Their real weapon was the merciless questioning that went on and on, hour after hour, tripping him up, laying traps for him, twisting everything that he said, convicting him at every step of lies and self-contradiction until he began weeping as much from shame as from nervous fatigue.

name: convicting
trans: n.罪犯
example: Their real weapon was the merciless questioning that went on and on, hour after hour, tripping him up, laying traps for him, twisting everything that he said, convicting him at every step of lies and self-contradiction until he began weeping as much from shame as from nervous fatigue.

name: weeping
trans: adj.树枝低垂的v.（通常因悲伤）哭泣( weep的现在分词 ),流泪,悲哀,哀悼
example: Their real weapon was the merciless questioning that went on and on, hour after hour, tripping him up, laying traps for him, twisting everything that he said, convicting him at every step of lies and self-contradiction until he began weeping as much from shame as from nervous fatigue.

name: shame
trans: n. 羞耻，耻辱；可耻的人(或事物)v. 使羞愧
example: Their real weapon was the merciless questioning that went on and on, hour after hour, tripping him up, laying traps for him, twisting everything that he said, convicting him at every step of lies and self-contradiction until he began weeping as much from shame as from nervous fatigue.

name: weep
trans: v. 哭泣，流泪；滴下n. 哭泣
example: Sometimes he would weep half a dozen times in a single session.

name: session
trans: n. 一段时间;开庭,开庭期;学期
example: Sometimes he would weep half a dozen times in a single session.

name: hesitation
trans: n.犹豫，踌躇
example: Most of the time they screamed abuse at him and threatened at every hesitation to deliver him over to the guards again; but sometimes they would suddenly change their tune, call him comrade, appeal to him in the name of Ingsoc and Big Brother, and ask him sorrowfully whether even now he had not enough loyalty to the Party left to make him wish to undo the evil he had done.

name: sorrowfully
trans: a.使人伤心的；悲伤的
example: Most of the time they screamed abuse at him and threatened at every hesitation to deliver him over to the guards again; but sometimes they would suddenly change their tune, call him comrade, appeal to him in the name of Ingsoc and Big Brother, and ask him sorrowfully whether even now he had not enough loyalty to the Party left to make him wish to undo the evil he had done.

name: nerves
trans: n. 神经；勇敢，胆量
example: When his nerves were in rags after hours of questioning, even this appeal could reduce him to snivelling tears.

name: rags
trans: 破布
example: When his nerves were in rags after hours of questioning, even this appeal could reduce him to snivelling tears.

name: fists
trans: n. 拳头
example: In the end the nagging voices broke him down more completely than the boots and fists of the guards.

name: signed
trans: adj.有符号的，有正负之分的
example: He became simply a mouth that uttered, a hand that signed, whatever was demanded of him.

name: concern
trans: vt. 影响;涉及;忙于;关心;n. 所关切的事;企业;关心
example: His sole concern was to find out what they wanted him to confess, and then confess it quickly, before the bullying started anew.

name: bullying
trans: n. 凌霸，恃强欺弱的行为
example: His sole concern was to find out what they wanted him to confess, and then confess it quickly, before the bullying started anew.

name: anew
trans: 重新；再
example: His sole concern was to find out what they wanted him to confess, and then confess it quickly, before the bullying started anew.

name: assassination
trans: n. 暗杀
example: He confessed to the assassination of eminent Party members, the distribution of seditious pamphlets, embezzlement of public funds, sale of military secrets, sabotage of every kind.

name: eminent
trans: a. 著名的,卓越的
example: He confessed to the assassination of eminent Party members, the distribution of seditious pamphlets, embezzlement of public funds, sale of military secrets, sabotage of every kind.

name: seditious
trans: 煽动性的，意在制造混乱的
example: He confessed to the assassination of eminent Party members, the distribution of seditious pamphlets, embezzlement of public funds, sale of military secrets, sabotage of every kind.

name: sale
trans: n. 出售，上市；贱卖，廉价出售；销售额
example: He confessed to the assassination of eminent Party members, the distribution of seditious pamphlets, embezzlement of public funds, sale of military secrets, sabotage of every kind.

name: Eastasian
example: He confessed that he had been a spy in the pay of the Eastasian government as far back as 1968.

name: believer
trans: n. 信徒；相信……者
example: He confessed that he was a religious believer, an admirer of capitalism, and a sexual pervert.

name: admirer
trans: n.赞赏者,羡慕者,崇拜者,（女子的）爱慕者
example: He confessed that he was a religious believer, an admirer of capitalism, and a sexual pervert.

name: pervert
trans: v.反常。
example: He confessed that he was a religious believer, an admirer of capitalism, and a sexual pervert.

name: murdered
trans: v.糟蹋( murder的过去式和过去分词 ),（尤指在团队运动中）彻底打败,打垮
example: He confessed that he had murdered his wife, although he knew, and his questioners must have known, that his wife was still alive.

name: personal
trans: a. 个人的，私人的；亲自的；身体的，人身的
example: He confessed that for years he had been in personal touch with Goldstein and had been a member of an underground organization which had included almost every human being he had ever known.

name: easier
example: It was easier to confess everything and implicate everybody.

name: Besides
trans: ad. 此外；并且prep. 于…之外；除…以外
example: Besides, in a sense it was all true.

name: deed
trans: n. 行为，行动；功绩，事迹；证书；契据
example: It was true that he had been the enemy of the Party, and in the eyes of the Party there was no distinction between the thought and the deed.

name: memories
trans: n. 记忆（memory的复数）；回忆
example: There were also memories of another kind.

name: disconnectedly
example: They stood out in his mind disconnectedly, like pictures with blackness all round them.

name: pair
trans: n. 一对，一双；一副；夫妇v. 配对，成对
example: He was in a cell which might have been either dark or light, because he could see nothing except a pair of eyes.

name: Near
trans: a. 近的，接近的；亲近的prep. 靠近ad. 接近
example: Near at hand some kind of instrument was ticking slowly and regularly.

name: luminous
trans: a.发光的；光明的
example: The eyes grew larger and more luminous.

name: dived
trans: v./n. 潜水，跳水，俯冲
example: Suddenly he floated out of his seat, dived into the eyes, and was swallowed up.

name: dials
trans: n. 表面,钟面,拨号盘 vt. 打电话
example: He was strapped into a chair surrounded by dials, under dazzling lights.

name: dazzling
trans: adj.令人目眩的
example: He was strapped into a chair surrounded by dials, under dazzling lights.

name: dials
trans: n. 表面,钟面,拨号盘 vt. 打电话
example: A man in a white coat was reading the dials.

name: tramp
trans: v. 徒步远行;长途跋涉
example: There was a tramp of heavy boots outside.

name: waxed
trans: vt.给…打蜡，给…上蜡（wax的过去式与过去分词形式）
example: The waxed-faced officer marched in, followed by two guards.

name: coat
trans: n. 上衣，外套；表皮；层，覆盖物v. 涂(盖)上
example: The man in the white coat did not turn round.

name: dials
trans: n. 表面,钟面,拨号盘 vt. 打电话
example: He did not look at Winston either; he was looking only at the dials.

name: golden
trans: a. 金黄色的；贵重的，极好的
example: He was rolling down a mighty corridor, a kilometre wide, full of glorious, golden light, roaring with laughter and shouting out confessions at the top of his voice.

name: confessing
trans: v. 供认，承认，坦白，忏悔
example: He was confessing everything, even the things he had succeeded in holding back under the torture.

name: relating
trans: v. 叙述，讲述；使互相关联
example: He was relating the entire history of his life to an audience who knew it already.

name: coats
trans: n. 上衣，外套；表皮；层，覆盖物v. 涂(盖)上
example: With him were the guards, the other questioners, the men in white coats, O'Brien, Julia, Mr Charrington, all rolling down the corridor together and shouting with laughter.

name: lain
example: Some dreadful thing which had lain embedded in the future had somehow been skipped over and had not happened.

name: skipped
trans: n./v. 跳,遗漏
example: Some dreadful thing which had lain embedded in the future had somehow been skipped over and had not happened.

name: forgiven
trans: v. 原谅,宽恕
example: Everything was all right, there was no more pain, the last detail of his life was laid bare, understood, forgiven.

name: plank
trans: n.厚木板, 支架, (政党的)政纲条款。vt.铺板, 立刻付款。vi.睡在板上
example: He was starting up from the plank bed in the half-certainty that he had heard O'Brien's voice.

name: interrogation
trans: n.讯问,审问,疑问句
example: All through his interrogation, although he had never seen him, he had had the feeling that O'Brien was at his elbow, just out of sight.

name: directing
trans: a./ad. 径直的(地)v. 管理，指导；(at，to)指向
example: It was O'Brien who was directing everything.

name: prevented
trans: v. (from)预防，防止，阻止，制止，妨碍
example: It was he who set the guards on to Winston and who prevented them from killing him.

name: scream
trans: v./n. 尖声叫，喊叫着说出，(风)呼啸
example: It was he who decided when Winston should scream with pain, when he should have a respite, when he should be fed, when he should sleep, when the drugs should be pumped into his arm.

name: respite
trans: 间歇，休息
example: It was he who decided when Winston should scream with pain, when he should have a respite, when he should be fed, when he should sleep, when the drugs should be pumped into his arm.

name: pumped
trans: adj. （肌肉由于过度运动）肿胀的；喘得上气不接下气的；腐心的
v. 用泵送；汲取；使喘不过气来（pump的过去分词）
example: It was he who decided when Winston should scream with pain, when he should have a respite, when he should be fed, when he should sleep, when the drugs should be pumped into his arm.

name: answers
trans: vt. 回答，答复，答案v. 回答，答复，响应
example: It was he who asked the questions and suggested the answers.

name: tormentor
example: He was the tormentor, he was the protector, he was the inquisitor, he was the friend.

name: drugged
trans: n. 药物；麻醉品；毒品；滞销货v. 下麻药；吸毒
example: And once--Winston could not remember whether it was in drugged sleep, or in normal sleep, or even in a moment of wakefulness--a voice murmured in his ear: 'Don't worry, Winston; you are in my keeping.

name: wakefulness
trans: n. [生理] 觉醒；不眠
example: And once--Winston could not remember whether it was in drugged sleep, or in normal sleep, or even in a moment of wakefulness--a voice murmured in his ear: 'Don't worry, Winston; you are in my keeping.

name: watched
trans: v. 观看；看守；(for)窥伺，等待n. 看管；表
example: For seven years I have watched over you.

name: turning
trans: n.旋转；变向；转弯处
example: Now the turning-point has come.

name: perfect
trans: a. 完善的；完全的；(语法)完成的v. 使完美
example: I shall save you, I shall make you perfect.

name: darkness
trans: n.黑暗
example: ' He was not sure whether it was O'Brien's voice; but it was the same voice that had said to him, 'We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness,' in that other dream, seven years ago.

name: ending
trans: n. 结尾，结局
example: He did not remember any ending to his interrogation.

name: materialized
trans: v.使具体化，物质化
example: There was a period of blackness and then the cell, or room, in which he now was had gradually materialized round him.

name: unable
trans: a.不能的，不会的
example: He was almost flat on his back, and unable to move.

name: essential
trans: n./a. 本质(的),必要(的)
example: His body was held down at every essential point.

name: gripped
trans: v./n. 紧握,抓紧,握力;柄;吸引
example: Even the back of his head was gripped in some manner.

name: gravely
trans: ad
v. 严肃地,庄重地严重地沉重地,阴郁地
example: O'Brien was looking down at him gravely and rather sadly.

name: pouches
trans: 小袋；育儿袋；烟草袋
成袋状
example: His face, seen from below, looked coarse and worn, with pouches under the eyes and tired lines from nose to chin.

name: eight
trans: num. 八pron. 八(个，只…)
example: He was older than Winston had thought him; he was perhaps forty-eight or fifty.

name: Under
trans: prep. 在…下面在…以下ad. 在下面；少于
example: Under his hand there was a dial with a lever on top and figures running round the face.

name: dial
trans: n. 表面,钟面,拨号盘 vt. 打电话
example: Under his hand there was a dial with a lever on top and figures running round the face.

name: lever
trans: n. 杆,杠杆;施加影响的手段;vt. 用杠杆移动
example: Under his hand there was a dial with a lever on top and figures running round the face.

name: met
trans: n. 会，集会v. 遇见；会谈；迎接；满足；符合
example: 'I told you,' said O'Brien, 'that if we met again it would be here.

name: Yes
trans: ad. 是[用于肯定句前
example: ' 'Yes,' said Winston.

name: slight
trans: a. 轻微的,不足道的;纤细的,瘦弱的;vt./n. 轻视,藐视
example: Without any warning except a slight movement of O'Brien's hand, a wave of pain flooded his body.

name: mortal
trans: a. 必有一死的;致命的;极端的,极大的;n. 致命性,死亡数,死亡率;人类
example: It was a frightening pain, because he could not see what was happening, and he had the feeling that some mortal injury was being done to him.

name: injury
trans: n. 伤害，损害
example: It was a frightening pain, because he could not see what was happening, and he had the feeling that some mortal injury was being done to him.

name: electrically
trans: adv.用电力，有关电地
example: He did not know whether the thing was really happening, or whether the effect was electrically produced; but his body was being wrenched out of shape, the joints were being slowly torn apart.

name: backbone
trans: n.脊梁骨
example: Although the pain had brought the sweat out on his forehead, the worst of all was the fear that his backbone was about to snap.

name: breathed
trans: n. 呼吸，气息
example: He set his teeth and breathed hard through his nose, trying to keep silent as long as possible.

name: afraid
trans: adj. 害怕的，恐惧的；犯愁的，不乐意的
example: 'You are afraid,' said O'Brien, watching his face, 'that in another moment something is going to break.

name: especial
trans: adj.特别的，专门的
example: Your especial fear is that it will be your backbone.

name: vertebrae
example: You have a vivid mental picture of the vertebrae snapping apart and the spinal fluid dripping out of them.

name: snapping
trans: v. 啪地移动；(使)突然断开，断开(成两截)
example: You have a vivid mental picture of the vertebrae snapping apart and the spinal fluid dripping out of them.

name: spinal
trans: adj. 脊骨的；脊髓的；脊柱的；尖刺的；针的; n. 脊椎麻醉 副 词: spinally
example: You have a vivid mental picture of the vertebrae snapping apart and the spinal fluid dripping out of them.

name: fluid
trans: a. 流动的,不固定的 n. 流体
example: You have a vivid mental picture of the vertebrae snapping apart and the spinal fluid dripping out of them.

name: thinking
trans: n.思想
example: That is what you are thinking, is it not, Winston?

name: answer
trans: vt. 回答，答复，答案v. 回答，答复，响应
example: ' Winston did not answer.

name: drew
trans: v. 拉；画；汲取；引出；(to)挨近n. 平局；拖曳
example: O'Brien drew back the lever on the dial.

name: receded
trans: vi. 后退;向后倾斜
example: The wave of pain receded almost as quickly as it had come.

name: forty
trans: num./a. 四十pron. 四十(个，只…)
example: 'That was forty,' said O'Brien.

name: run
trans: v. 奔，跑；流，淌；蔓延，伸展；经营；运转
example: 'You can see that the numbers on this dial run up to a hundred.

name: Will
trans: aux./v. 将；会；愿意n. 意志；决心；愿望
example: Will you please remember, throughout our conversation, that I have it in my power to inflict pain on you at any moment and to whatever degree I choose?

name: inflict
trans: vt. 使遭受,强加
example: Will you please remember, throughout our conversation, that I have it in my power to inflict pain on you at any moment and to whatever degree I choose?

name: prevaricate
trans: 支吾其词，撒谎

example: He had told them everything he knew about her, her habits, her character, her past life; he had confessed in the most trivial detail everything that had happened at their meetings, all that he had said to her and she to him, their black-market meals, their adulteries, their vague plottings against the Party--everything.

name: plottings
trans: n. 小块土地;阴谋;情节;vt. 绘制,标绘;密谋,策划
example: He had told them everything he knew about her, her habits, her character, her past life; he had confessed in the most trivial detail everything that had happened at their meetings, all that he had said to her and she to him, their black-market meals, their adulteries, their vague plottings against the Party--everything.

name: intended
trans: adj. 故意的，有意的；打算中的
n. 已订婚者
v. 打算；准备（intend的过去分词）

name: loving
trans: 亲爱的；钟情的；忠诚的
(Loving)人名；(英、瑞典)洛文
example: He had not stopped loving her; his feelings towards her had remained the same.

name: explanation
trans: n. 解释，说明
example: O'Brien had seen what he meant without the need for explanation.

name: Tell
trans: vt. 告诉，讲述；告诫；吩咐，命令；辨/区别
example: 'Tell me,' he said, 'how soon will they shoot me?

name: long
trans: a. 长的，长时间的，长期的ad. 长久，长期地
example: ' 'It might be a long time,' said O'Brien.

name: difficult
trans: a. 困难的，艰难的
example: 'You are a difficult case.

name: hope
trans: n. 希望，期望；希望的人或事v. 希望，期望
example: But don't give up hope.

name: cured
trans: v. 治愈;加工处理;n. 治愈,疗法;对策
example: Everyone is cured sooner or later.

name: shoot
trans: v. 发射；掠过，疾驰而过n. 嫩枝，苗，射击
example: In the end we shall shoot you.

name: Chapter
trans: n. 章；回，篇
example: ' Chapter 4 He was much better.

name: fatter
trans: a. 多脂肪的，肥胖的；丰厚的n. 脂肪，肥肉
example: He was growing fatter and stronger every day, if it was proper to speak of days.

name: comfortable
trans: a. 舒适的，舒服的；感到舒适的，安逸的
example: The white light and the humming sound were the same as ever, but the cell was a little more comfortable than the others he had been in.

name: mattress
trans: n.床垫
example: There was a pillow and a mattress on the plank bed, and a stool to sit on.

name: wash
trans: n. 洗；洗的衣物vt. 冲刷，洗；冲出vi. 洗澡
example: They had given him a bath, and they allowed him to wash himself fairly frequently in a tin basin.

name: wash
trans: n. 洗；洗的衣物vt. 冲刷，洗；冲出vi. 洗澡
example: They even gave him warm water to wash with.

name: underclothes
example: They had given him new underclothes and a clean suit of overalls.

name: soothing
trans: adj.慰藉的,使人宽心的,镇静的v.安慰( soothe的现在分词 ),抚慰,使舒服,减轻痛苦
example: They had dressed his varicose ulcer with soothing ointment.

name: ointment
trans: 药膏；[药] 油膏
example: They had dressed his varicose ulcer with soothing ointment.

name: dentures
trans: 假牙
example: They had pulled out the remnants of his teeth and given him a new set of dentures.

name: Weeks
trans: n. 星期，周
example: Weeks or months must have passed.

name: regular
trans: a. 有规律的；整齐的，匀称的，正规的，正式的
example: It would have been possible now to keep count of the passage of time, if he had felt any interest in doing so, since he was being fed at what appeared to be regular intervals.

name: dimly
trans: adv.昏暗地，朦胧地，模糊地,依稀,影影绰绰,隐隐约约
example: He was getting, he judged, three meals in the twenty-four hours; sometimes he wondered dimly whether he was getting them by night or by day.

name: meat
trans: n. (食用)肉类
example: The food was surprisingly good, with meat at every third meal.

name: Once
trans: ad. 一次，曾经conj. 一(旦)…就…n. 一次
example: Once there was even a packet of cigarettes.

name: matches
trans: n. 火柴；比赛（match的复数）
v. 匹敌；匹配（match的第三人称单数形式）
example: He had no matches, but the never-speaking guard who brought his food would give him a light.

name: persevered
trans: vi. 锲而不舍
example: The first time he tried to smoke it made him sick, but he persevered, and spun the packet out for a long time, smoking half a cigarette after each meal.

name: slate
trans: n.板岩, 石板, 石片, 蓝色。adj.暗蓝灰色的, 含板岩的。v.铺石板。
example: They had given him a white slate with a stump of pencil tied to the corner.

name: tied
trans: n. 领带；联系，关系，纽带；束缚v. 扎，系，捆
example: They had given him a white slate with a stump of pencil tied to the corner.

name: use
trans: n. 使/应用；用法/途；益/用处vt. 用；消耗
example: At first he made no use of it.

name: torpid
trans: adj. 迟钝的，迟缓的；不活泼的；麻痹的；[生物] 蛰伏的
example: Even when he was awake he was completely torpid.

name: reveries
trans: 幻想；沉思；幻想曲
example: Often he would lie from one meal to the next almost without stirring, sometimes asleep, sometimes waking into vague reveries in which it was too much trouble to open his eyes.

name: sleeping
trans: n.睡眠adj.睡着的,供睡觉用的,不要多事,不要自找麻烦v.为…提供床位( sleep的现在分词 )
example: He had long grown used to sleeping with a strong light on his face.

name: coherent
trans: a. 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
example: It seemed to make no difference, except that one's dreams were more coherent.

name: dreamed
trans: n./v. 梦，梦想，幻想
example: He dreamed a great deal all through this time, and they were always happy dreams.

name: sunlit
trans: adj.阳光照射的,日耀
example: He was in the Golden Country, or he was sitting among enormous glorious, sunlit ruins, with his mother, with Julia, with O'Brien--not doing anything, merely sitting in the sun, talking of peaceful things.

name: mostly
trans: ad. 几乎全部地；主要地，大部分，基本上
example: Such thoughts as he had when he was awake were mostly about his dreams.

name: stimulus
trans: n.刺激物, 促进因素, 刺激, 刺激。
example: He seemed to have lost the power of intellectual effort, now that the stimulus of pain had been removed.

name: distraction
trans: n.分心
example: He was not bored, he had no desire for conversation or distraction.

name: satisfying
trans: adj. 令人满意的,令人满足的
example: Merely to be alone, not to be beaten or questioned, to have enough to eat, and to be clean all over, was completely satisfying.

name: spend
trans: v. 花费；消耗，用尽；度过，消磨
example: By degrees he came to spend less time in sleep, but he still felt no impulse to get off the bed.

name: gathering
trans: n.集会，聚会，聚集
example: All he cared for was to lie quiet and feel the strength gathering in his body.

name: rounder
trans: a. 圆的prep. 围绕ad. 在周围v. 绕行n. (一)回合
example: He would finger himself here and there, trying to make sure that it was not an illusion that his muscles were growing rounder and his skin tauter.

name: tauter
trans: 紧绷的
example: He would finger himself here and there, trying to make sure that it was not an illusion that his muscles were growing rounder and his skin tauter.

name: established
trans: adj.已建立的
example: Finally it was established beyond a doubt that he was growing fatter; his thighs were now definitely thicker than his knees.

name: reluctantly
trans: adv.不情愿地，勉强地
example: After that, reluctantly at first, he began exercising himself regularly.

name: exercising
trans: n. 练习，习题；训练，锻练v. 训练，锻练；行使
example: After that, reluctantly at first, he began exercising himself regularly.

name: measured
trans: 深思熟虑的
example: In a little while he could walk three kilometres, measured by pacing the cell, and his bowed shoulders were growing straighter.

name: pacing
trans: n. (一)步;步速,速度,节奏 vi. 踱步
example: In a little while he could walk three kilometres, measured by pacing the cell, and his bowed shoulders were growing straighter.

name: attempted
trans: — attempted adjectivean attempted robbery/murder/suicide抢劫/谋杀/自杀未遂attempt
example: He attempted more elaborate exercises, and was astonished and humiliated to find what things he could not do.

name: length
trans: n. 长，长度；一段，一节，程度，范围
example: He could not move out of a walk, he could not hold his stool out at arm's length, he could not stand on one leg without falling over.

name: calf
trans: n.小牛，腿肚子
example: He squatted down on his heels, and found that with agonizing pains in thigh and calf he could just lift himself to a standing position.

name: weight
trans: n. 重量；负荷，重担；重要性，分量；砝码，秤砣
example: He lay flat on his belly and tried to lift his weight by his hands.

name: centimetre
trans: n.厘米
example: It was hopeless, he could not raise himself a centimetre.

name: feat
trans: n. 功绩，伟业，技艺
example: But after a few more days--a few more mealtimes--even that feat was accomplished.

name: accomplished
trans: adj. 熟练的，才华高的；娴于社交的；很成功的，非常优秀的；<英>完成的 v. 完成，实现（accomplish 的过去式和过去分词）
example: But after a few more days--a few more mealtimes--even that feat was accomplished.

name: running
trans: adj.连续的,滚开,走开,流动的n.经营,走私
example: A time came when he could do it six times running.

name: cherish
trans: vt. 爱护,抱有(希望);怀有(情感)

name: ruined
trans: adj. 毁灭的；荒废的
v. 毁灭（ruin的变形）
example: Only when he chanced to put his hand on his bald scalp did he remember the seamed, ruined face that had looked back at him out of the mirror.

name: active
trans: adj. 活跃的，敏捷的，积极的；在活动中的
example: His mind grew more active.

name: educating
trans: v. 教育，培养，训练
example: He sat down on the plank bed, his back against the wall and the slate on his knees, and set to work deliberately at the task of re-educating himself.

name: capitulated
trans: vi.有条件投降, 认输, 屈服, 让步, 停止抵抗。
example: He had capitulated, that was agreed.

name: capitulate
trans: vi.有条件投降, 认输, 屈服, 让步, 停止抵抗。
example: In reality, as he saw now, he had been ready to capitulate long before he had taken the decision.

name: frivolity
trans: 轻浮；轻薄；轻率
example: From the moment when he was inside the Ministry of Love--and yes, even during those minutes when he and Julia had stood helpless while the iron voice from the telescreen told them what to do--he had grasped the frivolity, the shallowness of his attempt to set himself up against the power of the Party.

name: shallowness
trans: 浅； 浅薄
example: From the moment when he was inside the Ministry of Love--and yes, even during those minutes when he and Julia had stood helpless while the iron voice from the telescreen told them what to do--he had grasped the frivolity, the shallowness of his attempt to set himself up against the power of the Party.

name: magnifying
trans: adj.放大的v.增加，升高，放大,放大( magnify的现在分词 ),扩大,夸大,夸奖
example: He knew now that for seven years the Thought Police had watched him like a beetle under a magnifying glass.

name: infer
trans: v. 推论，推断

name: speck
trans: 灰尘；污点；小颗粒
使有斑点
example: Even the speck of whitish dust on the cover of his diary they had carefully replaced.

name: shown

name: photographs
trans: n. 照片；逼真的描绘（photograph的复数）
v. 拍照；逼真地描绘；记入脑中（photograph的三单形式）

name: Yes
trans: ad. 是[用于肯定句前

name: fight
trans: v./n. 打(仗)，搏斗，斗争，战斗

name: Besides
trans: ad. 此外；并且prep. 于…之外；除…以外

name: collective
trans: n. 集体a. 集体的，共同的

name: check

name: judgements
trans: n.意见；审判；判断

name: Sanity
trans: n.心智健全。

name: learning
trans: n. 知识，学问；学习
example: It was merely a question of learning to think as they thought.

name: Only
trans: ad. 仅仅，只不过a. 唯一的conj. 可是，不过

name: awkward
trans: a. 难使用的;笨拙的;尴尬的

name: write
trans: v. 写，书写，写字；写作；写信(给)，函告

name: MAKE
trans: n. (产品)来源，制法vt. 制造，做成，准备

name: FIVE
trans: num. 五pron./a. 五(个，只…)

name: shying
trans: a. 怕羞的，腼腆的；胆怯的vi. 惊退，畏缩
example: His mind, as though shying away from something, seemed unable to concentrate.

name: concentrate
trans: v. 集中,全神贯注于,浓缩 n. 浓缩物

name: recall
trans: vt./n. 召回;回忆

name: consciously
trans: adv. 自觉地；有意识地

name: GOD
trans: n. 上帝(小写god泛指所有的“神，神像”)
example: He wrote: GOD IS POWER He accepted everything.

name: alterable
example: The past was alterable.

name: altered
trans: adj.医改变的v.改变，更改( alter的过去式和过去分词 )
example: The past never had been altered.

name: Eastasia
example: Oceania had always been at war with Eastasia.

name: charged
trans: adj.充满感情的,紧张的，可能引起激烈反应的v.填充

name: disproved
trans: v.反驳, 驳斥, 证明...为误。

name: invented
trans: v. 发明，创造；捏造，虚构
example: It had never existed, he had invented it.

name: remembering
trans: v. 记住；(to)转达问候，代…致意，代…问好

name: easy
trans: a. 容易的，不费力的，安逸的，宽裕的
example: How easy it all was!

name: surrender
trans: v./n. 投降,自首;放弃;屈服
example: Only surrender, and everything else followed.

name: struggled
trans: n./v. 斗争，奋斗，努力
example: It was like swimming against a current that swept you backwards however hard you struggled, and then suddenly deciding to turn round and go with the current instead of opposing it.

name: deciding
trans: v.下决心( decide的现在分词 ),（使）决定,解决,裁决
example: It was like swimming against a current that swept you backwards however hard you struggled, and then suddenly deciding to turn round and go with the current instead of opposing it.

name: opposing
trans: adj. 对面的；相对的；反对的
v. 反对（oppose的ing形式）
example: It was like swimming against a current that swept you backwards however hard you struggled, and then suddenly deciding to turn round and go with the current instead of opposing it.

name: predestined
trans: 预先注定
example: Nothing had changed except your own attitude: the predestined thing happened in any case.

name: rebelled
trans: v. 反抗，反叛，起义n. 叛逆者，起义者
example: He hardly knew why he had ever rebelled.

name: Everything
trans: pron. 每件事，一切；最重要的东西

name: Anything
trans: pron. 任何东西(事物)；无论什么东西(事物)

name: Nature
trans: n. 自然界，大自然；性质，本性，天性

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，引力；严肃，庄重
example: The law of gravity was nonsense.

name: bubble
trans: n. 气泡,泡沫
example: 'If I wished,' O'Brien had said, 'I could float off this floor like a soap bubble.

name: worked
trans: n. 工作(量)；作品；[pl.
example: ' Winston worked it out.

name: THINKS
trans: v. 想，思索；认为，以为；想要；料想，预料
example: 'If he THINKS he floats off the floor, and if I simultaneously THINK I see him do it, then the thing happens.

name: floats
trans: n. 浮子,浮标;(游行中的)彩车; v. 漂浮,筹资开办,使(币值)浮动
example: 'If he THINKS he floats off the floor, and if I simultaneously THINK I see him do it, then the thing happens.

name: THINK
trans: v. 想，思索；认为，以为；想要；料想，预料
example: 'If he THINKS he floats off the floor, and if I simultaneously THINK I see him do it, then the thing happens.

name: wreckage
trans: （失事船或飞机等的）残骸；（船只等的）失事
example: ' Suddenly, like a lump of submerged wreckage breaking the surface of water, the thought burst into his mind: 'It doesn't really happen.

name: imagine
trans: v. 想象，设想，料想
example: We imagine it.

name: hallucination
trans: 错觉
example: It is hallucination.

name: instantly
trans: ad.立即，即刻
example: ' He pushed the thought under instantly.

name: fallacy
trans: n.谬误, 谬论。
example: The fallacy was obvious.

name: presupposed
trans: vt. 假定；预料；以…为先决条件
example: It presupposed that somewhere or other, outside oneself, there was a 'real' world where 'real' things happened.

name: how
trans: ad. 1. (表示方法、手段、状态)怎样；如何
example: But how could there be such a world?

name: save
trans: v. 救，拯救；储蓄，贮存；节省
example: What knowledge have we of anything, save through our own minds?

name: happenings
trans: n.事件
example: All happenings are in the mind.

name: truly
trans: ad.真正地；忠实地
example: Whatever happens in all minds, truly happens.

name: disposing
trans: v. 处理,处置,除去;使愿意
example: He had no difficulty in disposing of the fallacy, and he was in no danger of succumbing to it.

name: succumbing
trans: vi.屈服, 屈从, 死。
example: He had no difficulty in disposing of the fallacy, and he was in no danger of succumbing to it.

name: nevertheless
trans: ad. 然而,不过,仍然
example: He realized, nevertheless, that it ought never to have occurred to him.

name: develop
trans: v. 发展，开发，研制；显现，显影；发育，生长
example: The mind should develop a blind spot whenever a dangerous thought presented itself.

name: instinctive
trans: adj.本能的，天性的
example: The process should be automatic, instinctive.

name: CRIMESTOP
example: CRIMESTOP, they called it in Newspeak.

name: crimestop
example: He set to work to exercise himself in crimestop.

name: propositions
trans: n. 主张，建议；陈述，命题
example: He presented himself with propositions--'the Party says the earth is flat', 'the party says that ice is heavier than water'--and trained himself in not seeing or not understanding the arguments that contradicted them.

name: heavier
trans: adj. 更沉重的；更巨大的
example: He presented himself with propositions--'the Party says the earth is flat', 'the party says that ice is heavier than water'--and trained himself in not seeing or not understanding the arguments that contradicted them.

name: easy
trans: a. 容易的，不费力的，安逸的，宽裕的
example: It was not easy.

name: improvisation
trans: n.即兴创作，即兴演说,即兴作品,急就章
example: It needed great powers of reasoning and improvisation.

name: arithmetical
example: The arithmetical problems raised, for instance, by such a statement as 'two and two make five' were beyond his intellectual grasp.

name: athleticism
trans: n.运动竞赛，崇尚运动，竞技热
example: It needed also a sort of athleticism of mind, an ability at one moment to make the most delicate use of logic and at the next to be unconscious of the crudest logical errors.

name: Stupidity
trans: n.愚蠢
example: Stupidity was as necessary as intelligence, and as difficult to attain.

name: attain
trans: v. 获得;达到
example: Stupidity was as necessary as intelligence, and as difficult to attain.

name: shoot
trans: v. 发射；掠过，疾驰而过n. 嫩枝，苗，射击
example: All the while, with one part of his mind, he wondered how soon they would shoot him.

name: depends
trans: v. (on)取决于，依靠，信赖，相信

name: hence
trans: ad. 从此地,从此时,因此
example: It might be ten minutes hence, or ten years.

name: confinement
trans: n.限制
example: They might keep him for years in solitary confinement, they might send him to a labour-camp, they might release him for a while, as they sometimes did.

name: enacted
trans: vt.制定法律, 颁布, 扮演。
example: It was perfectly possible that before he was shot the whole drama of his arrest and interrogation would be enacted all over again.

name: expected
trans: adj. 预期的；预料的
v. 预期；盼望（expect的过去分词）
example: The one certain thing was that death never came at an expected moment.

name: tradition
trans: n. 传统，惯例，传说
example: The tradition--the unspoken tradition: somehow you knew it, though you never heard it said--was that they shot you from behind; always in the back of the head, without warning, as you walked down a corridor from cell to cell.

name: unspoken
trans: adj.未说出口的,无人与之交谈的,没人理睬的,不言而喻的v.取消，撤回( unspeak的过去分词)
example: The tradition--the unspoken tradition: somehow you knew it, though you never heard it said--was that they shot you from behind; always in the back of the head, without warning, as you walked down a corridor from cell to cell.

name: reverie
trans: 幻想；沉思；幻想曲
example: One day--but 'one day' was not the right expression; just as probably it was in the middle of the night: once--he fell into a strange, blissful reverie.

name: bullet
trans: n. 子弹，枪弹
example: He was walking down the corridor, waiting for the bullet.

name: coming
trans: n. 来到；到达
v. 来（come的ing形式）
adj. 即将到来的；接着的；前途有望的
example: He knew that it was coming in another moment.

name: smoothed
trans: a. 光滑的,平稳的 v. 使光滑,使平稳
example: Everything was settled, smoothed out, reconciled.

name: reconciled
trans: vt. 使和解;使复交;调解,调停
example: Everything was settled, smoothed out, reconciled.

name: doubts
trans: n./v. 怀疑，疑虑

name: healthy
trans: a. 健康的，健壮的；有益健康的，卫生的

name: joy
trans: n. 欢乐，喜悦；乐事，乐趣
example: He walked easily, with a joy of movement and with a feeling of walking in sunlight.

name: sunlit
trans: adj.阳光照射的,日耀
example: He was not any longer in the narrow white corridors in the Ministry of Love, he was in the enormous sunlit passage, a kilometre wide, down which he had seemed to walk in the delirium induced by drugs.

name: cropped
trans: adj.裁切不正的
example: He was in the Golden Country, following the foot-track across the old rabbit-cropped pasture.

name: springy
example: He could feel the short springy turf under his feet and the gentle sunshine on his face.

name: willows
trans: 柳，柳木
example: At the edge of the field were the elm trees, faintly stirring, and somewhere beyond that was the stream where the dace lay in the green pools under the willows.

name: shock
trans: n./vt. (使)震惊
example: Suddenly he started up with a shock of horror.

name: backbone
trans: n.脊梁骨

name: aloud
trans: adv. 出声地，大声地

name: Julia
example: Julia!

name: love
trans: n. 爱，爱情，喜欢vt. 爱，热爱；爱好，喜欢
example: Julia, my love!

name: hallucination
trans: 错觉
example: ' For a moment he had had an overwhelming hallucination of her presence.

name: inside
trans: a. 里面的ad. 在里面n. 内部prep. 在…里
example: She had seemed to be not merely with him, but inside him.

name: texture
trans: n.(织品的)质地, (木材, 岩石等的)纹理, (皮肤)肌理, (文艺作品)结构。
example: It was as though she had got into the texture of his skin.

name: loved
trans: v.爱，热爱( love的过去式和过去分词 ),喜爱,喜好,喜欢
example: In that moment he had loved her far more than he had ever done when they were together and free.

name: Also
trans: ad. 而且(也)，此外(还)；同样地

name: compose
trans: v. 组成,构成,创作,排字,使安静
example: He lay back on the bed and tried to compose himself.

name: done
trans: 已完成的；做好了的；煮熟的；合乎礼仪的；合乎规矩
表示接受建议
做（do的过去分词）
（西、罗）多内（人名）；（英）多恩（人名）
example: What had he done?

name: servitude
trans: 劳役，奴役；地役权；奴隶状态

name: tramp
trans: v. 徒步远行;长途跋涉

name: outburst
trans: n. （火山、情感等的）爆发；破裂

name: agreement
trans: n. 同意;协议

name: obeyed
trans: v. 服从，顺从

name: conformity
trans: n.遵照，一致

name: retreated
trans: vi./n. 撤退

name: surrendered
trans: v./n. 投降,自首;放弃;屈服

name: preferred
trans: adj.首选的v.提出（请求、控诉等）( prefer的过去式和过去分词 ),提升,建议,选择某事物（而不选择他事物）
example: He knew that he was in the wrong, but he preferred to be in the wrong.

name: understand
trans: v. 懂，理解；获悉，听说；揣测，认为
example: They would understand that--O'Brien would understand it.

name: foolish
trans: a. 愚笨的，愚蠢的

name: start
trans: v. 开始；动身；吃惊；开办，开动n. 开端；惊起

name: take
trans: v. 拿取；吃；记录；取得；花费；捕获；认为

name: familiarize
trans: vt.使熟悉，使通俗化

name: furrows
trans: n.犁沟

name: Besides
trans: ad. 此外；并且prep. 于…之外；除…以外

name: inscrutability

name: features
trans: n./vt. 脸一部分,面貌,特征,特写,故事片;以…为特色

name: perceived
trans: v.感觉( perceive的过去式和过去分词 ),视为,认为,理解为

name: emerge
trans: vi. 出现,浮现,暴露

name: onwards
trans: 向前；在前面

name: cyst
trans: n.医囊肿,囊，泡囊,膀胱,植包囊

name: decide
trans: v. 决定，下决心；解决，裁决
example: One day they would decide to shoot him.

name: beforehand
trans: ad. 预先,事先

name: corridor
trans: n. 走廊，通路
example: It was always from behind, walking down a corridor.

name: Ten
trans: num. 十pron./a. 十(个，只…)
example: Ten seconds would be enough.

name: turn
trans: v./n. (使)转动；(使)旋转；(使)转变n. 机会
example: In that time the world inside him could turn over.

name: camouflage
trans: n. 伪装；隐藏；掩藏; 伪装物；掩饰手段；保护色; vt. & vi. 隐蔽；隐藏；掩藏；掩盖 时 态: camouflaged，camouflaging，camouflages
example: And then suddenly, without a word uttered, without a check in his step, without the changing of a line in his face--suddenly the camouflage would be down and bang!

name: batteries
trans: 电池
example: would go the batteries of his hatred.

name: Hatred
trans: n. 憎恨，憎恶，怨恨
example: Hatred would fill him like an enormous roaring flame.

name: bang
trans: n./v. 猛击,猛敲,砰然作声

name: bullet
trans: n. 子弹，枪弹
example: would go the bullet, too late, or too early.

name: reclaim
trans: vt. 要回;回收;开垦(荒地)
example: They would have blown his brain to pieces before they could reclaim it.

name: unrepented
example: The heretical thought would be unpunished, unrepented, out of their reach for ever.

name: perfection
trans: n. 尽善尽美，完美

name: hating
trans: n. 帽子(一般指有边的帽子)

name: accepting
trans: vt. 接受，领受；认可，同意vi. 同意，认可

name: degrading
trans: vt. 贬低;恶化;分解,降解

name: mutilating
trans: 切断，毁坏；使…残缺不全；使…支离破碎

name: plunge
trans: v./n. 投入,插入;跳水

name: filthiest
trans: n. 污秽,淫猥

name: sickening
trans: 令人厌恶的；患病的

name: Big
trans: a. 大的；重要的；宽宏大量的；大受欢迎的

name: float
trans: n. 浮子,浮标;(游行中的)彩车; v. 漂浮,筹资开办,使(币值)浮动

name: feelings
trans: n. 感情；心情；知觉；同情

name: tramp
trans: v. 徒步远行;长途跋涉

name: swung

name: walked
trans: v. 走，步行，散步；走遍n. 走，步行，散步

name: waxen

trans: v. 获得，得到；使，使得；变得，成为；到达

name: stupid
trans: a. 愚蠢的，迟钝的

name: straighter
trans: a. 直的；整齐的，端正的ad. 直接；正直，直率

trans: vi./n. 看，注视v. 好像，显得n. 外表，脸色

name: gentler
trans: a. 文雅的,有礼貌的

name: improving
trans: n.改进，改善（质量），精炼v.改善，改进，提高( improve的现在分词 ),提高（土地、地产）的价值,利用（机会）,抓紧（时间）

v. 感情上;情绪上;冲动地

trans: vt. 发现,发觉;侦察

name: hate
trans: v. 恨，憎恨；不愿，不喜欢n. 恨，憎恶

name: hate
trans: v. 恨，憎恨；不愿，不喜欢n. 恨，憎恶

name: step

name: required
trans: a.需要的,(rui,kuai,er,de)

name: But
trans: conj. 但是prep. 除…以外ad. 只，才，仅仅
example: ' 'But what is it, what is it?

name: How
trans: ad. 1. (表示方法、手段、状态)怎样；如何
example: How can I do it if I don't know what it is?

name: nearer
trans: a. 近的，接近的；亲近的prep. 靠近ad. 接近
example: ' O'Brien picked up the cage and brought it across to the nearer table.

name: baize
example: He set it down carefully on the baize cloth.

name: ears
trans: n. 耳，耳朵；听力，听觉；穗
example: Winston could hear the blood singing in his ears.

name: loneliness
trans: n.孤独，寂寞

name: drenched
trans: adj. 湿透的；充满的 v. 浸湿；强使服药；覆盖（drench的过去分词）
example: He was in the middle of a great empty plain, a flat desert drenched with sunlight, across which all sounds came to him out of immense distances.

name: immense
trans: a. 广大的,巨大的

name: Yet
trans: ad. 还，尚，仍然；已经conj. 然而ad. 甚至
example: Yet the cage with the rats was not two metres away from him.

name: rats
trans: n. [脊椎] 鼠；卑鄙之人（rat的复数）
v. 捕鼠；出卖（rat的三单形式）
int. 胡说；瞎扯
example: They were enormous rats.

name: grows
trans: v. 生长，成长；渐渐变成；栽培，种植；发展
example: They were at the age when a rat's muzzle grows blunt and fierce and his fur brown instead of grey.

name: fur
trans: n. 毛，毛皮
example: They were at the age when a rat's muzzle grows blunt and fierce and his fur brown instead of grey.

name: carnivorous
trans: 食肉的
example: 'The rat,' said O'Brien, still addressing his invisible audience, 'although a rodent, is carnivorous.

name: aware
trans: a. 知道的,意识的
example: You are aware of that.

name: town
trans: n. 市镇；市民；城市商业区，闹市区
example: You will have heard of the things that happen in the poor quarters of this town.

name: dare
trans: v.敢，挑战，竟敢
example: In some streets a woman dare not leave her baby alone in the house, even for five minutes.

name: attack
trans: n./vt. 攻击,非难,疾病发作

name: Within
trans: prep. 在…里面，在…以内ad. 在内
example: Within quite a small time they will strip it to the bones.

name: sick
trans: a. 有病的，患病的；恶心的，想吐的

name: astonishing
trans: adj. 使人吃惊的,惊人的ad
v. 令人惊讶地,惊人地
example: They show astonishing intelligence in knowing when a human being is helpless.

name: squeals
trans: v.长声尖叫, 告密, 抱怨, 激烈抗议。n.长而尖的声音。
example: ' There was an outburst of squeals from the cage.

name: reach
trans: v. 抵达；(out)伸手，够到n. 能达到的范围
example: It seemed to reach Winston from far away.

name: partition
trans: n.分开，分割；融墙

name: groan
trans: v./n. 呻吟,呻吟着表示;承受重压发出的声音

name: outside
trans: ad. 向外面n. 外部a. 外部的prep. 在…外

name: cage
trans: n. 鸟笼

name: click
trans: v.发出滴答声。n.滴答声。

name: frantic
trans: adj.狂乱的, 疯狂的。

name: immovably

name: nearer
trans: a. 近的，接近的；亲近的prep. 靠近ad. 接近

name: metre
trans: n.米，公尺

name: lever
trans: n. 杆,杠杆;施加影响的手段;vt. 用杠杆移动

name: construction
trans: n. 建造，构造；建筑物，结构；释义，解释

name: exit
trans: n. 出口，通道

name: slide
trans: n. 滑;幻灯片;v. 滑动

name: brutes
trans: n.禽兽，畜生

name: leap
trans: v. 扑向,欣然接受;n. 跳,跃

name: leap
trans: v. 扑向,欣然接受;n. 跳,跃
example: They will leap on to your face and bore straight into it.

name: attack
trans: n./vt. 攻击,非难,疾病发作
example: Sometimes they attack the eyes first.

name: devour
trans: vt. 狼吞虎咽地吃;挥霍,耗尽

name: closing
trans: adj.结尾的,结束的n.终结,结尾辞v.close（关闭）的现在分词形式
example: ' The cage was nearer; it was closing in.

name: succession
trans: n. 连续,继续;一连串;继承权

name: shrill
trans: a.尖声的vt.尖声地叫

name: furiously
trans: adv.狂怒地,狂暴地，猛烈地,气势汹汹,怒冲冲

name: split
trans: vt./vi. 劈开,使裂开;分离

name: foul
trans: a. 恶臭的;邪恶的;暴风雨的;n. (体育)犯规;v. 弄脏,玷污;(使)缠结,犯规
example: Suddenly the foul musty odour of the brutes struck his nostrils.

name: musty
trans: adj.发霉的,陈腐的,乏味的,陈旧的
example: Suddenly the foul musty odour of the brutes struck his nostrils.

name: convulsion
trans: 骚乱
example: There was a violent convulsion of nausea inside him, and he almost lost consciousness.

name: nausea
trans: n. 恶心,晕船;vt. 使恶心
example: There was a violent convulsion of nausea inside him, and he almost lost consciousness.

name: Everything
trans: pron. 每件事，一切；最重要的东西

name: insane
trans: a. 疯狂的,愚蠢的

name: clutching
trans: v. 抓住,攫住;n. 抓,攫,控制;离合器

name: save
trans: v. 救，拯救；储蓄，贮存；节省

name: interpose
trans: 提出（异议等）；使插入；使干涉

name: BODY
trans: n. 身体，本体；主体；尸体；物体；(一)群，批，堆
example: He must interpose another human being, the BODY of another human being, between himself and the rats.

name: circle
trans: n. 圆，圆周；集团；周期，循环v. 环绕，旋转

name: spans
trans: n. 一段时间;跨距,跨度;vt. 持续,贯穿,包括;横跨,跨越

name: rats
trans: n. [脊椎] 鼠；卑鄙之人（rat的复数）
v. 捕鼠；出卖（rat的三单形式）
int. 胡说；瞎扯
example: The rats knew what was coming now.

name: scaly
trans: adj.鱼鳞状的

name: sewers
trans: n.下水道, 缝具, 缝纫者。

name: bars
trans: n. 棍,闩,酒吧,障碍,条 vt. 闩门,阻挡,排斥,不准

name: whiskers
trans: n.髯，连鬓胡子

name: Again
trans: ad. 再次，另一次；重新；除此，再，更，还

name: mindless
trans: adj.愚笨的,不小心的,无心的，无意识的,不顾…的

name: Imperial
trans: adj.皇帝的。

name: didactically
example: 'It was a common punishment in Imperial China,' said O'Brien as didactically as ever.

name: closing
trans: adj.结尾的,结束的n.终结,结尾辞v.close（关闭）的现在分词形式

name: brushed
trans: n. 刷(子)，毛刷；画笔v. 刷，擦，掸，拂；掠过

trans: ad. 也，还；太，过于；很，非常

trans: n. 转移,传递;转让证书等;vt. 转让;转业;调任

name: frantically
trans: adv.疯狂地，狂热地

name: Julia
example: 'Do it to Julia!

name: Julia
example: Do it to Julia!

name: Not
trans: ad. 不，不是，不会；没有

name: care
trans: n. 小心；关怀，照料v. (about)关心，介意，计较

name: Tear
trans: n. 眼泪 vi. 撕裂,撕碎,破坏…安宁

name: oceans
trans: n. 海洋

trans: n. 海湾

name: African

name: disquieting

name: Leopoldville

name: excitement
trans: n. 刺激，激动，兴奋

name: dwelt

name: visualized
trans: vt.形象, 形象化, 想象。vi.显现

name: counterpaned

trans: n. 附录,阑尾

name: Principles
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，信念
example: The Principles of Newspeak Newspeak was the official language of Oceania and had been devised to meet the ideological needs of Ingsoc, or English Socialism.

name: devised
trans: vt. 设计,想出
example: The Principles of Newspeak Newspeak was the official language of Oceania and had been devised to meet the ideological needs of Ingsoc, or English Socialism.

name: communication
trans: n. 通讯,交往,交流,传达的消息,交通
example: In the year 1984 there was not as yet anyone who used Newspeak as his sole means of communication, either in speech or writing.

name: TOUR
trans: n. 旅游，旅行；巡回演出/比赛v. 旅游
example: The leading articles in 'The Times' were written in it, but this was a TOUR DE FORCE which could only be carried out by a specialist.

example: The leading articles in 'The Times' were written in it, but this was a TOUR DE FORCE which could only be carried out by a specialist.

name: Standard

example: Meanwhile it gained ground steadily, all Party members tending to use Newspeak words and grammatical constructions more and more in their everyday speech.

example: Meanwhile it gained ground steadily, all Party members tending to use Newspeak words and grammatical constructions more and more in their everyday speech.

name: embodied
example: The version in use in 1984, and embodied in the Ninth and Tenth Editions of the Newspeak Dictionary, was a provisional one, and contained many superfluous words and archaic formations which were due to be suppressed later.

name: perfected
trans: a. 完善的；完全的；(语法)完成的v. 使完美
example: It is with the final, perfected version, as embodied in the Eleventh Edition of the Dictionary, that we are concerned here.

name: medium
trans: n. 媒介,艺术形式;中庸,适中;借以生存之物(或环境);a. 中等的,中庸的
example: The purpose of Newspeak was not only to provide a medium of expression for the world-view and mental habits proper to the devotees of Ingsoc, but to make all other modes of thought impossible.

name: devotees
trans: n.热爱者，迷恋者,皈依者,信徒
example: The purpose of Newspeak was not only to provide a medium of expression for the world-view and mental habits proper to the devotees of Ingsoc, but to make all other modes of thought impossible.

name: diverging
trans: vi.分岔；分歧
example: It was intended that when Newspeak had been adopted once and for all and Oldspeak forgotten, a heretical thought--that is, a thought diverging from the principles of Ingsoc--should be literally unthinkable, at least so far as thought is dependent on words.

name: dependent
trans: a. 依靠的，依赖的，从属的；随…而定的
example: It was intended that when Newspeak had been adopted once and for all and Oldspeak forgotten, a heretical thought--that is, a thought diverging from the principles of Ingsoc--should be literally unthinkable, at least so far as thought is dependent on words.

name: excluding
trans: prep. 除…外, 不包括
example: Its vocabulary was so constructed as to give exact and often very subtle expression to every meaning that a Party member could properly wish to express, while excluding all other meanings and also the possibility of arriving at them by indirect methods.

name: stripping
trans: vt./vi. 剥去,除去;剥夺财产;n. 狭长一片
example: This was done partly by the invention of new words, but chiefly by eliminating undesirable words and by stripping such words as remained of unorthodox meanings, and so far as possible of all secondary meanings whatever.

name: secondary
trans: a. 第二的,中级的,次要的
example: This was done partly by the invention of new words, but chiefly by eliminating undesirable words and by stripping such words as remained of unorthodox meanings, and so far as possible of all secondary meanings whatever.

name: single
trans: a. 单人的；单一的，单个的；未婚的，独身的
example: To give a single example.

name: FREE
trans: a. 自由的；免费的；免税的；空闲的vt. 释放
example: The word FREE still existed in Newspeak, but it could only be used in such statements as 'This dog is free from lice' or 'This field is free from weeds'.

example: It could not be used in its old sense of 'politically free' or 'intellectually free' since political and intellectual freedom no longer existed even as concepts, and were therefore of necessity nameless.

trans: adv.知性上，智力上
example: It could not be used in its old sense of 'politically free' or 'intellectually free' since political and intellectual freedom no longer existed even as concepts, and were therefore of necessity nameless.

name: suppression
trans: n.镇压，压制

name: dispensed

example: Quite apart from the suppression of definitely heretical words, reduction of vocabulary was regarded as an end in itself, and no word that could be dispensed with was allowed to survive.

name: DIMINISH

name: newly
trans: ad
v. 新近;最近

name: distinct
trans: a. 清楚的;不同的,独特的

name: compound

example: Newspeak words were divided into three distinct classes, known as the A vocabulary, the B vocabulary (also called compound words), and the C vocabulary.

name: simpler
trans: adj. 简化的
example: It will be simpler to discuss each class separately, but the grammatical peculiarities of the language can be dealt with in the section devoted to the A vocabulary, since the same rules held good for all three categories.

name: peculiarities

name: VOCABULARY

example: THE A VOCABULARY.

name: riding
trans: n. 骑马；骑术
v. 骑；乘坐（ride的现在分词）
example: The A vocabulary consisted of the words needed for the business of everyday life--for such things as eating, drinking, working, putting on one's clothes, going up and down stairs, riding in vehicles, gardening, cooking, and the like.

name: gardening

name: ambiguities
example: All ambiguities and shades of meaning had been purged out of them.

trans: 断奏，断音
断奏的，断音的
不连贯地

trans: adj.哲学上的
example: It would have been quite impossible to use the A vocabulary for literary purposes or for political or philosophical discussion.

name: purposive

trans: a. 突出的，显著的，杰出的

name: WHEN
trans: ad./pron. 何时；当时conj. 那时；然后；而

example: Any word in the language (in principle this applied even to very abstract words such as IF or WHEN) could be used either as verb, noun, adjective, or adverb.

name: adverb

example: Any word in the language (in principle this applied even to very abstract words such as IF or WHEN) could be used either as verb, noun, adjective, or adverb.

name: variation
trans: n. 变化，变动；变种，变异

trans: n. 思想，思考，思维；意图，打算；想法

name: etymological

name: SPEEDWISE

name: adjectival
example: There was little need for them, since almost any adjectival meaning could be arrived at by adding -FUL to a noun-verb.

name: termination
trans: n.终止，结束
example: None of the now-existing adverbs was retained, except for a very few already ending in -WISE: the -WISE termination was invariable.

常数；不变的东西

name: GOODWISE

example: Thus, for example, UNCOLD meant 'warm', while PLUSCOLD and DOUBLEPLUSCOLD meant, respectively, 'very cold' and 'superlatively cold'.

name: modify
trans: vt. 修改;修饰

name: prepositional

name: BAD

name: inflect

trans: n. 含意，暗示，暗指；牵连
example: The B vocabulary consisted of words which had been deliberately constructed for political purposes: words, that is to say, which not only had in every case a political implication, but were intended to impose a desirable mental attitude upon the person using them.

name: inflect
example: In principle, however, all B words could inflect, and all inflected in exactly the same way.

name: subtilized

name: quoted

name: thoroughly

example: And in addition, only a person thoroughly grounded in Ingsoc could appreciate the full force of the word BELLYFEEL, which implied a blind, enthusiastic acceptance difficult to imagine today; or of the word OLDTHINK, which was inextricably mixed up with the idea of wickedness and decadence.

name: OLDTHINK
example: But the special function of certain Newspeak words, of which OLDTHINK was one, was not so much to express meanings as to destroy them.

name: comprehensive
trans: a. 内容广泛的，总括性的，综合的
example: These words, necessarily few in number, had had their meanings extended until they contained within themselves whole batteries of words which, as they were sufficiently covered by a single comprehensive term, could now be scrapped and forgotten.

name: compilers
trans: n.编译程序(器)
example: The greatest difficulty facing the compilers of the Newspeak Dictionary was not to invent new words, but, having invented them, to make sure what they meant: to make sure, that is to say, what ranges of words they cancelled by their existence.

name: convenience
trans: n. 便利;便利的设施
example: As we have already seen in the case of the word FREE, words which had once borne a heretical meaning were sometimes retained for the sake of convenience, but only with the undesirable meanings purged out of them.

name: Countless
trans: adj.无数的
example: Countless other words such as HONOUR, JUSTICE, MORALITY, INTERNATIONALISM, DEMOCRACY, SCIENCE, and RELIGION had simply ceased to exist.
